Julia tiene como sueño tener su minimarket  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Julia Magaly Briceño M. is 39 and lives in the Esperanza district in the province of Trujillo in the deparment of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through secondary school and has 2 daughters who depend on her economically. Julia has sold groceries for 2 weeks. She started her business of selling clothing 2 years ago and has her business in her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she received from the communal bank, "Nueva Esperanza II", she will purchase products like rice, sugar, noodles, candy, and soft drinks to supply her store. Julia has a dream of having a mini-market to grow her microbusiness.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products like rice, sugar, noodles, candy, and soft drinks to supply her grocery store

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora R. raises pigs for sale. She is 27 years old, married and has one school-age child. She is from the town of Plaridel. Flora has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Flora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Flora is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 33 años, es una madre muy amorosa y cariñosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Mariano de 45 años y a sus 2 hijos Yesenia de 14 y Rolando de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los ahorros que había guardado Marcelina durante 10 años, por fin tienen sus frutos, puesto que con ellos pudo comprar el bus que tanto ansiaba, el cual ahora a brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros Juliaca – Moho (Distrito de Puno). Gracias a esto, sus ganancias han mejorado, ya que anteriormente su única fuente de ingresos era su restaurante, el cual sigue adelante progresando poco a poco. Lo que más le gusta a Marcelina de su nuevo trabajo como cobradora del bus, es que le permite viajar constantemente y disfrutar del paisaje, lleva recién 6 meses en esta actividad y lo más difícil es tener que madrugar para cumplir con los horarios de salida. Sabe que es duro, pero que a la larga le dará muy buenos resultados, espera que en el futuro pueda comprar otro bus y salir adelante más rápido. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo, si no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en el cual es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un televisor nuevo para el bus, para que los pasajeros puedan distraerse durante el viaje.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 33 years old and a loving and caring mother. She lives in her own house with her 45-year-old husband Mariano and her two children, Yesenia (14) and Rolando (3), who are the inspiration for all their efforts. The savings Marcelina has accrued over the past 10 years have finally paid off, now that they can purchase the bus that they have always longed to buy, which now provides transportation service to passengers from Juliaca to Moho (in the Puno district). Thanks to this, their earnings have increased, since their only previous source of income was their restaurant, which has been growing little by little. What Marcelina enjoys most from her new job as a bus conductor is that it lets her travel constantly and enjoy the trip. She has spent 6 months at this job and the most difficult aspect for her is waking up early to follow the bus schedule. She knows this job is hard work, but will bring her good results in the long run. She hopes to buy another bus in the future and move forward even faster. This is Marcelina's second loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments on time so as not to cause problems for the other members of her loan group. She will use this loan to buy a new TV for her bus, so that passengers will be better able to relax during their trip.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a TV for her bus service

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice operates a printing business in the busy, densely-populated area of Nairobi. She has two little girls who are both in school.  Beatrice started this business in 2006, and has developed it to its current level. Her main focus is printing DVD cases. Due to rapid expansion, she has requested a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to satisfy the increased demand.

loans.use: To purchase more printing paper

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn L. is from the village of Lao Sta. Cruz. She is 31 years old. Analyn is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Analyn has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Analyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Analyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business of harvesting and selling fish

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mrs. Dina K., 27, and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Sann, 35, live along national road number one about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The eldest son is in primary school and the youngest one is still young. 

Dina has been selling roasted fish for 10 years. Her husband has been a construction constructor for almost 12 years. He has his own motorbike and hopes to supplement his existing business by driving Tuk Tuk taxi. Through this new business he will be able to generate extra income to support his family. Dina is applying for her first loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to attach with the motorbike for her husband to drive Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to attach with a motorbike for her husband to drive Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua started her fish business fifteen years-ago in a community market where she lives. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty fish and for that reason she is well-liked by many. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

Akosua is a 50 year-old divorcee and mother of four children, all currently in school. She uses her business proceeds to support her children: buying them food, and paying school and medical bills. She requires a loan to buy more stock of assorted fish, so as to increase sales to support her children's education and grow her business. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy stock of smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Geidy

texts.es: Geidy es una mujer activa y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 25 años y madre de un niño, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y prendas de vestir, su esposo le apoya en lo que se propone, él trabaja en un hospital. Es socia del Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, desde hace tres años. El primer préstamo fue de 300 soles lo cual invirtió en perfumes  para vender, en la actualidad necesita un crédito de 3000 soles que será invertido para comprar todo tipo de productos de  belleza para luego ofrecer y venderlo. La meta de Geidy es llegar a tener un bazar y seguir creciendo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Geidy is an active, enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 25 years old and is the mother of a child. She sells beauty products and clothing. Her husband supports her in her enterprises; he works in a hospital. She has been a member of the communal bank "La Positiva" for three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in perfumes to sell. Currently she needs a loan of 3,000 soles to buy all types of beauty products so that she can later offer them to the public and sell them. Geidy's goal is to eventually have a shop and to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy all types of beauty products

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. Both of his children attend elementary school. He operates a soft drink shop and sells items like Coke, canned drinks etc. He is also into selling food items such as beans, maize and groundnuts. He has been in this business for ten years now. Through the business, he has managed to buy a plot of land where he wants to build his house rather than renting. He buys his goods from the farming communities in the northern region of Ghana. He wants a loan to increase his working capital so that his dream of buying goods in bulk can be achieved. In this way, he can supply a large number of customers and increase his market size and his profit margin.

loans.use: To buy products in bulk

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger es un joven soltero de 27 años, vive independientemente en una casa alquilada.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia.
De sus padres heredó la responsabilidad y la dedicación a sus cultivos, él siembra café y plátanos en las chacras de sus padres. El trabajo en estos dos productos absorbe todo su tiempo, pero le place dedicarse a ello, sobre todo al café, que le es rentable, por ello cada año  elabora viveros para las plantas, las cuales vende y otra parte siembra con la finalidad de tener cosechas de forma alternada. En sus chacras, Roger trabaja solo, pero en la recolección de café emplea a sus familiares. 
Sus sueños a futuro son de encontrar a una mujer trabajadora que le gusta la chacra, y en comunión triunfar mediante la agricultura.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que muestra mucha gratitud, ya que estos préstamos le dan la oportunidad de trabajar; por ello, recalca su compromiso de cumplir con sus pagos mensuales. El dinero que solicita ahora será utilizado en la compra de fertilizantes, así como en la elaboración de viveros de café.
texts.en:
Roger is a young man who is 27 years of age and single. He inherited the responsibility for the coffee and banana crops on his parents’ farm. Maintaining these two products dominates all of his time, but he enjoys the work, especially the coffee since it is quite profitable. Each year he stocks his nursery with new plants, which are then sold and planted elsewhere by growers looking for alternative crops. In his own fields, Roger works alone but he employs relatives during harvest time.

In the future, he dreams of meeting a hardworking woman who enjoys farming and, as a couple, becoming successful in agriculture.

This is Roger’s second loan with MFP. He is grateful for these loans because they provide him with the opportunity to work. Therefore, he renews his commitment to complete his monthly payments. The money he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers and fund the development of his coffee nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & develop his coffee nursery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This enterpreneur is 23 years old and single. He has 8 years of experience in this business. He established his own shop 6 years ago and has one waiter. Because there are a lot of demands on his work, wants to buy more clay ovens and hire another waiter. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy flour and clay ovens and hire another employee

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha B. is a group leader of four members who all live in Chrouy Chrey village in Kandal province. She is 37 years old and single.

Mrs. Sokha B. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On her plantation she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and this has a bad effect on her crops. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sokha B. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the rice field to make the crop more productive. She will share this loan with the other group members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Buural

texts.en: Buural B. is 51 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs Province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Buural's two oldest sons live and work in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and the youngest son is serving in the national army. The youngest daughter is just two years old and stays home in the care of her mother. Buural has a small shoe-making business with his wife. He and his wife make traditional warm shoes for women and men. They usually sew five to seven pairs of shoes per month and locals like to wear their handcrafted quality shoes. His family also owns an old tractor that Buural uses in the spring and summer in order to earn some extra income for his family. Buural says that all his children except the twp-year-old have already grown up and are building their own lives. He would like to work hard and set aside some money to ensure his two-year-old daughter's future. He has requested a loan to purchase materials needed for making shoes.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for making shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy crops in bulk

loans.name: By God's Grace Group

texts.en:
Emma K., third from right, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. They are residents of Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone where they own small-scale businesses. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva lenders to enable them to expand their businesses.

The 33-year-old group leader is married to a businessman and they have 3 children. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III), the other in JSS I and the youngest is in class I. Emma has been selling rice and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) for 4 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of rice and gallons of palm oil.

(Beneath in the photo is Haja C. who was not present for the group snapshot.)

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Luby

texts.es: La Sra. Luby Ríos C. es comerciante vende ropa nueva ambulante en san pablo, san Cristóbal y san José de la montaña, el dinero los solicita una parte para invertirlo en el negocio y otra para compra materiales para remodelar su casa ya es el decimo crédito con Ceprodel y si le han impacto mucho ya que su negocio a crecido y su casa la mejorado, es casada tiene 3 niños en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Luby she sells new clothing on foot in San Pablo, San Cristóbal, and San José de la Montaña. She is requesting this loan in order to invest in her business. She will also use part of the money to make improvements to her home. This will be her 10th loan through Ceprodel and this has helped her improve her business and her home. She is married and has three young children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose M. is from Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old. Mary Rose is single and has four young children. To make a living, Mary Rose owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Mary Rose has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. (Photo was taken without food product available.)

In 2009, Mary Rose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Rose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Mary Rose is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mary Rose from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Tuv province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a small house which they built themselves. They have been living together in their current home for 10 years. Ganzorig operates a vegetable trading business, and his wife and family help him with his business.

Ganzorig started his business in 2006 with his father, and planted potatoes in 1-2 hectares of their land, carrots in 0.5 hectare of their land, and rutabagas. Ganzorig's father has 5 hectares of land with an irrigation system in Bornuur soum. Ganzorig has steadily grown and expanded his business and has become an experienced vegetable trader. Ganzorig uses Mongolian seeds for his business. However, he has been using the seeds for many years, and the seeds have been spoiling and loosing their quality. Therefore, there is a need to renew the seeds in order to increase their vegetable crop.

Besides the vegetable trading business, he has been planning to enlarge his house and to operate a tire repairing service in his yard. Ganzorig is a very open minded and hardworking person. He says, “I would like to expand my business and increase the crops to improve our family's quality of life.” He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase 2.5 tons of seeds for 1,250,000 tugrugs and also for fuel for his vegetable trading business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, soap, maize flour, rice and kerosene in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy corn, firewood, lime, watermelon, and soy

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou D. est un homme marié de 43 ans et père de 6 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Bamanankin de Ouelessebougou.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment les travaux journaliers auprès des maçons, quelques années à l’aventure et il revient au pays faire le commerce d’articles divers avec la vente de pièces détachées apprise  auprès de son oncle.
Avec une expérience de 4 ans, Monsieur Seydou D. maîtrise  bien son activité dans laquelle il est très sollicité.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle il décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Avec ce  prêt il  compte acheter, des pièces détachées  pour sa boutique sise au grand marché de Ouelessebougou.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).Sa clientèle est composée de plusieurs catégories sociales.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Seydou D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA  qui servira à  agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou D. is a 43-year-old married man and the father of six children.  He lives with his wife and children in the Bamanankin district of Ouelessebougou.  Not having attended school, he soon got started in commercial work, especially daywork with masons, abroad for a few years.  He returned to his home country to work with his uncle doing commerce in a variety of spare parts.  With four years of experience, Seydou has mastered his business and is in high demand.  In order to satisfy his customers, he decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan.  With this loan, he intends to buy some spare parts for his shop located in the big market of Ouelessebougou.  He stocks up in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali).  His customer base is composed of several slices of society. With this loan, Seydou plans on making a monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA that will be used to expand his shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying spare parts

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Mrs. Lynn A. is from the barangay of P-Madanihon, Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Lynn is married and blessed with two children, one at school age and the other still an infant. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a food business, particularly in chicken barbecue and a little eatery. She’s engaged in this kind business for more than three years already and earned approximately 12,000 PHP gross a month from this chicken barbecue and little eatery business.

In 2008, Lynn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lynn is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP as her third loan availment, which will be used to add capital in her existing chicken barbecue and little eatery business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs and savings for future use, especially for her child’s education, loan repayments and possible business expansions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital for her chicken barbecue and little eatery business

loans.name: Bring Ambercourt To Unite Group 3, Jinja

texts.en:
His business started off four years ago in Amber Court market in Jinja. With earnings from his lucrative bar business, 34-year-old O. Timothy has, in many respects, managed to shoulder all his family responsibilities, principally the provision of finances towards his five children’s education. His family’s welfare has also, to a broader extent, improved and so has his marriage.

Timothy’s clientele has been increasing since, a broad hint of his good rapport-building skills. Starting off as a revenue collector was a big springboard to establishing himself in business, in that he used his savings to take root. With all contingencies laid out in case of adversity, and with experience, determination and hard work in tow, Timothy is destined for tides of success in the future.

Though Timothy’s 50,000 shillings a week may seem to be modest, he has nurtured a savings culture that has been vital in seeing his disposable income grow. He wants to buy more crates of beer, sodas and local brew for his business with this loan.He also harbors dreams of significantly expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer, sodas and other local brews

loans.name: Mirtha Hungria

texts.es:
Mirtha de 36 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Ella tiene una tienda de víveres ( las rejas que aparecen en la foto es para la seguridad de la tienda ya que esta dentro de su casa). 

Para poder solventar los gastos familiares ella tuvo que invertir sus ahorros porque su esposo había fallecido y no tenia ingresos para sus hijos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido surtir mas su negocio, Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y aceite para su loca. En el futuro quiere surtir mas su negocio con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 36 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban area that originally consisted of irregular terrain with several hills, streams, and lakes that still exist as remnants of a disappearing ecosystem). She manages a grocery store (the bars that appear in the photo help protect her store since it is inside her home).

In order to cover her family’s expenses, she had to invest her savings because her husband died and she had no income for her two children. With effort, Mirtha was gradually able to increase the inventory of her business. She works from 8am until 7pm every day.

She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, and oil for her store. In the future, she wants to restock her store with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia D. is from the town of Trento. She is 47 years old and is married. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alicia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her fourth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila applied for a loan from Asasah to financially assist her husband with buying a new auto rickshaw for him. She lives with her family in a city called Borewala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan. 

A very talented and caring lady, Jamila owns a clothes-selling business. She purchases clothes from Multan and Lahore (famous for its textiles) and sells them in her native city of Borewala. Her clientele base is her neighborhood. She specifically sells ladies clothes. She has now started selling shawls (worn by women over the shoulders or head) as well. She does this work to make her family’s life easier.
 
Her husband's name is W. A. and he is a driver for a trade. He has driven a rented rickshaw for the last three years. She is hopeful that this investment will prove helpful for her husband’s business. He will be able to drive as much as he wants and increases his income without paying rent.

loans.use: Purchase a new rickshaw for driving

loans.name: Dembagnouma Iv Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Dembagnouma IV  est constitué par dix femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Wobougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ROKIA D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environ 1, 8 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice 75.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The Dembagnouma IV group is composed of 10 married women with an average age of 31, an average of 2 children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Wobougou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their rainy season activities. They grow rice, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. They are on their second seasonal loan and their previous loan was repaid in full. With this new loan, Rokia D. plans on buying fertilizer and small farming equipment, and paying the labor costs involved in maintaining approximately 1.8 hectares of peanuts. The harvested crops are sold in Dioïla to a client base made up of merchants. She hopes to make a profit of 75,000 francs CFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Ma. Nita

texts.en:
Ma. Nita J. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 52 years old. Ma. Nita is married and has 7 children. Her younger children still go to school and she hopes to be able to continue their education. To make a living, Ma. Nita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ma. Nita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years.

Ma. Nita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Nita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ma. Nita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Ma. Nita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda G. is from the village of Barcolan. She is 37 years old. Yolanda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 22000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Lorena Rocio

texts.es:
Lorena es vendedora de productos Yambal (empresa de cosméticos vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras). Vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Paraíso” con caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Cuando su esposo viajo a Venezuela para darle una mejor vida a ella y a su hija se encontró que no tenia oportunidades, entonces ella para tener dinero para su hija tubo que incurrir a distintos trabajos y uno de ellos fue ser vendedora de productos Yambal. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 09h00am todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas y desodorantes para tener mas variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir la casa.
texts.en:
Lorena sells Yanbal products. (Yanbal is a cosmetics company that sells products at low prices to enterprising women). She lives in a hilly periurban zone called “Paraíso” noted for its unpaved streets. When her husband went to Venezuela in an effort to provide her and her daughter a better life he discovered that there were no opportunities there so she had to find ways to earn income for her daughter so she went into various kinds of jobs one of which was a Yanbal saleswoman. She currently works every day starting at 9am. She will use the loan to buy perfumes, creams and deodorants to have a wider variety of products. In the future she’d like to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: To make a living, Felicidad Q. provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. She is 43 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Bagong Tanza. Felicidad has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Felicidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Felicidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to repair her vehicle for better service. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa L. es una mujer casada con 3 hijos en las edades de 21 a 36 años, que elabora con sus  manos artesanías y las vende en su propia miscelánea, actividades que inició  a partir de su creatividad, conocimiento empirico en el oficio y del  mercado que aborda .
Rosa es una mujer muy inteligente que le saca provecho a todos sus conocimientos, por eso en  cada momento elabora el producto de acuerdo a la época,  al mercado y  teniendo en cuenta que le deje utilidades; ella  se adapta rápidamente a los cambios de productos cuando es necesario,  porque es capaz de ajustarse a los requerimientos de su mercado, así ocurrió  cuando fabricaba productos en cerámica y se le complicó la venta por su alta  competitividad  y   ella fue capaz de sostenerse,   aprendiendo  diferentes tipos de manualidades y técnicas,  como las que práctica hoy  que es la de  elaborar muñecos de trapo y arteanias en tela, en su propio taller,  tiene maquina para fabricarlos y un punto de venta en su propia casa, que lo  aprovecha efectivamente porque agregó mercancías  como articulos femeninos, figuras decorativas, adornos de cocina, detalles para el hoga, multiusos con lo que tambien genera utilidades.  
Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con él comprará materias primas e insumos como: telas, caritas, rellenos de algodon y detalles navideños para la venta decembrina. Con su primer crédito aumentó su capital de trabajo, consiguió nuevos clientes y quiere con su credikiva, continuar creciendo especialmente  para lograr su sueño y gran desafío que el de tener un almacén especializado en sus propios productos.
texts.en:
Rosa L. is married and has three children whose ages range from 21 to 36 years.  She makes hand-made crafts that she sells in her own general store.  She began these activities based on her own creativity and self-taught skills in the area and the marketplace.

Rosa is a very intelligent woman who takes full advantage of all her knowledge.  She is always making items according to the season, the market and their profitability.  She adapts quickly to product changes when necessary because she is able to adjust to market requirements.  This is what happened previously when she used to make ceramic items but sales became complicated due to high competition.  She was able to stay in business learning different manual skills and techniques like the ones she practices today making rag dolls and cloth crafts in her own workshop.  She has a machine to manufacture them and a sales point in her own home which she uses quite efficiently in that she added other merchandise like female articles, decorative figures, kitchen decorations, home goods, multiple-use clothing items that also generate profits.

This is her second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that will be used to buy raw materials and ingredients like: fabric, faces, cotton filling and Christmas decorations for the December sales season.  She used her first loan to increase working capital and acquired new customers.  She wants to use her Kiva loan to continue growing especially to reach her dream and great challenge of having a large store specializing in her own products.

loans.use: To buy fabric, faces, cotton filling and Christmas decorations for December sales.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel  se dedica al servicio de chapería quien debe despertar a diario a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para poder ayudar  a la  esposa en quehaceres de la casa para luego poder dedicarse durante el día a su trabajo, es amante de los vehículos pues manifiesta que el es medico de los autos ya que a diario se encuentra manteniendo y reparando vehículos, el dinero que ahora solicita lo necesita para  la compra de mayor material tales como pinturas y otros esto debido a la amplia demanda que tiene, es un cliente ,muy responsable y trabajador, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Miguel works as a panel beater.  He must wake up very early every morning so that he can help his wife with some household chores before he spends the rest of the day at his work.  He loves vehicles and he tells us that he is a 'vehicle doctor' since he spends every day maintaining and repairing vehicles.  The money he is currently requesting is needed to buy more material such as paint owing to the high demand which he has.  He is a very responsible client and hard working.  He is very grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: To buy material for his panel beating business

loans.name: Saleh

texts.ar:
صالح عمره 38 سنة يعمل في محل للزجاج تعهدات زجاج ابواب وشبابيك يعمل فيها منذ اكثر من 17 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يحب عائلته ويريد
لها العيش الكريم يهدف الى تطوير نفسه وتحسين وضع عائلته لم يواجه اي صعوبة في المصلحة الا نقص المادة يسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى 
شراء بضاعة زجاج ولوازم تعهدات لتوسيع المصلحة والاعتماد على الذات يطور بعمله كثيرا لذلك له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه وغيره طموح يتميز بعمله بالجودة
texts.en: Saleh is a 38-year-old husband and father of three who loves his family very much and wants to improve their lives. For the past seventeen years, he has been employed at a shop specializing in window and glass door contracting, with customers comprising of his neighbors and colleagues, among others. The only difficulty he has ever faced in his work has been a lack of financial resources. Accordingly, Saleh is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase glass supplies to further expand his business and become more self-reliant. Saleh is very driven and always produces quality work.

loans.use: To purchase glass supplies for business

loans.name: Monzoto Plus Group

texts.en:
Monzoto Plus is a group of 7 owners of small businesses, chaired by Baruani.  Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Baruani, single, aged 40, operates a general store while taking care of one younger brother. He began his business in 1998. Baruani has used four Hope loans (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) to finance the expanding of his inventory. Due to the high demand in his community, he intends with the next loan to buy more goods for resale in order to meet client demands and generate additional profit. This will help him to achieve his plans to grow the business.  His business brings in a profit of US$110 per week. Baruani’s ambition is to expand his store. He is engaged.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Santa Martha.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15, 13 y 8 años, los  dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en  escuela. El marido fabrica ladrillos.

La señora María es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que junto a su marido se dedican a la dura tarea de fabricar ladrillos que son utilizados en el campo de la construcción, trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 7h30 hasta las 17h00, ellos fabrican los ladrillos y luego los entregan  a los comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar a comprar a todos los fabricantes de la zona.
 
Este crédito es para comprar materia prima para la fabricación de los ladrillos. La señora es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y por las reuniones ya que en ellas se divierte mucho. Sus sueños son tener una casa más grande.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the Santa Martha Communal Bank meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as a type of straw hats that are known both around Ecuador and abroad.

This is where we find Ms. María, who is 38 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage, through which she has had three children, ages 15, 13, and 8 years.  The two older children are in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school.  Her husband makes bricks.

Ms. María is a very hard-working woman who, together with her husband, does the difficult work of making bricks to be used for construction.  They work from Monday to Saturday from 7:30 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  They make the bricks and then bring them to a certain place where merchants come to buy from all of the manufacturers in the area.
 
This loan is for buying raw materials for making the bricks.  Ms. María is a founding member of her communal bank and likes it because of the benefits it offers and because she really enjoys herself at the meetings.  Her dream is to have a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bricks

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Las personas que aparecen en la imagen es la esposa San Juanita López Rodríguez y un yerno.
El señor Manuel Ramírez Q. y su esposa son maestros; con el trascurso de los años tomaron el cargo de directores en una escuela y fue de la manera que a su hijos le dieron una mejor calidad de vida. En este momento ellos desean colocar vitropiso en la sala para dar una mejor vista.
texts.en: The individuals that are photographed here are San Juanita Lopez Rodriguez and her son-in-law. Mr. Manuel R. Q. and his wife are teachers. With time they took over as principal and director of a school, and this is how they have been able to provide their children with a better quality of life. They want to install tile flooring in their living room to improve their comfort.

loans.use: To install tile flooring.

loans.name: Ranjana

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Ranjana P.. She is married and has 2 children aged 14 and 10. In 2010, she established her grocery store. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her shop. In the future, Ranjana plans to lift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop

loans.name: Mel

texts.en:
Mr. Mel S. makes wooden furniture. He is 50 years old and is a resident of Kompong Tom province, Phnom Penh. He has five children: four are married and one is single.

Mr. Mel S. produces over five sets of wooden beds and then sells them to his customers for a profit. Generally, he sells the beds by going door-to-door. His wife helps to be responsible for the family by making rattan cupboards. Mr. Mel S. requests a loan to invest more capital in order to buy more beds to sell. This loan will provide him with additional income for supporting his family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy more beds to sell.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia G. is from the village of Buguac, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old. Verginia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Verginia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green bananas & firewood in the local community. Verginia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Verginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Verginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Verginia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like firewood & bananas. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Verginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like firewood & bananas

location.town: Buguac, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Gloribel

texts.en:
Gloribel M. is from the village of Galas. She is 45 years old, married and has three school-aged children. Gloribel operates a family member's business in the food sector, selling different kinds of food and snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over six months and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2011, Gloribel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gloribel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gloribel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina C. is from the village of Pag-asa, Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Josefina is separated from her spouse and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her  business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, detergents & instant noodles in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Estefania; la socia tiene 46 años de edad casada y tiene 7 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura sembrando papa,maiz,cebada entre otros esta actividad la socia lleva años realizando el cual le va bien ya que mediante esto la socia saca a sus hijos adelante conjuntamente con su esposo trabajan en su chacra para así poder tener más productos que cocechar para ser vendidos en las ferias sabatinas del mercado de Huancaro ubicado por el centro de la ciudad, la socia también está dedicada a su hogar al cuidado de sus hijos y se siente feliz ya que sus hijos son lo más importante que tiene.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, abono y semillas para su chacra.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Estefania is a member of the "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata" community bank which is located in Yuncaypata community, in Cusco province and department.

Estefania is 46 years old, married, and has 7 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and farming.  She grows potatoes, corn, barley and other crops.  Estefania has been in this business for years and it is going very well as, through her work, she is able to get her children ahead in life.  She works on her farm together with her husband so that they can have more products to harvest and sell in the Saturday street markets which take place at Huancaro market, in the city center.  Estefania also looks after her children at home and feels happy since her children are the most important thing she has.

Estefania is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers, manure and seeds for her farm.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is currently in the business of selling clothes. She is 28 years old, married, and has 4 children, all of whom go to school. She has requested a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to build a house for rent in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is 60 years old, married to Irene and the father of three children. He operates a fuel pump at the Gikuni trading center in Kikuyu Township where he sells fuel for domestic use. This is his primary business and he has been doing it for the last three years. 

This is his third loan with KADET and he plans to buy another pump so as to maximize his fuel sales. He hopes, from the returns, to expand his business and give his family a better life.
 
He hopes and desires to operate a petrol service station in future.

loans.use: to buy another fuel pump

loans.name: Edwing

texts.es:
Edwing, 30 años, es un hombre trabajador y bueno, tiene dos hermanos pero solo vive con sus padres Aparicio de 60 y Teodora de 55 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Su vida es significado de esfuerzo, más aún que su razón de progreso y triunfo es su hermana Ana que estudia Gastronomía en la capital; motivo por el cual dejó sus estudios de Teología para apoyarla. Edwing lleva 15 años dedicándose al cultivo de espinaca, zanahoria y habas, las cosecha y las vende en el mercado central de su localidad también viaja dos veces por mes a la capital, donde lo comercializa a los mayoristas, a precios muy buenos que le permiten obtener buenas ganancias. Le gusta atender, regar y fumigar las plantas porque sabe que las hortalizas tiene mayor demanda que otros cultivos. Ahora él quiere incursionar en otros campos como la ganadería, “quiero comprar terrenos para la crianza intensiva”, afirma. Además de dedicarse al trasporte de productos con el camión que tiene, obteniendo así ganancias extras, que le sirven también para poder trasladar sus propios productos. Su mayor prioridad es sembrar y mejorar la calidad de sus productos para poder vender a un mayor precio sus cultivos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde está contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal donde puede compartir sus planes de negocio.
La camioneta de Edwing, está malograda por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará llantas para su repuesto, así como también invertirá en la compra de semilla de espinaca y abono orgánico para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Edwing, 30, is a good, hard working man.  He has two siblings but he only lives with his parents, Aparicio, 60, and Teodora, 55, in his own house located in Palcamayo.

His life is the epitome of effort; more so because his motivation for progress and triumph is his sister, Ana, who is studying Gastronomy in the capital.  He abandoned his Theology studies to support her.

Edwing has been growing spinach, carrots and broad beans for 15 years.  He harvests them and sells them in his locality’s central market.  He also travels twice a month to the capital to sell to wholesalers at very good prices that permit him to have good profits.

He enjoys caring for, watering and fumigating the plants because he knows that leafy green vegetables are in greater demand than other crops.  Now he wants to go into other fields like, cattle raising.  “I want to buy land for intensive cattle raising,” he affirms.  He also has a truck that he uses to transport products thus earning extra income; he can also use it to transport his own products. His main priority is to plant and improve the quality of his products so that he can sell his harvests at a higher price.

He belongs to the “Patrón San Cristóbal” (Patron St. Christopher) communal bank and this is the 8th loan with MFP where he’s happy to belong to the communal bank where he can share his business plans.

Edwing’s truck is in disrepair so he will use the loan to replace the tires.  He will also buy spinach seeds and organic manure for his next planting.

loans.use: to buy tires as well as spinach seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea, 38 years old, is a humble villager living in the province of Kompong Cham. She is married and blessed with two school-aged children, while her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. To earn a living, Mrs. Chea grows crops of rice every year, with which she has had great success. She can plant the crops at least twice a year by following both the rainy and dry seasons. The rainy season is coming now and this would be good for her crops, but she doesn’t have immediate cash to get started with this crop yet. Therefore, Mrs. Chea is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing insecticides, seeds, and fertilizers to produce crops that grow well.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, seeds, and fertilizers to produce crops that grow well.

loans.name: The Help Sisters Group

texts.en:
Musu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Musu was born in Kenema city 36 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has 2 children who are attending primary school. Musu sells cotton cloth, gara lappers (locally dyed cloth), blouses, skirts, baby clothes, etc. 

With the help of this loan, Musu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Musu will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy cotton cloth, gara lappers (locally dyed cloth), blouses, skirts, baby clothes, etc. to add to her business.

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Mosses Y. Bangura, handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy cotton cloth, gara lappers, blouses, skirts, baby clothes, etc. to add to her business

loans.name: San Salvador Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo gracias a la iniciativa de unas vecinas de la ciudad de San Ignacio, fue una reunión de  amigas que al oír del programa mujeres emprendedoras decidieron organizarse para formar un comité. Actualmente el comité denominado San Salvador esta integrado por doce mujeres, las cuales trabajan de forma responsable, unida y solidaria. Todas ellas se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras para que por medio del trabajo conjunto puedan llevar un ingreso a sus casas para la ayuda a su familia.
La Sra luz tiene una pequeña peluquería en la que atiende a todos sus clientes desde hace ya varios años. Ella por medio de su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia para poder darles un sustento digno, sin hacerles faltar lo básico. Ella sueña algún día poder ampliar su pequeña peluquería y así poder atender a mas clientes.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de implemento para su peluquería como ser ruleros, secadores, planchitas, gel y demás. Ella sabe que el credito le sera de mucha utilidad, y por eso tiene sus esperanzas puestas en el prestamos.
texts.en:
The group was formed thanks to the initiative of one of the members from the city of San Ignacio. It was at a friends' gather that she heard about the program for entrepreneurial women that they decided to organize themselves and to form a group. Today, the name of the group is San Salvador and it is made up of twelve women, all of whom work in a responsible, unified, and group-oriented way. They all came together to help each other out so that with a group effort they might earn an income to bring home for the support of their family. 

Luz has a small beauty salon where she has been attending her clients for many years now. It is through her business that she has been able to help her family and to provide them with dignity and support, to provide for their basic needs. She dream of expanding her small hair salon some day to be able to attend more clients. She requests a loan to purchase implements for her salon, such as rolls, dryers, irons, hair gel, and other products. She knows that this loan will be very useful to her and for this reason she has her hopes on getting a loan.

loans.use: to purchase implements for her salon, such as rolls, dryers, irons, hair gel, and other products.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 47 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with four school-aged children.

Edgar is a farmer. He owns and operates a business venture in agriculture. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of his income comes from the raising of sows for producing multiple piglets to sell. He has been engaged in this business for five years. Twice a year, he earns approximately 60,000 PHP (~$1440) doing this type of activity. 

He has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase feeds and an additional sow for raising. Edgar has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business into a large-scale operation and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase feed and an additional sow to raise.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan has a mixed farm in his eastern Kenyan hometown that produces maize, beans and millet. In the farming business for 30 years now and employing two farmhands, he earns additional income from his wood workshop and the carpentry services that he provides to the local market. He is 51 years old, married, and has two children aged 12 and 21.

With this loan of 42,000 Kenyan shillings, Jonathan intends to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale.

His biggest challenges have been an inadequate supply of water and diseases which affect his production. Jonathan plans to expand his dairy farm in the future by acquiring at least five dairy cows and constructing a better zero-grazing unit.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Badenyaton 4 Group

texts.fr:
Composé de neuf membres, les femmes du groupe  BADENYATON 4 sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le village de Farabougou dans la commune rurale de Tesserela dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs productivités par l’utilisation d’engrais, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil, le sésame et le niébé.
Madame Djouma (cliente assise à l’extrême droite avec son bébé) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux sacs d’urée, 50 kg de semence d’arachide, recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de sarclage. Elle se ravitaille en semences à la foire de Gouassola, en main d’œuvre avec les hommes pour les activités de labour et de sarclage. Elle compte produire sur une superficie de 2 hectares : 7 sacs de mil et 10 sacs d’arachide. La production d’arachide est presque vendue alors que le mil est auto-consommé pour aider le chef de famille dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer en vivres.
texts.en:
Most of the nine women who make up the Badenyaton 4 group are married in extended large traditional families.  They are, on average, 39 years old with three children.  They live in the village of Farabougou in the rural commune of Tesserela, which is in Ségou, Mali’s fourth administrative region.  They know each other as neighbors, relatives, and through marriage.

They turned to Soro Yiriwaso hoping to increase their yield by using fertilizers, and they are currently on their second farming loan.  The group’s members will be farming peanuts, millet, sesame and nyebe beans (cowpeas).

Djouma (the client sitting at the far right with her baby) plans on using her loan to purchase two bags of urea and 50 kg of peanut seeds, and to hire workers for plowing and hoeing.  She purchases her supply of seeds at the Gouassola market, and she recruits men to do the plowing and hoeing work.  She expects to produce on 2 hectares (5 acres) of land: 7 bags of millet and 10 bags of peanuts. The peanut harvest is virtually all sold, while the millet goes for her family’s consumption, to help the head of the household cover the household living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase urea and peanut seeds, and to hire workers to help with plowing and hoeing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making "pupusas", as well as sodas and nonperishable goods for her store.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Teresa del Carmen se ha destacado por ser una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo debido a que ha sabido llevar el sustento a su casa y familia y ha logrado mantener a su amada familia en mejores condiciones. Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajadora y con altos valores lo cual ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas en su municipio. 

Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como zinc y perlines para iniciar la mejora del techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa del Carmen is known for being a person who is very dedicated to her work.  Teresa has provided for the welfare of her home and her family.  She has managed to maintain the family that she loves and believes in providing better conditions.  Teresa is known as an excellent worker with good values, thus enabling her to earn the respect of many people around town.  

She came to the CEPRODEL branch in El Sauce to request a loan so that she could improve the condition of her home.  The loan she requested will be used to buy construction materials, such as plywood and crossbeams, in order to repair the roof of her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for repairing the roof of her house.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 49 years old, married to Alice Judith, and he supports a family of three people. He sells charcoal and he has been in business two years. His monthly income from the business is KES 15,000.


This is his second loan with KADET. He repaid his earlier loan successfully. He will use the loan to add more charcoal to the business. He plans to purchase a "matatu" (mini-bus) with the anticipated profit from the business. His dream and hope is to venture into the transport business.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal to his business.

loans.name: Alichon

texts.ru: Аличон умный предприимчивый юноша. На центральном рынке он занимается куплей и продажей парфюмерии. Этим бизнесом он занимается уже год. Аличон имеет лавку, когда он уезжает за товаром, продажей занимается его брат. Так как у него  налаженный бизнес, и в ассортименте имеется парфюмерия разных фирм, поэтому  у него постоянные клиенты. Аличон просит займ в размере 800$ США для  расширения бизнеса и привлечения новых клиентов. Он надеется на понимание и благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Alichon is a smart and enterprising young man. He sells perfumes and body care products at the central city market. He owns a market stall and when he travels to purchase more goods his brother minds the store. Alichon has been managing his store for a year now and the business runs smoothly: he has many different types of perfumes for sale an a lot of regular clients. Alichon is requesting a loan of 800 US dollars to purchase a lot of new perfumes for sale and so to be able to attract new clients. He hopes for your help and thanks you in advance for support.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa has operated as a coconut seller for the past one year. Her potential clients are people around the market area. She faces the major challenge of competition from other operators. 

Nadzuwa is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school, while one is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who helps provide for the family's basic needs. Nadzuwa has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

With this loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, Nadzuwa wants to purchase three sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities which have low interest rates. She dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Fátima De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Fátima es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio su negocio con la producción de nacatamales comida típica que generalmente se hace los fines de semana. En la actualidad también vende ropa de todo tipo de estilos.
Ella con el crédito comprara mercadería para aprovechar la temporada alta que es en diciembre.
texts.en: Fátima is a hardworking, enterprising woman who started her business making Nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales], a traditional food usually consumed on weekends.  At present, she also sells clothes in all styles.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to take advantage of high season which is December.

loans.use: to buy summer seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Marisol Isidora

texts.es: Marisol tiene 39 años de edad es casada y tiene 03 hijos menores de edad. Marisol es cosmetóloga, ella  ofrece sus servicios de corte de cabello, pintado y tratamiento capilar a domicilio, poco a poco Marisol  ha mejorado sus ingresos, es por ello que con los deseos de superarse inició su propio negocio instalando en su vivienda una bodega la cual brinda productos de primera necesidad, es de esta manera como apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. La meta de Marisol es de crecer en su negocio implementándolo, pues de esa manera obtendrá mayores ganancias. Con el crédito que solicito va invertir en su negocio comprar leche, arroz, azúcar, aceite y frutas para así surtir su bodega y de esta manera llegar a fidelizar  a sus clientes. Marisol está muy agradecida con los créditos brindados.
texts.en:
Marisol is 39, married and has three minor children.  She is a beautician, offering her services cutting, tinting and treating hair at home. Gradually Marisol has improved her earnings. It was with the desire to improve herself and help her husband with household expenses that she started her own business, establishing a small grocery store in her home where she sells basic necessities. 

Marisol’s goal is to expand her business by stocking it. In this way she will earn greater profits. She will invest the loan she is requesting in her business, buying milk, rice, sugar, oil and fruit in order to supply her store and thus promote customer loyalty. Marisol is very grateful for the loans she has received.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, sugar, oil and fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, dairy products, groceries, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya is 51 years old and has been working as a banker for 33 years. She is currently a teller in a commercial bank. She lives with her two sons and her husband in a boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

One of Tuya’s sons will be married in January 2012 and she wants to prepare wedding gifts for him, such as a ger, which is a traditional nomadic Mongolian tent that has been used for many thousand years. For Mongolians, this is a most respectful and big gift, especially for new family. 

Tuya is requesting a loan to cover the cost of purchasing a ger for her son’s wedding gift.

loans.use: to purchase a ger as a gift for her son's wedding

loans.name: Aotoa

texts.en:
Aotoa is a 31-year-old woman living in the town of Samata, Uta. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Aotoa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. Her main income comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Aotoa has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,200 WST a month from it.

In 2010, Aotoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and ability to engage in business activities.  Aotoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. The previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  

Aotoa is now requesting a new loan of 1,400 WST which she will use to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones. This will be her second loan from SPBD. She will use the additional revenue that she generates from her business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones

loans.name: Umar

texts.ru: Умар честный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Он занимается скотоводством и начал эту работу 15 лет назад. В начале ему было трудно, его семья поддерживала его и сейчас он успешен в своем деле. Кроме этого он работает в дехканском хозяйстве своего  района. Умар хочет развивать  скотоводство и стать самым успешным в своей деятельностью. Умар просит вас о помощи на расширение его бизнеса и покупки скота. Он надеется, что вы станете причиной его успеха и поможете ему. Спасибо вам большое!
texts.en: Umar is an honest and focused person. He is married and is raising four children. He has been in the cattle-raising business for fifteen years. At the beginning, this was difficult for him, as his family was supporting him. Now he has a successful business. In addition, he works at his district’s dekhan farm. Umar wants to develop his cattle-raising and become the most successful in the business. Umar is asking for your help to expand his business and buy cattle. He hopes that your help will become the reason for his success. Thank you very much!

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana es casada tiene 3 hijos y desde hace siete años vive en una casa de interés social; ella trabaja en una maquiladora de la localidad de lunes a viernes diez horas diarias con descansos de 15, 30, 10  esto para que tome sus alimentos  de esto hace 1 año ya que ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar un empleo para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar; su esposo se dedica a realizar trabajos de plomería, electricidad y albañilería en general y hace un año el no contaba con un ingreso fijo y ese fue el motivo por el cual Ana tuvo que trabajar ellos cuentan con una necesidad en su vivienda ya que la losa que tiene su casa está dañada y requiere de reparación se le trasmina el agua y  siempre hay desechos de la losa tirados en su casa, ella requiere el apoyo para reparar la losa y así poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is married and has three children.  She has been living in government-assisted housing for seven years.  She works at a local factory from Monday to Friday for 10 hours a day and with 15, 30, and 10 minute breaks, which allow her to eat her meals.  She started working there a year ago when she saw she needed to look for a job to help her husband with the expenses of the home.  Her husband does plumbing, electrical, and mason work, and for a year he has not had a steady source of income.  This is why Ana had to work.  Their home's ceiling is damaged and needs to be repaired, because it leaks water, and there is always broken plaster that has fallen down.  She needs the support of a loan to repair the ceiling and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy construction supplies to fix her ceiling

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom lives in bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 31 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Yom heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Francis
