texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, maize, milk, flour, and other household items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy market area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, milk, soap and other items. 

Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will make more profits. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, milk, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en: In Vanadzor city of Lori region lives Nelli and she is 57 years old. Nelli lives here now alone, since her single daughter, who is very clever young girl and she graduated Yerevan State Linguistic University, now she continues her education at the Germany.  Nelli is proud of her and she is sure that her daughter will surely have a lot of success thanks to her cleverness and intelligence. While Nelli in Vanadzor city’s wholesale market at the rented stall is engaged in clothes trading business. At her stall she sells women and children clothes. She has very nice and wide assortment of nice clothes of different sizes and for all the seasons. She has a lot of regular customers who visit her stall already many years. Nelli mentions that she does her best to keep her business since she must financially support her daughter who lives and studies in Europe. Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Nelli asks for the purchase of winter season clothes for her business development, she needs to refresh her last winter clothes assortment as well, making it more attractive for her customers.

loans.use: for the purchase of winter season clothes for her business development, she needs to refresh her last winter clothes assortment as well

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
N. is 23 years old, married have no child but takes care of one girl of a relative and she is in primary school. 

N.`s main activity before joining Umoja women group was bead work and looking after her husband`s cows. When she joined Umoja women group, and was trained on modern livestock management, she decide to start a small steers’ project. She took a loan of USD 118 and bought 2 steers. After 4 months she sold them at Isinya market and got USD 225. This encouraged her and now aims at keeping 8 steers at a go and selling them as they mature to enable her generate income throughout the year. She intends to market at Isinya and Kitengela township. This will assist her take care of her dependant and also her children in future.

loans.use: Nashipae wants to buy two steers which will be fattened and sold in 4-6 month.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel C. owns a rice farm in Salitre, Ecuador. He has been a farmer his whole life in this area, where rice is the primary crop. Angel has livestock on his farm as a secondary source of income. He raises chicken and grows many different fruits for personal consumption and small sales. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to more efficiently plant rice and involve his 3 children in the activities. They are all almost done with school and are interested in taking part in the family business.

Angel is part of the first Communal Bank in the new Mifex Rural Finance Program. All the members of the Resistencia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named Resistencia. They will use the microloans to prepare the land and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Resistencia Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural area in the Province of Guayas which is known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture, which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to rice farming and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year during the rainy season on the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There is not a single financial institution that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The only access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous area despte its rural location. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in the fact that many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding during the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worst when El Niño occurs, the rice farmers lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Prepare his farm for cultivating rice

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en: Mubariz is a local resident of the town of Beylagan. He rents a small place at the local market where he sells clothes. He has been engaged in this since 2005. His is short on capital and decided to apply for a loan from the Normicro Beylagan Branch for the first time. He needs $400 to buy inventory and increase the variety of clothes he sells.  He hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to increase the variety of inventory

loans.name: Flerida

texts.en:
Flerida has a stand where she sells fruit in a local market. She started off with a very small amount of investment capital and with her husband’s help learned the trade quickly. She has been doing this type of work for about 10 years along with her husband.

The most difficult part of this business is offering competitive prices to the customer. In order to do this Flerida requested a loan so that she may purchase her fruits at wholesale quantities and prices. She did very well with her first loan and is hoping to take out a second. She will continue to invest in wholesale fruits in an effort to increae her supply and diversify the fruits she sells.

She and her husband have three children together including one who they are currently putting through college. Her dream is to have all her kids attain a college degree.

loans.use: By her products wholesale

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
I am a mother of six, three boys and three girls. The boys are done with their studies and are currently working . My husband is a driver and works in a school. My eldest son owns a car which he bought on installments. He uses it for taking kids to school in the morning and in the afternoon.

A year back, one of my younger sons started a garment shop but it did not go quite well and soon we had to close it. Now, he also wants to buy a car and wants to start the same work that his elder brother is already doing. He is sure that he will do well with the car and my eldest son has some clients for his younger brother to help him to start his business. I need a loan to help my son buy a car on installments and start his own work.

Farzana R., Lahore.

loans.use: Purchase an automobile

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: There are 6 members of the C. T. family. The grandfather, the father, who is a farmer, and his wife all help out with the wife’s sister’s business. They have two children, who are 12 and 10 years old, who are in the same 7th grade class.  They wish to borrow $75 to invest in a cashew tree that will help to increase and expand their business.  They will pay it back in 5 months time.

loans.use: To plant cashews

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Señora Carmen Rosa is 32-years-old. She lives in Cruz de Pargo, a town in the district of Salpo in the province of Otuzco in La Libertad. She went to school until 6th grade. She has 4 children who depend on her. She started her business with the first credit she received from Manuela Ramos as a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (hard-working women). She received 300 nuevos soles from them (about $100) five years ago. She used to devote herself to housework and helping her husband on their small farm. With this money, she bought cuajada (a yogurt-like product) and took it to Trujillo to sell. This is how she started a grocery store little by little in her community. She still takes cuajada to Trujillo on Wednesdays and Saturdays. This loan from Manuela Ramos of 1,200 nuevos soles (about $403), to be repaid in 4 months, will be used to buy rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and other products to supply her grocery store. Her main goal is to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Carmen Rosa tiene 32 años, ella vive en Cruz de Pargo, Caserío del Distrito de Salpo, Provincia de Otuzco. Departamento La Libertad, estudió hasta el 6to de primaria, tiene 4 hijos que dependen de ella. La señora Carmen Rosa inició su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió de Manuela Ramos en su Banco Comunal "Mujeres Trabajadoras", el monto recibido fue de S/ 300.00 soles ($ 100.00), esto fue hace cinco años, ya que antes se dedicaba a los quehaceres de su casa y ayudar a su esposo en la chacra; con este dinero compró cuajada y lo llevó a vender a Trujillo y así poco a poco fue implementando una bodega en su comunidad, aún así continúa llevando cuajada a Trujillo los días miércoles y sábados. El reciente préstamo recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,200.00 (aproximadamente $403), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, será utilizado para comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas y otros productos para surtir su bodega. Su mayor es ver profesionales a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of various products for a grocery store

loans.name: Eve's Group

texts.en:
With a loan, Eve Ashele wants to increase her quality of services and purchase a drier.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn D., 23, is married with one little kid and lives in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To make her living, she works raising pigs and reselling them to her nearby butcher, making on average around $2 each day. Her husband works charging various kinds of batteries for the people in his area, earning around $2 per day of profit. Thorn D. would like to use this loan to expand her livestock of pigs in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To expand her livestock of pigs to increase her income.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is a 38-year-old car mechanic. Anwar is married and has 4 children. He works and lives in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. This is the first time Anwar has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy material for his business. The increased income generated from the investment will be used for the maintenance of his house.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Muyasara

texts.ru:
Muyasara Holmuradova lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 46 years old, married, and has 6 children. She has high school education and, currently, is not employed. The income earned by her husband is not sufficient to cover all of the family expenses. For this reason, she wants to purchase a cow, which will provide milk for the family. In case there is extra milk, she plans to sell it to her neighbors at low prices. This will help both her family and her neighbors. That is why she is asking for this loan. She plans to pay off the given loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Холмуродова Муяссара проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст46 лет , замужем и имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее . Нигде не работает. Того что зарабатывает ее муж ее семье не хватает , поэтому клиентка хочет купить корову , которая будет давать молоко для ее семьи , а если будет лишнее сможет продавать соседям , таким же как она у которых нет коровы по доступной цене , ниже рыночной. Это будет помощью как для ее семьи , так и для ее соседей. Но для этого она должна получить кредит , который поможет выполнить ее планы. А погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr:
Born around 1971 in Adjaha, in the Mono department in the south of Benin, Mrs. Aline A. is originally from Grand Popo. She is married to Elie Adjinakou, who works at the Postal and Telecommunications Office of Benin, and has two children: Fadil, 14, in fifth grade, and Alabi, 12, in fourth grade. She sells traditional cloth, plastics, oil, soap and other goods. These products are distributed to potential customers but also to other types of customers. Mrs. Aline A. has extensive experience in distribution, but she is currently facing difficulties in supplying all of these products, which are in high demand among her customers. Faced with this situation, she is requesting this loan in order to purchase enough supplies to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1971 à ADJAHA dans le département du MONO au sud du BENIN, dame A. Aline est originaire de GRAND POPO; mariée à ADJINAKOU Elie un agent de l'office des postes télécommunications du BENIN, elle est mère de 2 enfants Fadil 14 ans en classe de CM2 et ALABI 12 ans en classe de CM1. Elle est une revendeuse de pagne, des plastiques, d’huile, des savons et autres. Ces produits font l’objet de distribution vers les clients potentiels mais également vers d’autres types de clients. D’une grande expérience dans la distribution, Dame A. Aline éprouve quelques difficultés actuellement dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits qui font l’objet d’une grande demande auprès de ses clients. Face à cet état de chose, elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’approvisionner afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 lengths of cloth, one barrel of oil and 12 basins

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Las Margaritas Communal Bank is a young bank that begins its third cycle with 22 partners. The partners look forward to receiving a new loan that will help their businesses to proviD. more products.

The partners engage in different businesses such as the sale of vegetables, snacks, cheeses, groceries, food, crafts, cosmetics by catalogue, fish, fruits, and transport services.

Each partner has a different story to tell, as in the case of Haydee. Haydee is a weaver, a skill she learned from her father. Upon establishing her homestead, she taught her husband, too. Together they have a shop with three looms and sell their products to middlemen, but hope one day to engage in direct sales.

Maria is married and has been selling vegetables in the Magdalena market for many years. She supports her children with the income her business generates since her husband holds only temporary jobs.

The partners require varying loan amounts, including loans from 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, to 1000 soles, and amounting to a total loan of 11,100 soles in the Communal Bank.

The loans will be applied toward the purchase of sugar, rice, pasta, squash, tomato, onions, cookies, sweets, cheeses, various cosmetics and fish.

The partners dream of having equity capital and a stable business, of expanding their businesses and offering a better life to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Las Margaritas es un Banco joven que inicia su tercer ciclo con 22 socias. Ellas están alegres D. recibir un nuevo préstamo, que ayudará a surtir con más productos sus negocios.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, golosinas, quesos, abarrotes, comida, artesanía, cosméticos por catálogos, pescado, frutas y servicios D. transporte.

Cada socia tiene una historia diferente que contar como es el caso D. Haydee que realiza trabajos en telar, actividad que aprendió D. su padre y al formar su hogar enseñó a su esposo y actualmente tienen un taller con tres telares, sus productos lo venD. a intermediarios, pero espera algún día tener un puesto D. venta directa.

Mientras que Maria es casada, venD. verduras en el mercado Magdalena hace muchos años y con los ingresos que genera su negocio mantiene a sus hijos, pues su esposo solo tiene trabajos eventuales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 11,100 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, zapallo, tomate, cebolla galletas, caramelos, quesos, cosméticos variados y pescado.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener capital propio, un negocio estable, ampliar sus negocios y brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, pasta, squash, tomato, onions, cookies, sweets, cheeses, various cosmetics and fish.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru:
Muborak Rakhmonova lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Muborak owns a small bakery and has over ten years of experience in baking bread. Her bakery is located in the center of the market, which gives people an opportunity to buy fresh bread at any time of the day. The development of this business would help Muborak to sustain her family. With the price of flour increasing, she decided to buy flour wholesale. This would allow her keeping the same prices. She plans to repay the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Рахмонова Муборак жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 40 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муборак имеет небольшой цех по выпечкe хлебобулочных изделий. Имеет опыт в этой деятельности более 10 лет. Ее цех находится в центре рынка, поэтому население имеет возможность покупать свежий хлеб в любое время суток. Наладив свой небольшой бизнес клиентка может содержать свою семью. В данное время растет цена на муку, поэтому клиентка решила закупить муку у оптовых поставщиков. Это позволит ей не поднимать цены на свою продукцию. Планирует погасить кредит в течениe 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of flour

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 50-year-old woman from a small place called Doborovci, near the town of Gračanica. She doesn't work but she does agriculture and cattle breeding. That is an assured way to bring in additional monthly money for her family. She is married and she has 2 married daughters. Her husband has been working for 15 years in a concrete factory and he earns about 1000 KM (US$ 810) monthly.

This is Fatima's first loan at MCO WWI in the amount of 600 KM (US$ 500) and Fatima intends to use this loan to buy a cow because she has all the conditions for cattle breeding. She has a big place that she will set aside for a future barn and she hopes that she will buy a good cow with a lot of milk in order to sell milk and earn additional money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Viviana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Viviana is a member of the Los Proceres ("The Founding Fathers") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "provincia" of San Martin where she operates a business buying and selling wholesale supplies of rice. Her business is located in a space at her house. Her customers are mainly small food shops and people who sell food items in the market. She decided to start the business so that she could be independent and help with family expenses. Rice sells for an especially good price now which, in turn, generates a good income that allows Viviana to contribute to family expenses, including her children's schooling which is especially important to her.

With this loan of S/.800 (800 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of rice, at wholesale prices, to resell to shops and market vendors. She already has customers who come by her house daily looking for her product.

Viviana, 25, lives with her husband and their two young children. She operates this business because she likes it and because it generates income that helps her husband with the family's expenses. Her goal is to own a small rice farm. She would also like to sell other products such as coffee and maize.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, vive en el Departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la compra y venta de y arroz en chala y pilado, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Próceres Nº 355, sus clientes son las bodegas sobre todo y personas que venden abarrotes en el mercado. Decide iniciar en el negocio para independizarse y ayudar en la economía familiar ya que en esta época la venta del arroz esta en un buen precio que le favorece generar sus ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos sobre todo en la educación de sus menores hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, que será pagado en 6 meses comprará arroz por sacos para ser vendidos en las bodegas y comerciantes del mercado al por mayor, ya tiene clientes quienes clientes visitan diariamente a su casa en busca de su producto.

Tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos aun pequeños, se dedica a este negocio porque le gusta y le permite generar ingresos económicos para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, tiene como meta tener su chacra para sembrar arroz, le gustaría también dedicarse a la venta de otros productos como café y maíz.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of rice for resale.

loans.name: Hy

texts.en: Mrs. Hy S. is a vegetable farmer in Trapaing Run Village in Takeo Province. Her crops have been damaged by animals because her field does not have a fence to protect it. Thus, Mrs. Hy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy wood to build a fence around her field. Mrs. Hy S. is a 48-year-old widow with four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory and the other one is attending school.

loans.use: To build a fence around her field.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say R. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their three children in Kampong Cham.  As a pig farmer, Say's business has suffered from inflation, which has doubled the costs associated with feeding animals.  Nonetheless, she earns about $2 each day while her husband, as a construction foreman in Phnom Penh, earns about $7 each day.  In order to move away from pig farming, Say is requesting a loan of $700, which will be used to purchase a calf for resale in the future, as well as more tools for her husband's construction business.

loans.use: To purchase a calf and more tools for construction.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima was born in 1964 and is a widow with one child. She lives in Azerbaijan's Khachmaz region, in the village of Sayad. She has been in the farming business for six years. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving her farm.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en:
At 44 years of age, Yadigar K. is married and has three adorable daughters. His principal work is the buying and selling of cattle. This business requires lots of strength because he needs to wake up early in the morning, pasture his calves outside, worry about vaccinations. This necessitates considerable financial means.

The business is very profitable, but his lack of capital makes his income insignificant, and living conditions remain difficult in his household. To strengthen his business, he is asking for a loan of 1200 USD, which will serve to buy more cattle to expand his business. This will allow him to effectively meet the needs of his household.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Tiến năm nay 46 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đã  trưởng thành tại xã Nam Viêm thị xã Phúc Yên – Vĩnh Phúc. Năm 1999  chị Tiến tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại chị Lan đang đầu tư vốn để chăn nuôi lợn, bò.Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng,  Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của các con nên kinh tế gia đình ngày càng ổn định hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị Lan xin vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm bò và  thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 46 years old, she lives with her husband and two grown-up children in Nam Viem commune, Phuc Yen district, Vinh Phuc province. In 1999, Mrs. T. participated in TYM Fund and borrowed money to raise livestock. Currently, Mrs. Lan raises pigs and cows. This is the business that brings the main source of income for her family, with a monthly income of VND5,000,000. Apart from this, her family also has financial support from her children therefore the economic situation of the family is increasingly stable.

In this loan cycle, Mrs Loan would like to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy more cows and food for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Tith's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people. Its leader, Mrs. V. is 50 years old and a window. She currently earns a living by working with her daughter as temporary workers. She now has seven children; six are single and the other is married. To help support the family's needs a little, her son is employed as a local fisherman. Currently, the family living conditions is not good because their old house is too small for them. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. V. would like to ask for a loan to combine with her savings to build a new house.

The other three members are:

B., a local fisherman, needs a loan to buy nets and traps for fishing.

R. earns a living catching fish for sale. She requests a loan to buy more tools for fishing.

T. is working as a temporary worker and she is asking for a loan to repair her old house. The borrowers live in Chong Khneas Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es una mujer D. 55 años, vive en una casa alquilada con su esposo Donato D. 58 años y sus hijos Percy D. 20 y Rudy D. 18, a los cuales quiere mucho y desea darles unos estudios superiores adecuados. Juana es una madre D. familia muy dedicada, realiza el negocio D. la venta D. leña y es muy solicitada por sus clientes. Con 9 años en este negocio Juana desea para el futuro D. su trabajo, incrementar la cantidad D. leña que tiene para vender y así tener dinero para pagar los estudios superiores D. sus hijos, a quienes cuida con mucho amor y siempre se ha preocupado porque no les falte nada. Ella disfruta D. conversar con sus clientes, siempre suelta una broma para llevarse mejor con ellos, ya que su principal estrategia D. venta es la alegría que le pone a todo lo que hace, pues lo que menos le gusta es estar molesta y más aun si lo está cuando venD., ya que no quiere alejar sus clientes D. sus negocio. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y se ha comprometido a pagarlo con todas las socias D. su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita, 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra D. más leña para incrementar la cantidad D. su mercadería.
texts.en:
Juana is a 55 year old woman, she lives in a rented home with her husband (58 year old Donato) and her children (Percy, age 20 and Rudy, age 18), whom she loves very much and she wishes to proviD. them an adequate university education. Juana is a very dedicated mother; she has a firewood business and is sought after by her customers. Juana has had this business for 9 years, and she wishes to increase the quantity of wood that she has to sell and in this way have enough money to pay for her children’s university tuition. She cares for her children with a lot of love and she always worries that they have what they need. She enjoys conversing with her customers and she always has a joke to share and create a good relationship with her customers. Her principle selling strategy is to be happy in all that she does. She doesn’t like to be a bother and if she were to be a pest when she is selling she wouldn’t have any customers. This is her fifth loan with MFP, she feels very happy to have received it and she has promised to pay it with all the members of her Community Bank. The money she seeks, 1000 nuevos soles, will be invested in buying more firewood to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of firewood to sell

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy K., 50, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers who typically make US$4 per day. This couple has five children, four of whom are farmers and one who is a student. Soy K. would like to take out a loan to purchase fertilizers to increase her farm's production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
LUZ MARÍA F. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”.  Su negocio está ubicado en el Mercado N° 3 puesto N°  224, Distrito de Calleria, tiene 47 años, 3 hijos (2 menores de edad).  Su esposo es coadministrador del negocio.

	Ella  tiene el negocio en el mercado de su localidad, el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en la compra de algunos abarrotes para surtir su pequeño puesto.  Ya lleva 6 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, su negocio ha ido creciendo vez y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con el pasar del tiempo es necesario dar mayor seguridad al local, ya que es de madera y necesita cambiar y refaccionar algunas paredes.
Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, podrá invertir S/.1000 en compra de madera para su local y el resto en compra de abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Luz Maria F. P., belongs to the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas” (“United Hands”). Her business is located in the market in the district of Calleria. She is 47 years old, and has 3 children (2 are underage). Her husband is the co-administrator of the business. Luz’ business is located in her neighborhood’s market; the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos was of 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of groceries to supply her small stand. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 6 years, and her business has been growing which is why she has had to increase the amount of her loans. As time has passed it has become necessary to increase the security of her locale, given that it is of wood and requires changing and refurbishing some of the walls. With this loan of 3,000 PEN she will be able to invest 1,000 PEN in the purchase of wood for her local, and the rest will be used to purchase groceries to stock her store. Luz thanks Manuela Ramos, for being an institution that serves the community with the service that it provides and contributes to the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various products (groceries). To purchase wood for the maintenance of her locale.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia C. is 50 years old and has two children. She manages a small rice farm. The income generated from the farm is used to meet the basic needs of her family. She teaches her children to farm so that when they grow up they will know how to plant rice for their families. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI to buy diesel and seeds. She needs diesel to run the tractor to plow the field and requires good quality rice seeds to obtain maximum harvest.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to help them start their own business. CEVI provides not only credit assistance but also trainings and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase diesel and seeds

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A., 47, is married and has two children; sons. According to her, one son is currently in junior high school while the other is a senior high school student. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works to provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver. Margaret sells porridge. She prepares it in her house and sells in front of her house. Margaret procures bags of maize and beans from the local market. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. Margaret is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Mohammad Kazem

texts.en:
M. Kazem is the son of M. A.. He lives in 8th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives in a family of seven members and all of them benefit from the income he generates through his business.

He has a carpentry business and works hard in order to earn more money. He has a desire to be the most popular carpenter and to make all kinds of wooden equipment. He would like to take a loan of 50,000 Afghani to progress and make his life better.

loans.use: To buy required materials for his carpentry business

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia V. is from the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 38 years old. Porferia is married and has seven school-age children. To make a living, Porferia owns and operates a business buying and selling bananas in her community. Porferia has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 700 PHP a month.

In 2009, Porferia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Porferia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase bananas to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bananas to sell

loans.name: Nina's Group

texts.en:
Nina N. is the leader of the Kisakye group in Rubaga. She has a pork joint that also acts as a bar in the social centre of Mengo. She has sold beer, soda, wine, water, and other drinks for a year now but the pork for a long time.

She is a 28 year old mother of three children, aged between 10 and 4 years old. They are all attending school. She also cares for three sisters, including paying their school fees.

Nina says that her level of cleanliness and good customer care have kept her business moving and enabled her to make more profits. She needs a loan to help buy more stock of drinks for her bar and more pork for sale. She hopes to buy a plot of land for her children and educate them further.

loans.use: To buy more stock of drinks and pork for her business.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis R.  es padre de familia y tiene ya 15 años que adquirió un terreno en el cual fue construyendo su casa con tres créditos que ha tenido con FVP, los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. Ahora está solicitando nueva mente un préstamo para poder escriturar la propiedad. 
También a su negocio de mecánica (Reparación de Autos) le está haciendo falta herramienta más moderna. 
Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar acabo el tramite de las escrituras y la comprar de la herramienta, es por eso que solicita el crédito, y desea pagarlo con los ingresos de obtiene del negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. José Luis R. is a family man. Fifteen years ago, he acquired the land on which he is built his house. He took out three previous loans with FVP to finance the construction, and all were paid on time. He is requesting a new loan so that he can file the deed to his property.

Don José is an auto mechanic by trade, but he does not have the most modern tools.

At the moment, he does not have the money to carry out the processing of the deed or to purchase new tools. That’s why he is requesting this loan, and he will make the payments using the earnings from his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Initiate the deed to his property & purchase tools for his business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 29-year-old father of one who runs a printing and graphic design business. He has repaid three other loans successfully and is now asking for a fourth loan of Ksh. 60,000 to purchase additional computers and printers. He believes that the loan and an expanded business will allow him to prosper and get him and his family a better life. He describes himself as mentally smart, determined, funny and industrious.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy additional computers and printers

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn T., 35-years old, rice farmer started to worry about the growing finance sin their home. She has four children and a very supportive husband. She learned to farm when she was just a little kid, from her parents. But when she got married she was able to apply what she lerned in her childhood days. 

To buy seeds, pesticides and payment for the laborers are the real purpose why she would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community economic Ventures Inc. Hopefully, this would be her 5th loan in CEVI that will truly help her augment their income. 

She said, she likes the services of CEVI because of low interest rate of 2% a month which is very low that every borrowers could afford to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides and payment for the laborer

loans.name: Enkhbaigalmaa

texts.en:
Enkhbaigalmaa D. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her oldest son is a university student and her younger daughters currently attend a local secondary school. Her husband, Chuluunbaatar, works in their town as an electrician.

Enkhbaigalmaa currently operates a small sewing business in the town. Her husband always helps out in his free time, and her oldest daughter helps her mother by sewing clothes. Her entire family has become very motivated to make the business successful. 

Enkhbaigalmaa started her sewing business in 2007 and has found success in her trade. She is known throughout her community as a humble and graceful person. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and one day own her own workplace. Her dream is to one day be able to build a new house for her family. She is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to purchase new fabric and thread for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase new fabric and thread for her sewing business

loans.name: Ambica

texts.en:
Ambica P. lives in Koteshwor, Nepal. Koteshwor is located in the Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in their own businesses. Ambica P. has four members including herself in her family. Her husband's name is Bhishma Raj P.. He works in a private office. They have two children. Her older son is studying in grade 11 and the younger son is studying in grade 10.
Four years ago Ambica opened her ready made clothes shop to uplift the living standard of her family. She sells different types of clothes in her shop. She specializes in children clothes. 
Now Ambica is requesting Rs25000.00 loan to buy new design clothes for her shop.

loans.use: to buys readymade clothes for her shop

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
Malik I. has a successful business selling foodstuffs at a market in Agsu city. He started his business about 5 years ago after evaluating different business possibilities, deciding this would be the best option and something he would enjoy.
Malik purchases his products at very low prices and is then able to resell them for a profit. Because he sells in bulk amounts, he deals with a high inventory turnover rate. Malik rents a very good location at the market for his business and has a small amount of competition.
He has requested a loan of 1607 AZN to increase his business capital. This loan will give him the ability to purchase more products to sell, enabling him to increase his profit and to continue operating a profitable business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and the children. Currently all her children are schooling in the community. She is a local manufacturer of soap. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to make her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities due to lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to increase her income to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ten bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is focused and hard working. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is 35 years old and married with four children.

She sells provisions very close to her house, and has been in this business for the past eight years. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN which she intends to use to buy provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Foai

texts.en:
Foai is 29 and married with 3 children (ages 3-7).  She owns & operates a business venture, catching & selling farm-raised fish .  She has 4 years of experience in this business.    Foai needs a loan of WST $2700 to purchase a fishing boat.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2006, Foai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Foai's 4th loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

Foai's Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta M. is 52 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Eseta has 5 years of experience in this business.  Eseta needs a loan of WST $2000 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Eseta joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Eseta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Eseta M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to five children, who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Agnes is a trader. She trades in tomatoes and groundnuts. She procures the goods from nearby farming communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Agnes sometimes treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for 20 years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and groundnuts

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari S. runs a foodstuffs shop at Tabata ward in Dar es Salaam. He is married with four school-age children. He purchases the business goods from the wholesale shops at the city market and sells retail to customers at his shop. He has been in the business for five years and the business income has enabled him to pay the children's school fees and capitalize the business. He needs a loan of T.shs 700,000 to buy more business goods. 
. 
.

loans.use: To buy more business stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for self-publishing, advertising costs and website creation

loans.name: Ludya

texts.en:
Ludya was born in 1958 and she is married to Mr. John Boswony. They have seven children: Julia, 28; Pamela, 25; Sammy, 24, (University Student); Dorine, 20, (secondary student); Carolyne, 18, (secondary student ); Ronald, 16; and Hazael, 12, (in primary school).

Ludya is a farmer; she plants vegetables, maize and Irish potatoes. She started this farming business in 1989, and she earns a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000. She also gets Kshs. 2,000 per month from other sources of income. Her clients are mostly residents of Timboiywo centre.

Ludya has not borrowed from another source before Kadet. A friend introduced her to Kadet Ltd. She has borrowed an agriculture loan worth Kshs. 60,000 from Kadet Ltd. and she intends to buy farm inputs to help her grow maize. This includes maize seeds and fertilizers. If this loan boosts her business, Ludya plans to use the extra profit to pay school fees. 

She dreams of purchasing more land, and she describes herself as polite and hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Jangiboy

texts.en:
The business activity from which Jangiboy makes a living is the breeding of livestock. He started this business 7 years ago with a small number of livestock, but as his business has developed, he has acquired greater quantities of animals for their eventual sale and gain from their derivatives. According to Jangiboy, he works very hard so that he can take care of his children. For that reason, he is always looking for a way to improve his family's living. Currently, he needs a loan of 6000 Somoni in order to purchase more cattle to later resell after breeding them. This will allow him to fully meet the needs of his family and educate his children.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to develop his business.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita P., from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province, is 38 years old, married, and the mother of two school-aged children. To make a living, Nelita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over eight years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

Nelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to invest in expanding the business, she is now requesting a new loan, her second, of 8000 PHP to invest in further expanding the business. Nelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cervelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Cervelina Sánchez Gutiérrez es profesora de secundaria tiene 25 años de ser maestra trabaja en una comunidad de san Rafael del sur, es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos lo cual dos son menores y están en edad escolar, el dinero lo solicita para comprar 200 pulgas de madera para reparar su casa.
Es el sexto crédito con nosotros y dice que todos los crédito le han servido mucho ya que ha podido salir adelante con su familia y espera que siempre le estemos financiando para seguir luchando con su familia.
texts.en:
La Sra. Cervelina Sánchez Gutiérrez es profesora de secundaria tiene 25 años de ser maestra trabaja en una comunidad de san Rafael del sur, es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos lo cual dos son menores y están en edad escolar, el dinero lo solicita para comprar 200 pulgas de madera para reparar su casa. Es el sexto crédito con nosotros y dice que todos los crédito le han servido mucho ya que ha podido salir adelante con su familia y espera que siempre le estemos financiando para seguir luchando con su familia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar madera

loans.name: Lagwai B2 Alimo Janat Group

texts.en: A. Janat, 31 years old, is married with five children, three of them in school. She also has three dependents. She has been operating a grocery business for over a year. She is using the loan to purchase grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, silver fish, and so forth. The loan is improving her business and her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, silver fish, and so forth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 24 años, convive con Mailen de 20 años, ellos tienen dos pequeños hijos, todos viven en su acogedora casa propia, que construyeron luego de constantes sacrificios. Su dedicación y esmero hacen que Ricardo, sea uno de los mejores productores de plátano y café de su localidad “Sanchirio Palomar”, pese a ser joven, es un padre responsable y eso lo motiva aseguir trabajando y poder brindarle lo mejor a su familia. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposa y más en temporada de cosecha, normalmente él se dedica al campo y su esposa a las labores domésticas y cuidar de sus hijos. Lleva más de un año dedicado a la agricultura y lo que más le gusta es cultivar  y limpiar sus plantaciones de café, por otro lado le molesta que en el mercado de su ciudad  le quieran regatear en el precio, los mayoristas alegando que es su precio real en el mercado. Pese a todo considera que su oficio es bastante rentable porque puede cubrir los gastos de su familia, educar a sus hijos y sobre todo le permite ahorrar. Actualmente tiene dos hectáreas de plátano y quiere comprar un terreno de dos hectáreas más para renovar sus plantaciones y tener mayor productividad. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasmado con la idea de trabajar en su grupo comunal donde hay reglas y normas que cumplir. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mil 600 plantas de plátano para plantarlas en sus terrenos nuevos.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 24 years old and lives with Mailen, who is 20. They have 2 small children, and all live together in their own cozy home that they built through much sacrifice. Ricardo's dedication and industriousness have made him one of the best producers of bananas and coffee in the Sanchirio Palomar area. In spite of being young, he is a responsible father and this motivates him to continue working so that he can provide the best for his family. At times he is helped out by his wife, especially during the harvest season. Normally, he works in the fields and his wife carries out the domestic tasks and cares for their children. For more than a year he has worked in agriculture, and what he likes most is to cultivate and clear his coffee lands. On the other hand, he does not enjoy the market in his city where they want to haggle on price, where the wholesalers claim that their price is the real market price. In spite of all of this, he considers this line of work to be sufficiently profitable, since he can cover the household expenses, educate his children and, above all, save. Currently he has 2 hectares of bananas, and he wants to buy 2 more hectares of land so that he can add to his cultivations and have increased production. This is the first time that he has taken a loan from MFP, and he is enthusiastic about the idea of working with a communal group where there are rules and regulations to comply with. With the loan he requests, he will buy 1,600 banana plants to plant on his new land.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: he will buy 1,600 banana plants to plant on his new land

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 28 años es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Samuel de 29 años y su único hijo Yonatan de 10 años. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, Victoria sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos son el plátano y el café, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de “La Merced”. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlas. Para el futuro desea comprar más tierras para sembrar más café. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los mil seiscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para hacer más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Victoria, age 28, is a very responsible and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her 29 year old husband, Samuel, and her only child, 10 year old Yonatan. Victoria leaves to work in the fields very early in the morning everyday. There are no days off for her. She has to continually work her farm in order to have good production. Her main products are bananas and coffee. She sells them wholesale in the city of La Merced. She has been doing this activity for four years. What she likes the best about her work is the freedom she has working her crops. The most difficult part is taking care of her crops so that the pests are not able to damage them. In the future she wants to buy more land to plant more coffee. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual making her payments, and she expects to do the same now as well. She is a well-liked by her colleagues in her communal bank because she is very happy. She will use the 1,600 PEN she is requesting to buy more fertilizer to make her fields more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fertilizer to improve her coffee and banana production

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie J. is from the village of Lower Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 26 years old, married and has 2 very young children. Melanie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina S. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Paulina owns and operates a business selling home products, especially ready-to-wear clothing, in the local community. Paulina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Paulina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paulina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Paulina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rakima's Group

texts.en:
Rakima J. is the leader of this group. She is 53 and divorced. She has raised two daughters and a son; her daughters are married and live separately with their families and her son works in a factory. Twelve years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Rakima started to sell vegetable oil in the market. She earns on average 10,000 KGS per month. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase 200 liters of oil in order to increase her business turnover. In the future, she wants to see her son get married.

Nurjan A., 33, is married. She has a son and three daughters; her son and oldest daughter attend school and the other children are not yet old enough. Nurjan is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband works in construction. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS, Nurjan bought a cow and started to breed cattle. She also sells milk to make money. She earns 2,000 KGS per month from these activities. With money received from this loan, she wants to purchase a bull in order to resell it after fattening. In the future, Nurjan wants to repair her house and install new gates.

Nurzat S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 33 and divorced. She has a 13 year old daughter, who attends school. Nurzat has been engaged in cattle breeding for three years, beginning with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS. She also sells milk and earns 3,000 KGS per month from these activities. Her profits made it possible for her to improve her family's living conditions and purchase household appliances. With money received from this loan, she wants to purchase sheep for breeding. In the future, Nurzat plans to purchase a vehicle.

Aida C., 26, is married. She has two daughters and a son. Her older daughter attends school and the other children are not yet old enough. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 3,000 KGS, Aida built a kiosk near her house and started to sell convenience goods. She earns 18,000 KGS per month. With money received from this loan, she wants to purchase a fridge to store goods and stationery because the school season begins and the demand will be high. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase 200 liters of vegetable oil

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 48 years old has 8 children. Fe has been involved in farming for over 10 years. She plants and harvests rice crops. She also grows pigs to fatten and sell. Fe's older children help her in farming. She hopes to have a stable source of income.

Ma. Fe joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Fe is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She will also use the loan to buy feeds and piglet. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She will also use the loan to buy feeds and piglet

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie J. is from the village of Sinait. She is 42 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Rosalie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest. In 2010, Rosalie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SORO YIRIWA  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans  et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait l’achat vente de fruits et légumes, de pagnes wax   avec Mariam S. et divers autres articles pour femmes .
 MARIAM S. compte acheter avec son  prêt 50 pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Bamako  et effectue sa vente au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille, en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
These four married women are members of the Soro Yiriwa group and are on average 43 years old with 4 children. The are mostly from monogamous families and live in Medine, one of the neighbourhoods of Sikasso. (Third administrative region of Mali). This will be their seventh business loan with the Soro Yiriwasso microfinance institution.

This group of women buy and sell fruits and vegetables, pagnes wax (wax dyed decorative cloth) and various other women's articles. Mariam S. plans to buy 50 pieces of pagnes wax. She buys supplies from the major market in Bamako and sells her products in the large market is Sikasso in both bulk or as individual items, for cash or credit to a clientele made up of both men and women.

She plans to earn a monthly profit of 75,000 Francs CFA and a part will be used to help support her husband meet the daily expenses and part to be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies of pagnes wax (wax dyed decorative cloth) for resale

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne L. is 28 years old and the single mother of James L. who is one year old. She lives in Kakamega town.

Everlyne sells Irish potatoes in the market and has been in this business for the past year. Her clientele mainly consist of the hotels around who sell chips. She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is also a client here. She wants to buy ten sacks of Irish potatoes to add to her stock so as to be able to meet the demand of her clients.

Her hope and dream is to be the main supplier of Irish potatoes to the big hotels around.

loans.use: Buy ten sacks of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita tiene 33 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Jovita vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Anta provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad de Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco donde la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Jovita alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su negocio. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y también se dedica a la venta granos. 
     
Jovita desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Jovita con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá para aumentar sus negocios y desea comprar granos como por ejemplo cebada, trigo, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Jovita is 33 years old, has two children and lives with her common-law husband. She currently lives in the community of Compone, district of Anta, department of Cusco, Peru. Her community is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco, and the majority of its inhabitants make a living in agriculture and raising livestock. Jovita balances her household and business activities. Her main source of income comes from farming, and she also makes a living selling grains. Jovita has belonged to the "San Isidro de Compone" community bank and Kiva partner Asociacion Araruwa in Cusco for quite some time. With her next loan of 500 soles, she plans to expand her business by purchasing grains, such as barley, wheat, etc. Jovita is grateful for the opportunity made available through this medium and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase grains such as barley, wheat, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Alexis

texts.es:
Manuel, reside en Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, donde vive con sus padres y un hermano, es soltero y tiene 20 años de edad, en su familia todos trabajan; él es empleado desde hace un año en una gasolinera con el cargo de jefe de pista, su horario es rotativo  y en este momento su casa tiene la necesidad de reparar el portón por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar mano de obra y comprar los materiales que se necesiten para reparar el portón de su vivienda.
Este préstamo le ayudara a dar una mejor vistosidad a su vivienda, así mismo su familia estará más segura. El desea dar a su familia estabilidad económica para enfrentar cualquier situación imprevista es por eso que quiere seguir trabajando y luchado por mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in Concepcion Batres in the Usulutan department. He is 20, single, and lives with his parents and a brother. Everyone in his family works. For the past year he has worked rotating shifts at a gas station as lot boss. 

The gate to his house needs to be repaired, so he has requested a loan to pay for labor and materials to fix it. This loan will help improve the home's appearance as well as increasing its security. He hopes to provide the financial stability to his family to deal with unforeseen events which is why he wants to keep working and striving to improve living conditions.

loans.use: Repair the family home's gate.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 58-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. She sells a wide range of goods from her home to customers from her community. She has been involved in this occupation from the past six years.  She sells oil, olives etc. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory for the coming winter season. Her business depends largely on the seasons and she needs to be prepared before the winter.  She believes that her business would fare better if she were to sell her goods in a different part of Lebanon. In the future, she would like to rent out a space to sell her merchandise, as well as sell popular homemade food products. For the time being, she will continue to sell goods from her home.

loans.use: To increase her inventory for the coming winter season

loans.name: Thimothe

texts.fr:
Marié  père de 4 enfants qui sont encore sur le banc de l’école, monsieur Timothée s’est lancé dans la vente en gros du pétrole et des cartes prépayées.
 Il vendait 20000f par jour avant le premier prêt qui lui a permis de renforcé son activité, il avait acheté : 
2000 litres  de pétrole, les cartes MTN et ZAIN et  un abonnement a CONGO TELECOM  cela lui a permis de générer   plus revenus pour épargner et rembourser le prêt sans problèmes.

Avec le prochain prêt il va continuer avec le même élan en achetant encore 3000l de pétrole lampant  et agrandir son entreprise en achetant les cartes de recharges de différents réseaux de télécommunication .
L’avenir de ses enfants lui tient à cœur , il se bat à les soutenir dans leurs différents option car il y a un qui veut devenir prêtre.
Très rigoureux en gestion, monsieur Timothée veut prospérer au travers de notre organisme.
texts.en:
