Mr. Thimothe is a married father of four children who still attend school. He is a wholesaler of kerosene and prepaid telephone cards.

His daily revenue amounted to 20,000F prior to his first loan, which allowed him to strengthen his activity. He bought 2000 liters of kerosene, MTN and ZAIN cards, and a subscription to CONGO TELECOM. This enabled him to generate more income, boost his savings, and repay the loan without problems.

With the next loan, he plans to keep the momentum by adding 3000 liters of kerosene to his stock, and expand his business by purchasing telephone recharge cards from various telecommunication  networks.

He takes his children’s future to heart, striving to support them in their various options. One of them wishes to become a priest.

A rigorous manager, Mr. Thimothe hopes to prosper through our organization.

loans.use: Buying recharge cards and a small kerosene station

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.en:
Maria is forty-three years old.  She maintains a stable home, living with her husband and their three children.  The family lives in the district of Tambogrande.  Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone which is populated primarily by farmers.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals.

Maria raises sheep in corrals near her home.  She feeds and cares for the animals until they reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold for their meat in local markets.  The animals play an important role in meeting the nutritional needs of local residents and are an integral part of the local culinary tradition.  Maria’s husband manages a small parcel of land the family owns and also works as a farmhand helping local growers with the maintenance and harvest of their crops.

This will be Maria’s first loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the loan to purchase balanced feed for her animals in order to improve their health and productivity.  She hopes to be able to take advantage of bulk discounts.  She has planned this investment to increase the sustainability of her business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed

loans.name: Jehiner Ivan

texts.es:
Jehiner tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial y con bastante movimiento de transporte. Es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace cinco años se ha dedicado a brindar servicio de taxi en la ciudad donde reside. El brinda su servicio todos los dias en las principales zonas frecuentadas por los pobladores de la ciudad. el negocio se ha consolidado como su única fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante. los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia a solventar sus gastos económicos.

Jehiner desea brindar mantenimiento a su vehículo y realizar algunas reparaciones para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento y así asegurarse el sustento. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jehiner is 29 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Chiclayo, an area with quite a bit of commercial and transport activity.  It is the capital of Lambayeque region.

Jehiner has been providing taxi services in his city for five years.  He provides his service every day in the main areas frequented by the city's residents.  His business has become his only source of income and so he works hard every day to get ahead.  He uses the income he makes from his business to cover his personal expenses and to help his family cover their financial expenses.

Jehiner would like to have some maintenance work and repairs done on his vehicle to ensure it runs correctly and thereby guarantee his ability to earn a living.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To have maintenance work and repairs done on his vehicle to ensure it runs correctly

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy S., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. is a housewife and her husband is a mechanic, earning an income of USD 11.60 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 18 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more equipment for her husband to improve his mechanic's business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her loan first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for her husband

loans.name: Ernesto's Group

texts.en:
Ernesto S. is from the village of Biasong, Lopez Jaena. He is 52 years old and the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ernesto is separated from his spouse and has 1 adult-aged child. Ernesto owns and operates a business selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Ernesto joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesto is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ernesto from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora F. is from the town of Surallah. She is 46 years old. Nora is married and has 4 children, aged 18, 16, 10 and 2. To make a living, Nora owns & operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nora also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells various products.

Nora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizers

loans.name: Oprecida

texts.en:
Oprecida P. is from the village of San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 53 years old, and single, with no children. To make a living, Oprecida operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Oprecida has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Oprecida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oprecida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Oprecida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Oprecida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en: Otgontuya, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a shift driver for a transportation company and gets paid 150,000 to 300,000 MNT monthly. Otgontuya graduated from a vocational school as a shoemaker in 2007 and began working for a workshop with other shoemakers. She has been working there for the last three years and now she makes shoes at home in addition to her job. She is planning to increase her production and make more variety of shoes at home. She is a hardworking person who takes initiative and said, "I would like to increase my profit and save money for my children's future study.".She is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more materials for her shoemaking business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for shoemaking

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ubaldina; la socia tiene 36 años de edad, casada y tiene 7 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras se dedica a la agricultura, ella siembra lechuga para luego venderlo a sus clientes que se encuentran  en los mercados de Cusco a la vez la socia recoge hierbas de los campos ( hierbas medicinales) que también lo vende a sus mismos clientes, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable, ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo él es albañil y ambos sacan a  su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de abono, fertilizantes para su chacra.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata". It is located in the community of Yuncaypata, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Ubaldina. She is 36 years old, married, and she has 7 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling vegetables. She is an agriculturist and she cultivates lettuce which is later sold to clients at the markets in Cusco. She also harvests herbs from the fields (medicinal herbs) and she also sells them to those same clients. She is a very happy person and she is responsible. She works together with her husband, a construction worker, for the support of the family.

She requests a loan to purchase fertilizers for her fields.

She is happy for her loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her fields

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been doing dairy farming in Litein Town, South Rift, Kenya for eight years and sells her milk produce to the local market. She is married with three children aged between seven and one. She has two farmhands on her farm. 

Hellen has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase a motorcycle and enable her to venture into the transport business. She adds that this will improve her income and make it more consistent even during the dry season when the dairy business is doing badly. The income she says is intended to pay for the education of her children and improve her farming businesses. 

Hellen believes her main challenge is the drought.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Edgar Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Edgar,   se dedica al Servicio de Transporte, Hace Diez años. El señor empieza su jornada laboral desde muy tempranas horas seis de la mañana y concluye según como le fue en el día. Normalmente a las once de la noche, Tiene  51 años, Vive en la Zona del Plan 3000, Tiene Cinco  hijos dos que dependen de el y Los Otros trabajan y Estudian, Actualmente el necesita el crédito para comprar el motor para su vehículo y algunas reparaciones del vehículo como ser arreglos eléctricos y chapeado. Su Esposa vende comida en su propio domicilio, Son Personas responsables las cuales buscan día a día el bienestar y la superación para poder tener una vejez segura.
texts.en:
Edgar has worked for ten years providing transportation services.  He starts his working day at the early hour of 6:00am, and it ends depending on how well the day went, normally around 11:00pm.  He is 51 years old and lives in the Plan 3000 area.  He has five children, and two still depend on him.  The others work and go to school.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase an engine for his car and to do some car repairs, including electrical repairs and veneers.  His wife sells food in their home.  They are responsible people who seek well-being and improvement every day in order to have a secure old-age.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and purchase an engine.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido, from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon, is 31 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Bienvinido owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, breads and green bananas in the local community. Engaged in his business for over a year, he earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 20111, Bienvinido joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and bananas, Bienvinido plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & bananas.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 60 years old. She has been raising broiler chickens for about 10 years, with an average income of about KES 9,000 per month. Her husband, Samuel, also contributes to the family income.
	
Anastacia is taking her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. She plans to use the loan to buy more broiler chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.  She hopes to have a big poultry farm and improve her standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more broilers.

loans.name: Afrodita De Tolcayuca Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Afrodita de Tolcayuca" porque para las integrantes del grupo el nombre de “Afrodita” es muy representativo ya que es la diosa de la belleza. El grupo se ubica en el Estado de Hidalgo, en México. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes. La señora Xochitl es la presidenta del grupo. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, estudio la carrera técnica en Comercio. Xochitl se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene un negocio fijo en un lugar concurrido del municipio, su negocio es un bazar en la cual vende ropa y zapatos, ya tiene 14 años en su negocio. La señora Xochitl decidio dedicarse a la venta de ropa ya que le permiten obtener ingresos extras que le ayudan a solventar los gastos del hogar, así como apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. La señora tiene dos hijos, uno de 15 y otro de 11 años respectivamente quienes estudian actualmente en la localidad. El prestamo que solicita es principalmente para la compra de un mostrador donde pueda ofrecer de una manera más visible sus artículos y esto poder ayudarle a incrementar sus ventas. Xochitl es conocita como una mujer que lucha por tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia además de que es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y con gran carisma para sus clientes, vecinos y familiares. La foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señora Xochilt. Con las ganancias que obtenga seguira invirtiendo en mercancia y para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called Afrodita de Tolcayuca because the name Aphrodite represents the Goddess of beauty.  The group is located in the state of Hidalgo in Mexico.  The group is comprised of ten members.

Xochitl is the president of the group.  She is 35 years old, and she studied for a technical career in business.  Xochitl sells clothes, and she has a fixed business in a very busy place in the municipality.  Her business is a bazaar where she sells clothes and shoes.  She has had the business for 14 years.

Xochitl decided to sell clothes because it allows her to get extra income.  This helps her pay the household expenses and helps with her children’s education.  She has two children, ages 15 and 10.  They are currently in the local school.

The loan she is requesting is mainly to buy a display case where she will be able to offer her goods in a more visible way.  This will help her increase her sales.

Xochitl is known as a woman who struggles to have a better quality of life for her family.  She is an enterprising and responsible woman with great charisma for her customers, neighbors, and family members.

The photo was taken at Xochilt’s business.  With the earnings that she gets she will continue investing in merchandise and paying for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a display case for clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Sixta Justina

texts.es:
Sixta es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos (1 independiente).  Tiene educación secundaria completa.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos, su primer monto solicitado fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados ovinos y vacunos.  También se dedica a la confección de artesanía como chompas, chalinas y ponchos, esto lo hace en sus ratos libres.
Con éste nuevo  préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará seis animales, los compra en las comunidades del distrito y los vende en Mañazo y Puno.  En el negocio trabaja sola.  Nos dice que sus hijos estudian.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de venta de comidas el cual le permitirá tener mayores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo, compartir con las socias y las charlas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Sixta is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de San José” which is located in the District of Mañazo, Province and Department of Puno. She is 39 years old, widowed, and has four children (one of whom is independent). Sixta completed her high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for three loan cycles. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 500 PEN. The money was invested in her business of buying and selling sheep and cattle. In addition, she produces handicrafts such as sweaters, scarves, and ponchos during her free time.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy six animals. Sixta will buy the animals in the communities within the district and sell them in Mañazo and Puno. She works alone in her business. Her children are in school.

Her dream is to have a business selling food so that she can earn more income. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the camaraderie, sharing with the other members, and the seminars that relate to business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Tanous

texts.en: Tanous is a 57-year-old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. Despite his older age, he has been working as a taxi driver for the past 20 years. He operates a student van service in his town as well as in his neighboring villages. He also transports private clients upon their requests. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his van such as updating the paint, repairing the engine, etc. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new van and hire a part-time employee to work on it.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his van

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 21-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. Zeinab started her own business selling clothes in order to help her husband raise their children and cover most of their expenses. Zeinab is a woman with a good reputation; she is liked and supported by most of her customers.

Zeinab is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to prepare herself for the Eid Al Fitr holy celebration, often abbreviated to Eid, a three day Muslim holiday that marks the end of Ramadan, the Islamic holy month of fasting. Many people work hard to buy new clothes and shoes so their children can celebrate Eid in new clothes.

Zeinab also sells toys to increase her income and to attract children to various toys and gadgets. She hopes to improve her business and to provide her children with the best and healthy living.

loans.use: To increase her clothing and shoes inventory

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has operated her retail business for the last six months.  She normally sells her goods outside her house.She is twenty-four years old, single, and the mother of one school-going child.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to pay rent and move into a more permanent place from where to sell.

In future, she hopes to grow her retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To pay rent and move to a more permanent place.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Sergio tiene 27 años de edad,  el socio es casado; el socio tiene 2 hijos, el socio trabaja taxista interprovincial, el socio tiene su unidad vehicular y traslada pasajeros desde el poblado de Urcos hasta Ocongate, el socio en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo en el cambio de aceite y otros para ponerlo operativo para que siga transitando bien.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “The Triumphant Beautiful Mary” Bank that is located in the Ocongate District in the Quispicanchis Province in the Department of Cusco.
The member, named Sergio, is 27 years old. He is married with two children. He works as a taxi driver who drives between provinces. He has one vehicle and he transports passengers from the city of Urcos to Ocongate. This member would like this loan in order to maintain his vehicle. He would spend the money on oil changes and other necessities needed to keep his car operating and able to run well.
This member is thankful for the support of this loan and promises to pay his payments on time.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle by paying for oil changes and other necessities needed to keep his vehicle in working order so he can continue transporting his customers.

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es: Este cliente es un pequeño agricultor que se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como maíz, frijol y trigo, está solicitando para la compra de insumos tales como urea, completo insecticida y pago de mano de obra, es casado y de oficio agrónomo y los créditos los solicita al vencimiento para pagar una vez que la cosecha se haya levantado y comercializada.
texts.en:
This client is a small farmer who grows basic staples such as corn, beans, and wheat. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies such as urea, insecticides, as well as pay for labor. He is married and has been in the agricultural trade.

The loans he has requested have been repaid as soon as his crops are harvested and sold.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy weaves and hair braids

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavugho, leader du groupe d’affaire «Rafiki», est  entrepreneur, âgée de 40  ans, mariée, mère de plusieurs  enfants et petits fils et filles. Son mari est un chômeur. Elle est  vendeuse de d’habits dames (pagnes). Elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre il ya 7 ans. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  6 cycles avec  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut  reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  15 pièces de pagnes à marchander  et réaliser d’autres micros projets de la famille.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et scolariser ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Client Kavugho, the leader of the business group “Rafiki,” is an entrepreneur.  She is 40 years old, married and the mother of several children and grandchildren.  Her husband is unemployed.  She sells women’s clothing (pagnes, which are brightly colored lengths of cloth).  She has been involved in this money-making work for 7 years.  She has been through 6 loan cycles with Hekima.  The first money she had came from her husband.  This new loan will allow her to buy 15 pagnes to sell and to carry out some other plans for the family.   She would also like to see her children grow up more comfortably and to be educated.  This client thanks Hekima for its work to benefit poor women who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to pay for 15 pagnes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 58 years old, married to Charles. She sells poultry and has been in the business for the past eight years. She gets a monthly income of KES 3,500.

This is her third loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy poultry. She will buy dairy cattle with the anticipated profits. Her dream is to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Todo Lo Puede En Cristo - Huancayo Group

texts.es: María Elena  D. 43 años D. edad casada, con un hija D. 14 años D. edad se caracteriza por ser muy alegre y ocurrente, ella es presidenta D. la Alcancía comunal “ TODO LO PUED. EN CRISTO”, elegida por ser carismática y tratable, ella tiene su bodeguita en su casa, el cual reparte a pedido D. sus clientes por su zona, ella usara el préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para su bodega y así satisfacer mejor los pedidos D. sus clientes, ella sueña con hacer crecer su negocio D. la bodega. Está ubicada en la segunda fila lado derecha con chompa negra y al lado D. ella esta su hija menor D. edad.
texts.en:
43-year old María Elena is married and has a 14-year old daughter. She is a lively and clever woman, and also the president of the Todo lo PueD. en Cristo Community Bank. She was chosen because she is charismatic and easy to get on with.

María Elena runs a small store out of her house and also delivers items to customers who live in her neighbourhood. She plans to use the loan money to buy more merchandise for her store so that she can better fulfill the requests of her customers. Her dream is to have a bigger business one day.

in the photo María Elena is second on the right wearing a black sweater. Her daughter is next to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Aguacatitla Group

texts.es:
Grupo Aguacatitla (que significa lugar de los aguacates)
Doña Lucia es natal de un pueblito cuyo nombre significa piedras acomodadas, su lengua materna es el náhuatl, la señora comúnmente se dedica a las labores del hogar y también lleva a su niña al kínder, pero también atiende un negocio de tienda de abarrotes que inicio desde hace 4 años, ella piensa invertir más pues de esa forma ayudaría a su esposo en los gasto de la familia.
La señora Lucia es líder del grupo Aguacatitla cuyos integrantes son:
María Victoria-juegos de video
Marcolina-perfumeria
Rosa-venta de ropa
El grupo Aguacatitla está felizmente agradecido con KIVA y FRAC por el crédito que les fue otorgado, el cual se está invirtiendo en negocios de comercio, el grupo está totalmente seguro que sus inversiones serán prósperas.
texts.en:
Grupo Aguacatitla (Group of the place of the avocados) Doña Lucia was born in a small village whose name means “adapted stones”. Her mother tongue is náhuatl (an indigenous language). Doña Lucia usually dedicates herself to housework. She also takes her daughter to kindergarten and takes care of her business, a grocery shop that she began 4 years ago. She plans to invest more in the business since in this way she would help her husband with family expenses.

Señora Lucia is the leader of Grupo Aquacatitla whose other members are: María Victoria-video games Marcolina-perfume shop Rosa-clothing sales

Grupo Aguacatitla is very thankful to Kiva and FRAC for the loan, which will be invested in commercial businesses. The group is certain that their investments will prosper.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, cookies, toilet paper, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca de 41 años, es una mujer casada. Ella y Jesús, su esposo vieron nacer a 2 hijos, que actualmente tienen 21 y 7 años. Esta familia vive en armonía bajo un techo propio, en el distrito de Huasahuasi. Francisca y Jesús se dedican hace muchos atrás a la agricultura. En los terrenos agrícolas de su propiedad siembran papa, arvejas y olluco; productos que al cosecharlos derivan al mercado mayorista para su venta al por mayor. “Me conviene vender de esa manera, por que me evito que mis cosechan se pudran o malogren, así también gano dinero al instante”, explica. A la vez, en los pastizales y campo abierto que cuenta su comunidad alimentan a sus animales, como son: carneros y chanchos. A éstos cría y engorda. Después de 4 o 5 meses los vende, ganando por ganado alrededor de 100 soles. En los meses de diciembre y enero, los ofrece a mayor precio, por ser fechas de fiestas navideñas y año nuevo. Francisca, se ve más adelante como una productora mayorista que expenderá verduras, hortalizas y tubérculos al por mayor, no sólo en la ciudad de Tarma, sino que piensa viajar a otras ciudades. Sabe que el precio fuera de la ciudad le será más conveniente. Con su apoyo podrá acceder a su préstamo número 13 de MFP, por eso se muestra firme en su decisión de pagar las cuotas en los días establecidos. Además comenta que compartir intereses y metas, es lo que más le agrada de su banco comunal. “Estoy preparando una siembra de papas para mayo, para eso compraré bolsas de abono y fertilizantes”, manifiesta. Sacando sus cálculos, Francisca invertirá 1200 soles aproximadamente.
texts.en:
Francisca, 41, is a married woman. She and Jesús, her husband, had two children who are currently 21 and 7 years old.   This family lives in harmony in their own house in the Huasahuasi district.  Francisca and Jesús have been farmers for many years.  They grow potatoes, peas and ‘olluco’ [an Andean tuber] on farmland they own and when harvested they are sold at the local wholesale market.  “It’s advantageous for me to sell that way because I avoid my crops rotting or deteriorating and this way I earn money instantly,” she explains.  They also feed their animals, calves and pigs, on the community’s open fields and pasture lands.  She raises these animals to fatten them up and sell after about four or five months; she sells them head by head for about 100 soles.  During December and January she sells them at higher prices because of Christmas and New Year.

Francisca sees herself in the future as a wholesaler selling vegetables, leafy vegetables and tubers at wholesale not only in the city of Tarma but she also plans to go to other cities.  She knows that prices outside the city will be more convenient.

With your support she’ll be able to access MFP loan #13 so she is firm in her determination to make her installment payments according to the established payment plan.  She also comments that sharing interests and goals is what she likes best about her communal bank.  “I’m preparing for the May potato planting so will buy sacks of manure and fertilizer,” she states.  According to her calculations, Francisca will invest 1200 soles approximately.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulls for slaughtering

loans.name: Miguel Christian

texts.es:
Miguel sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Miguel sigue estudiando la carrera profesional de Turismo en una de las universidades particular de la ciudad del Cusco y está cursando el séptimo semestre. Actualmente, Miguel está trabajando en una de las veterinarias de la ciudad del Cusco. 
En esta oportunidad Miguel requiere el préstamo para pagar su matricula de la universidad.     

Miguel se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Miguel continues to participate in the communal back "Chaska" of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.  Miguel continues studying the professional tourism career in one of the universities in the city of Cusco and is in his seventh semester.  Currently, Miguel is working in one of the veterinary clinics in the city of Cusco.  At this opportunity, Miguel needs the loan to pay for his university tuition.  

Miguel finds himself grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium and thus, promises to complete his payments according to the timeline.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a very hard working woman who has been practicing mixed farming for over five years. She also has a hotel, which she manages as a secondary business. She is 29 years old and married. She and her husband have two children. 

She is applying for her second loan. She plans to use part of the loan to buy farm inputs like maize seeds and fertilizers and the other part to purchase more food stuffs for her hotel business. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children’s school fees. 

She hopes to develop her business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is a married woman with 2 children. She and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. Michel's husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Michel sells his catch at the market. Michel does her best to improve their income and sustain their family.

Michel has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. Michel hopes to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia, de 37 años, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos. Juntos habitan en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Aurelia, trabaja como agricultor desde los 16 años, y actualmente cultiva cacao. Nos comenta que cuando se separó de su esposo ella se quedó con los bienes de la familia, además de encargarse ella sola por el bienestar de sus hijos. Generalmente trabaja con la ayuda de peones, quienes le facilitan en el cultivo y cosecha, así solo le quedaría expenderlo a los acopiadores de cacao, siendo ellos los que trasladan sus productos desde el campo hacia su centro de acopio. Aurelia en un futuro piensa en construir una vivienda con material noble, y para ello está ahorrando. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Ella esta agradecida con los integrantes de su banco comunal por permitir acceder al grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, por lo que contratará peones.
texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Aurelia is a single mother who has four children.  They live together in the populated center of Canayre in the Llochegua District.  Aurelia has worked as a farmer for 16 years and she currently grows cacao.  She tells us that when she left her husband she got the family's assets and she was also left to take care of her children on her own.  She usually works with the help of laborers who help with the planting and harvesting; that way all she has to do is pay the cacao collectors, who are the ones who transport her products from the fields to the collection center.  

In the future, Aurelia is thinking about building a home out of fine materials and she saving up to do this.  This will be her second loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time.  She is thankful to the members of her communal bank for letting her join.  She will invest the 1,000 nuevos soles in maintaining her fields by hiring laborers.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 37 year old married man.  He has a daughter who is 5 years old.  He describes himself to be an honest and God fearing man. 

He operates a retail store where he sells beauty and pesonal care products such as hairbands, cutex, razor blades etc.  He has been involved in this business for 6 years.  His business is located in a conducive environment.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more beauty products. 

Timothy's business goal is to expand his general store within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products such as hair bands, braids, cutex, etc

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos, se dedica a la venta de platillos típicos, tiene más de 5 años dedicándose al negocio, lo aprendió de su madre, la manera de vender es ambulante, desde las 3:00pm hasta las 7:00pm.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de yuca, papas, salsa, queso, aceite, que son los materiales  necesarios para la elaboración de los platillos típicos, este crédito le ayudara para invertir más en el negocio, su riesgo con la venta ambulante es la época de invierno, cuando por las tardes llueve y no les deja espacio para salir a vender.
Los sueños de Ana son mantener el negocio y crecer, ya que esto le permitirá mejorar los ingresos para sus padres.

loans.use: Compra de yuca, papas, salsa, queso, aceite.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 62 years old and lives in Canunan, Guipos, ZDS. She is widowed with 3 children.                       

To earn a living, Lorelie has a business selling snacks. She earns about 4 thousand pesos each month doing this type of work. Lorelie has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.                   

Lorelie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Lorelie would like to have more distribution of her snacks.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Mama Egue's Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis le 20 Novembre 2013, il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  Mama (assise à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 35 ans mariée et mère de 05 garçons. Elle est vendeuse de beignets, d'huile raffiné et de condiments. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 1 bidon de 20 litres d’huile à 15000f, 1 sac de 50 kg de farine  à 20000f , 01 sac de sucre de 50 kg à 25000f pour faire ses beignets et des légumes pour les revendre en détails.

 Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte renforcer ses épargnes et aider son mari dans la dépenses quotidienne et le paiement de la scolarités de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A good relationship exists between the members of this group created on November 20, 2013. They stand in solidarity and help one another. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Mama (sitting all the way to the right) is the group’s highlighted borrower. She is 35 years old, married, and mother to five boys. She sells fried dough, oil, and condiments. She procures her supplies from weekly markets and then retails the products.

With this new loan, she plans to purchase one jug of oil (15,000 XOF), one bag of flour (20,000 XOF), 1 bag of sugar (20,000) and to give seed money (5,000 XOF). With profits, she increases her savings.

loans.use: to buy one jug of oil (15,000 XOF), one bag of flour (20,000 XOF), 1 bag of sugar (20,000) and to give seed money (5,000 XOF).

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a retail business where he sells movies and electronics. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics, movies. His business goal is to open another branch within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics, movies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 56 years old married with 5 children, 2 are still depending on her even after finishing school due to unemployment. She has been in this business for 8 years and deals more with fast moving consumer goods e.g. rice, sugar, maize flour and cereals. Cereals have higher returns and their prices are not as volatile as the rest of the products.

loans.use: She would like to stock cereals because of having higher returns.

loans.name: Inglab

texts.en: Inglab has been engaged in this business for 6 years. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region, settled in Sumgait city. He has 2 children. He has his own mini shop. This 63-year-old man is the only breadwinner in family. Having borrowed the loan amount of $300 from Normicro he rented the grocery store. The second time he borrowed $500 and bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc. Now Inglab wants loan amount of $500 to increase the range of goods and to buy the new refrigerator.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods and to buy the new refrigerator

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.en:
In Ukraine, many people prefer wearing sports shoes to any other kind of shoe. Evgeniy is one of those people. After trying out a couple of other business ventures, he found that he liked selling sports shoes the most. He credits his success to finding a good market opportunity and to timely financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine. His integrity and hard-working attitude have allowed him to establish his business and keep it stable.

After 7 years in business, Evgeniy was recently able to add on to his sales location. Today he is requesting $1000 to stock this additional retail space with new brands of shoes, which he will be able to purchase in bulk. Evgeniy and his wife Anjela are the proud parents of two sons, who they are currently helping through college. His desire is to increase his productivity and raise his net income so that he can continue to provide for his family.

В Україні багато людей віддають перевагу спортивному взуттю. Євген - один з таких людей. Спробувавши себе в різних сферах, він вирішив, що продаж спортивного взуття йому насправді до душі. Євген вважає, що досяг успіху, бо знайшов власну нішу на ринку та отримав вчасну підтримку від „Надії України”. Порядність та наполеглива праця допомогли йому досягти стабільності в роботі. Євген займається цим бізнесом вже 7 років. Зовсім нещодавно він зміг придбати нову торгову точку. Зараз він просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб оптом закупити товар для нового кіоску та поповнити асортимент взуття новими моделями. Євген з дружиною Анжелою виховують двох синів, які вчаться в університеті. Євген хоче підвищити продуктивність торгівлі та отримати чистий прибуток для того, щоб і надалі забезпечувати родину усім необхідним.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old and works with his brother in a laundry. He and his brother are responsible for taking care of a big family. This is his first loan from AL-Aman. He want sto paint the shop and repair the laundry machine. He wants to increase his income and open a new branch of his shop in another place.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Paint the shop and repair the laundry machine

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora is a weaver. She weaves blankets made out of "poyvi" which is a type of fabric/needlework traditional to Carapegua, the city where she lives. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in college.

She started weaving about 17 years ago which she believes is a talent she inherited from her mother. Since she couldn't finish school, Isidra had to work at a very young age to survive. She later married Aurelio Britez who is a hard worker and he sells the "poyvi" blankets that she makes by travelling throughout the city.

Aurelio travels with his dad who knows the city like the palm of his hands. He taught Aurelio how to be a good salesman and a good business man too. They travelled as far as Asuncion (Paraguay's capital) once a week to sell blankets to the stores around the capital.

Both Isidra and Aurelio want to one day see all their kids graduate from college and to get a good job without having to suffer or to put up with difficult times in the streets like bad weather in order to feed their family.

Isidora is requesting a loan in order to purchase a vast amount of thread in different colors to meet her clients high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Isidra es tejedora de mantas de “poyvi” un tejido tradicional de la zona donde reside: Carapeguá, ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos todos cursando actualmente sus estudios secundarios. La actividad la inició hace 17 años por que es una habilidad heredada de su madre. Ya que no pudo terminar sus estudios, Isidra, tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para generar ingreso y ganarse el pan de cada día, luego se casó con Aurelio Brítez, una persona muy emprendedora que se encarga de vender de forma ambulante las mantas de poyvi que teje Isidra. Aurelio viaja con su padre, un antiguo conocedor del rubro, quien le enseño la habilidad en las ventas de estos productos a crédito en los barrios residenciales de Asunción (capital del Paraguay). Es así que Aurelio viaja una vez por semana a la capital a vender las mantas y frazadas a tiendas de la capital. Ambos sueñan con ver a sus hijos terminar sus estudios y adquirir una profesión, sin tener que pasar el duro sacrificio de soportar en la calle frío, lluvia y calor para acercar el pan para la familia. Isidra solicita el crédito pues necesita comprar hilos de algodón de diferentes colores y en grandes cantidades, ya que han aumentado la demanda de mantas de diferentes colores hecha por sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase more thread in multiple colors

loans.name: Reina Martínez

texts.en:
Reina, 57, is married and is mother of a large family. In fact, the couple has eleven children.

Reina owns a clothing store. She started her business ten years ago. She buys garments in Santo Domingo, the capital, or Dajabón, located on the border with Haiti, where she finds variety and good prices.

The businesswoman is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase a large amount of clothes to be sold during the holiday season. Given this loan, Reina will be able to help her husband deal with their housing issues.

loans.use: To purchase garments to be sold during the holiday season and expand her business

loans.name: Tulia

texts.es:
Tulia belongs to the Banco Comunal Fray Martín of the A. H. Faustino Maldonado Mz E Lt 9, of the Calleria district in the Department (State) of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and is the mother of 5 children. She's separated from her husband and supports her children on her own. For this reason, Tulia, with her first loan provided by Manuela Ramos of 300.00 soles, decided to set up a small stand to sell chickens.

Tulia gets up at 3 in the morning to slaughter and cut up the chickens and sell them. Her children help her with the housework, giving that she finishes selling at 10 in the morning.

With the recent loan received from from Manuela Ramos which will be paid back in 4 months, she will be able to extend her reach to sell to more people, buy 2 cages in which to put the chickens, buy 100 chickens and a plastic container in which to store the giblets.

Tulia is very happy that she can count on this business. Thanks to her business, she can educate her children and pay for the needs of the home.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Tulia pertenece al Banco Comunal Fray Martín, del A. H. Faustino Maldonado Mz E Lt 9 del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, está separada D. su esposo y sola tiene que trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Por esta razón es que Tulia, con el primer préstamo D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300.00 soles, deciD. poner un pequeño puesto D. venta D. pollos (aves para consuno). Tulia se levanta a las 3.00 D. la mañana para beneficiar a los pollos y venderlos, sus hijos le ayudan con las tareas D. la casa dado que termina D. vender a las 10.00 D. la mañana. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos el cual será pagado en 4 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 2 jabas para poner los pollos, 100 pollos y un embace para conservar la menudencia. Tulia está muy contenta D. contar con este negocio, dado que gracias a ello pueD. educar a sus hijos así como costear las necesidades D. la casa.

loans.use: Purchase of chicken cages and chickens and be able to extend her reach to sell to more customers.

loans.name: Felipa Consuelo

texts.es:
The case of Mrs. Felipa R. is a great example for many people. She has worked selling wallets and simple clothing among a variety of products. She started her business 6 years ago with a sum of C$200.00 from her savings.

She started with a small basket, as a street vendor. After obtaining a greater volume of merchandise of varied products to offer to her customers, she established her business in the second street of the market of la Terminal, which is a fixed stand out in the open.

She is a single mother with four children, who works very hard to encourage them in their progress of studying elementary and high school.

She has been affiliated with Ceprodel for a year, having gotten 9 loans which have doubtlessly allow her to improve her business and diversify her market including other products of imitation jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Un gran ejemplo para muchas personas es el caso de la señora Felipa R. el cual por mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a la venta de billeteras, prendas sencillas de vestir entre otros productos variados. Comenzó su negocio desde hace 6 años con un monto de C$200.00 producto del ahorro que la señora tenia.

Ella inicia con una canasta pequeña ambulante y después creció obteniendo mayor cantidad de mercadería de productos variados para ofrecer a su clientela ubicando su negocio en la segunda calle del mercado de la Terminal que es un puesto fijo al aire libre.

Es una señora madre soltera con 4 hijos que lucha todos los días para salir adelante en su proceso de estudios en niveles de primaria y secundaria.

Fue afiliada hace un año en Ceprodel quien le asistió con financiamiento habiéndoles otorgado 9 créditos que sin lugar a duda han podido mejorar su negocio logrando diversificar su mercado con otros productos del mismo ramo de bisuterías.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de productos)

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en: Mariyam, is a 50-year-old widow who has a food stall where she sells crispy chips, snacks, etc. She also sells veils to earn income for the family since her husband passed away. From both of her businesses she earns $85 a month. She requests a loan of $75 to expand her businesses, and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 24 years old and a married woman.  She is from  Potoci, a small town near  Mostar. She is  married  and together with her husband runs a coffee shop.  They have one child , 3 years old, and Aida  took this loan  in the amount of  US$ 750 to buy equipment  for their work.  Her wish is to  start  improving this business  that will  provide  her  with regular  income and employment.

loans.use: Buying equipment for their cafe

loans.name: Basheeran's Group

texts.en: Group leader Basheeran Z. is married with two sons and one daughter.  Her children are aged eight, four and two years, respectively. Her husband operates a small grocery store where he sells many staple items. Her family's income is just enough to make ends meet.  The other members of this group who are also requesting loans are: Parwez F., who requires loan to expand her family’s fruits business; Safia G., who wants to purchase a rickshaw; Kaleem M., who also wants to expand her general store; and Khalida P., who wants to invest in her own business.  As a group, they are requesting from Kiva a loan of $1,150.00.

loans.use: To buy a stock of items for a grocery store.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu S. is a fishmonger. She is married and has 2 dependents. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then later sells the fish to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi T., 49 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 1997. She has two grown-up children. When she first joined TYM Fund, she just borrowed 50USD to raise chicken. After that first loan, she earned 20USD in profit. Although the profit was small, it helped her understand the benefits of being a member of TYM Fund. In 11 years, she has continuously taken loans and used it to breed animals; her income increases significantly. In total, she has borrowed up to 3000USD. Mrs. T. is a fishman, and what he earns is also used towards the repayments. With the average monthly income of 200USD, Mrs. T. wants to borrow 950USD to buy buffaloes, cows, and fertilizers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Tám, 49 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1997. Chị có 2 con đã trưởng thành. Khi mới vào chị chỉ vay 50USD để chăn nuôi gà. Cuối vòng vốn chị lãi được 20USD. Số lãi tuy nhỏ nhưng chị Tám đã thấy được tiện ích khi tham gia Quỹ. Trong 11 năm chị liên tục vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Tổng số vốn vay của Quỹ lên đến 3000USD. Nguồn hoàn trả tuần được lấy từ việc đánh bắt cá của chồng nên công việc diễn ra rất thuận lợi. Với thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng là 200USD, chị Tám đề nghị xin vay 950USD để mua trâu bò nuôi và dành một phần tiền mua phân bón.

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeun Y., 48, is single and lives with her widowed sister, brother, and four nephews, two of whom are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road Number Five, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Khoeun and her brother and sister have been farming since they were young. She has also started selling grocery items in front of her house. Her house is on lower ground than her neighbor’s, and so it floods during the rainy season. Mrs. Khoeun is requesting a loan of US$800 to fill up the ground around her house.

loans.use: Household improvements

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Mwanahawa C. who is married and has four children aged between 25 and 38. In 2005, Mwanahawa established her bun business. Mwanahawa requires a loan in order to purchase additional wheat flour, and cooking oil. In the future, Mwanahawa plans to increase the production. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Cosset Aminta

texts.es:
Cosset, 26, lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood, and is married. Her husband works and contributes to the house expenses.
Cosset opened a small corner store with her own savings five years ago. The loan she is requesting this time is to purchase a larger variety of products to offer to her current customers and to attract other customers.
A few years ago, Cosset lost her little son. Her business has helped her to overcome her grief over what happened; she invests much time and effort in her business.
She hopes one day to rebuild her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Cosset habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, tiene 26 años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Cosset tiene una pulpería con cinco años en las ventas, ella inició con fondos propio. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo en la inversión de la pulpería para ofrecer a sus clientes variedades de productos así como la captación de otros clientes. Hace algunos años Cosset perdió a su pequeño hijo, su negocio la ha ayudado a sobreponerse y sobrellevar lo que pasó, ella le dedica mucho esfuerzo y tiempo a su negocio. Espera poder algún día reconstruir su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to sell in corner store

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en: Mrs. Soeung L., 46, sells a variety of grocery products and earns US $2.00 per day. Her husband, Mr. Ngok Hov, 40, is a motorcycle taxi driver. They live in Orchar Commune, Battambang Province, and have five children, all of whom are studying in school and living in the family home. They have discussed increasing their income. Facing the obstacle of lacking capital, L. requested a Kiva loan of US $400 to buy a second-hand motorcycle to replace her husband's old one for his business and to use the rest to stock more groceries to sell. The loan will enable them to increase their income to sustain her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband's business and more groceries to sell

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say I. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham.  Every day, Say bakes Khmer cakes and sells them in her village's market, thereby earning about $2.  Her husband works as a rice farmer, and must labour exceptionally hard every day to overcome the difficulties presented by poor weather conditions, a lack of rain, and inflation, which has increased the prices of fertilizer and rice seed.  He now earns only $2 each day.  In order to increase her family's income and overall prosperity, Say is requesting a loan of $350, which will be used to put one of her daughters through a school for professional tailors and allow Say's family to begin the construction of a tailor shop for their daughter.

loans.use: To pay the fees for tailoring school.

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en:
Miss Bhawani S. is a single woman who lives in Tangal. Tangal is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Miss Bhawani S. lives with her mother and sister.

Miss Bhawani S. is engaged in a sweet shop. All her family members equally contribute to the same shop. They make different types of sweet foods in her shop. They opened their shop nearly 10 years ago. Now Miss S. is requesting for a Rs 30000.00 loan to buy food ingredients for making the sweet foods.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients for her work

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoeun L. and her husband, Mr. Sin Kroch, both 46-year-old silk weavers living on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1980 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family house; three study in local school, and one daughter is acquiring tailoring skills.

Hoeun has been a silk weaver for 20 years, a skill she learned from her relatives. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Hoeun is now requesting a loan of $600 to purchase additional silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Abdul Wahad

texts.en:
Abdul Wahad is 32 years old and he lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is married with two children and has a small restaurant in Kabul. He is requesting a small loan for his business because he wants to increase the size of his shop. This will improve his income and provide a better living for his family.

He is requesting an individual loan of 50000 Afghan over a 12 month term. He wants to expand his business, buying new tables and chairs for his restaurant. This will attract more customers to the restaurant and increase his business.

He is very happy that this small loan process is available in Afghanistan. This helps small business people in Afghanistan. He wants to thank all lenders.
________________________________________________________________________

loans.use: To buy new tables and chairs for his restaurent

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita G. is 52 years old and has been a resident of San Manuel Naguillan, Isabela since she was born.  She chooses to remain single and has adopted a child.  Through her small business of managing a village store, she has been able to send her son to school to pursue his vocational course as an electrician.  However, due to life difficulties, she was not able to maintain her store business.  

Angelita has been engaged in a buy and sell business for six years in the public market.  She is asking for a loan of $200 as additional capital for her buy and sell business and to help her to re-open her village store.This would  further increase her daily income. She hopes to maintain the good relationship she has with her adopted son.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en:
This is Abibatu B., Mohamed B., Isatu S., Memuna K. and Marie B.. They call their group Hold Tight, a Krio phrase for “Be Firm”. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. They always repay their loans in full. Their previous loan was for Le 800,000 each. This helped them a lot. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan, and thus were able to solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000 each to add to their businesses.

Abibatu (right) is the leader of this group. She was born in Sanda, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-four years of age, married and a mother of five children between the ages of one and thirteen years. She has been a businesswoman for the past six years now. She sells ready-to-wear clothes for women and "gara lappers" (locally dyed clothes).

With this loan of Le 1,000,000, Abibatu will buy two pieces of "brillians” and more ready read-to-wear clothes for women to add into her business. (One piece of "brillian" is about thirty yards of white cotton used to dye gara clothe).

loans.use: Invest in business by buying ready-to-wear clothes for women

loans.name: Mall

texts.en: Mall L., 27, makes US$2.50 each day selling fish in the Siem Reap province. She is married and has three children living at home to support. Her husband, Rom Huon, makes approximately US$5 every day as a construction worker. Mall L. would like a loan of US$900 to purchase a motorbike to transport her fish. This will help to reduce her daily transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Veronica Del Socorro

texts.es: Verónica del Socorro L. tiene 36 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Verónica tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Verónica es la compra  venta de mercadería en general. Hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, Doña Verónica decidió escoger este tipo de trabajo por ser uno de las fuentes de ingresos mas accesibles además le gusta mucho este tipo de trabajo. Los propósitos de Verónica con su negocio son de mantener a sus clientes ya que algunos no reciben la atención que se merecen. El financiamiento que esta solicitando es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de cosméticos, ropa interior, ropa para niños, ropa para damas y caballeros. El deseo de Verónica es dejarles este negocio a sus hijos para que el día de mañana pueda sobrevivir. La cantidad que solicita es de C$7.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Verónica del Socorro L., 36, is married and has 3 children who work. Verónica buys and sells general merchandise. She has had her business for 6 years. Verónica chose this type of work because it is a good source of accessible income, and she really likes this type of work. The business goal that Verónica has is to keep her customers happy because some of them do not receive the attention they deserve. The loan is for working capital to buy cosmetics, underwear, children’s clothes, and clothes for women and men. Verónica’s wish is to leave the business to her children to help them survive in the future. The amount of the loan is $375 (7000 NIO).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. is one of the active members of HSPFI. She has done well with her previous loans, which has made her business run well. Teresita is married with five children. Her husband assists her in their business. They both want to strive hard for their children who are all in school.

Teresita is very happy with the result of her investments and she is determined to continue growing these. Her previous loans are already repaid due to the success of her business. Teresita and her husband agreed to put up another mini grocery store in front of the school in their town. She is now requesting an additional loan of PHP 11,000.00 to finance the installation of her new grocery store.

loans.use: Finance the installation of new grocery store

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jorge Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Jorge G. se dedica a la actividad ganadera desde muy joven habiendo adquirido amplia experiencia porque fue entrenado junto con su hermano en la crianza de ganado.

Actualmente el señor Jorge ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dos vacas paridas para su hato y así sacarles el máximo provecho con el fin de obtener ingresos para continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo por ser él la cabeza del hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge G. has worked with cattle since he was very young, having gotten a lot of experience by learning, along with his brother, how to raise cattle. Mr. Jorge has come to Ceprodel today to apply for a loan to buy 2 calving cows for his herd. In this way, he can get the most from them and make more money, so he can continue maintaining his family who really needs his help since he’s the head of the household.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de dos vacas paridas

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is thirty-five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children, three sons and two daughters. According to her, her children are either in primary and junior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Gladys is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She procures her products from Dormaa. She says her store is by the road side. Gladys has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk to increase her stock. She is hopeful that she will expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions for her store.

loans.name: Maylen

texts.en:
Maylen T. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis, Occidental. She is 28 years old. Maylen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maylen owns and operates a hog-raising business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Maylen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Maylen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maylen has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Maylen is requesting a new loan of 2000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Maylen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana O. is seventy-one years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are grown ups and out of school. She lives with her husband and some grandchildren in a family house in a busy commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Juliana works to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She is a poultry farmer, dealing in birds such as fowl, turkey, etc. She distributes mostly to food vendors and restaurant operators but also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Juliana has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy poultry in bulk. She aspires to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy poultry in bulk

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 13, 9 y 8 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años se dedica al bordado de fustanes y al tejido a mano, trabaja en su casa durante todo el día, mientras atiende las necesidades de su familia. Rosa solo atiende pedidos y el precio que cobra es de acuerdo a la complejidad del diseño de los bordados. Debido a la calidad y creatividad en su trabajo han notado el aumento de sus pedidos, pues sus antiguos clientes la vienen recomendando con otras persona, lo cual favorece sus ganancias. Rosa quiere  producir más bordados y esto sólo es posible contratando los servicios de personal, este proyecto será lo más próximo que va realizar. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal porque la conocen como una persona sincera y con cualidades para un trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando se invertirá en la compra de hilos de diversos colores, telas  y lana al por mayor.
texts.en:
Rosa is thirty years old. She lives with her husband and three children ages 13, 9, and 8 in their own house. Since she was six years old she has been embroidering cotton cloth and hand knitting. She does this work at home all day while she takes care of her family. Rosa only does custom work and she charges her customers based on the complexity of the embroidery design. She has noticed an increasing demand for her work because of its quality and creativity. Previous customers recommend her to other people which help to increase her earnings. Rosa would like to produce more embroidered items. This is only possible if she hires other employees. This is the next step for her business. This is Rosa’s first loan with MFP. She was invited to be a part of the cooperative bank because she is known as an honest person with the ability to work on a team. With the money that she has requested, she will buy many colors of thread, fabric and wool at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy materials to be used for embroidery.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 05 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Alto Alianza .
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de maíz y fideos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1100.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de una maquina tostadora para el tostado de maíz, fideo, trigo, arroz  que luego los vende el los mercados de Puno.

Su deseo es seguir continuar con su trabajo y construir su casa.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sonia belongs to the “3 de Mayo II” communal bank, which is located in the Puno District, Puno Province, Puno Department. She is 40 years old, married, the mother of 5 children, and she completed high school studies. She lives in the Barrio Alto Alianza neighborhood. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 years. She had an initial loan of 300 PEN, which she used to buy corn and noodles. At this time, she needs a loan of 1,100 PEN to purchase a machine for toasting corn, noodles, wheat, and rice, which she sells in the markets in Puno. She hopes to continue with her work and to build her house. She likes the savings and the punctuality at the group meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a toasting machine for toasting corn

loans.name: Tith

texts.en:
Tith S., age 49, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and her children in Phnom Penh City. She is engaged in a business of sewing and designing clothes at her home, earning approximately 3 USD per day. To make a living, her husband has to commute from place to place to work as a construction worker, earning 8 USD per day, which is the primary source of income for her family. The family is also assisted by two of her children who are employed in a local garment factory with an income of 2 USD per day each.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate in an additional business as a motor-taxi driver. With the remainder of the loan, she wants to buy wood for her husband to use in the construction business. By doing so, she believes that her husband will be able to generate maximum income to increase the standard of living for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for a taxi business and wood for use in a construction business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 40 years old, is married to Bonifacio who works as a farmer in their village. They have been blessed with eight children: Bryan Jhon, April Gay, Christian Mae, Jay-Jay, Jobelle, Ebony Dhaine, and Jhon Jerico. All of their children are enrolled in public school. Some are in college and high school while some are in the elementary level. The family lives peacefully in Barangay Annayatan, Enrile, Cagayan. 

Jocelyn aims to send all her children to college but she is worried because of financial difficulties that they are experiencing. However, she believes that by patience and hard work, she can achieve her dreams and to be able to provide for the needs of their children. She wants the children to be able to finish their studies.  

They manage both a furniture business and a hog-raising business. Their income in the business is of big help thus, she wants to maintain and somehow become sustainable for the progress of their family. She also wanted to request for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 for further improvement of their small businesses.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La Sra. Herminia D. de 35 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Alejandro Ferreira de 42 años de edad, ellos tienen la dicha de tener  3 hijos todos en edad escolar.
