   Doña Herminia es comerciante y docente, ella empezó a realizar esta actividad aproximadamente en el año 2.002; con el capital que llegaron ahorrar del sueldo que tiene como docente, desde ese tiempo invirtieron en cabinas telefónicas para generar  un ingreso aparte de su salario, en la actualidad vende  también golosinas y accesorios para incrementar sus ingresos.
   Ella invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías, con lo cual lograría tener un más stock de productos en ofertas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia D. is 35 years old and is married to Mr. Alejandro Ferreira, who is 42 years old. They have the joy of having 3 children, all of whom are in school. Mrs. Herminia is a merchant and teacher. She started pursuing this activity around 2002, with the capital that she has saved from her salary as a teacher. Since this time, she invested in phone booths to earn an income apart from her salary. At present, she also sells sweets and accessories to increase her earnings. She will invest this loan in the purchase of more merchandise, so that she can offer a larger stock of products.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets, sodas, juices, dairy products, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Georgina Ancelma

texts.es: Georgina Ancelma C. tiene  53 años de edad, es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta mucho de su trabajo a pesar de los problemas de cáncer con lo que ha luchado.  Ella tiene 4 hijos a su cargo y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Su actividad económica es la compra de mercadería en general. Ella dio inicio hace mas de 17 años, cuando quedo desempleada ya que anteriormente laboraba como secretaria y con la ayuda necesaria de su esposo logro establecerse con el negocio de la venta de mercadería a pesar de que tenía muy pocos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio. el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de mercadería.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Teresia Wambui

texts.en:
Teresia is single and resides with her sister, Eunice. She has been in the tailoring business for four years and is requesting a loan of $550 to stock her stall with fabrics. She has numerous customers in the county council market where she operates her stall. Teresia was introduced to KADET through existing clients and she has no previous credit history. With her improved income, she plans on opening another shop. In the future, she hopes to own a piece of land. Teresia is very hardworking.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more fabric for tailoring shop

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: Maria Victoria tiene 45 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de comida. Hace más de 8 años que inicio este negocio, por lo que  presenta sus estudios finalizados hasta 6 grado, a pesar de no tener mucho conocimiento es una persona que ha sabido salir adelante. Tiene 2 hijos que viven de manera independiente, la mayoría de los vecinos de Doña Maria saben muy bien que ella cocina muy bien y que sus platillos son muy deliciosos, pues ella sabe que lo que más vende son las enchiladas y sus platanitos que pueden ser acompañados con cualquier comida. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y mejorar su producción. Su deseo es seguir obteniendo más fama con sus famosos platillos.
texts.en:
45-year old Maria Victoria earns her living by making and selling food. She started her business more than eight years ago. She studied up to sixth grade, and in spite of not having much education she is a person who knows how to get on in life. She has two children who are now independent. The majority of her neighbours in Doña Maria know that she is a good cook and that the dishes she makes are delicious. Maria Victoria says that the best-selling items are enchiladas and the bananas which can be served with any dish. The money she is asking for will be used for working capital and to increase production. Her wish is to become even more renowned for her cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance sells medicines at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a maternity home in the future. She is 57 years old and married with five children. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Boldmaa

texts.en:
C. Boldmaa is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her older son is a university student, her younger is in high school and her husband works as a taxi driver. Boldmaa operates a small hair salon in her town. She opened her business in 1997 in partnership with a close friend. She and her friend, who is also a hairdresser, started their business out of a small rented workspace.

Over the years, Boldmaa has grown her business into a successful and stable operation. In 2005, she used her savings to buy her own workplace. At this time she also gave her salon a name, "HANA". She has continued her success since 2005 and has since hired four more hairdressers to keep up with demand.

Boldmaa works hard to provide quality service to her many customers and hopes to continue her success in the future. She is requesting a 2,245,000 tugrug (~1580 USD) loan to purchase styling equipment and supplies for her salon.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase styling equipment and supplies

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie A., 27 years old, is a young farmer from Santa Josefa Agusan del Asur. She used to work in the city but because she was not able to finish her studies in college, she was not able to land better employment. She decided to go back and manage a small rice field.

Her experience in the field is very helpful. Now, she needs additional capital for her business. She would like to request a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her harvest and income.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona F. currently sells cooked food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer and sodas to sell.  Lona is 32 years old and is married to a police man. She has seven children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Andrea Fernanda

texts.es:
Andrea C. de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es ebanista con el tiene 2 hijos aun no están estudiando en la escuela. 

Andrea empezó con la venta de arroz a quintal con un pequeño capital que le presto su papa, poco a poco siguió adelante con el negocio.

Ahora ella reparte a muchas tiendas el arroz por quintal como comerciante mayorista, trabaja de lunes a domingos en compañía de su papa ya que le ayuda con la transportación del arroz, vende cada quintal de arroz a $ 27.00. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es que a veces los clientes se demoran en cancelar.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más arroz para poder agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar su propia casa y poner hay su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrea C. is 25 years old and lives in a semi-urban area in Paraiso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and has basic utilities (running water, electricity, etc.). Her husband is a carpenter with whom she has 2 young children who are not quite school-aged. Andrea started her business selling rice by the kilo (in large quantities, ~45 kg) with a small amount of capital her father lent her; little by little she has grown her business. Now, she acts as a wholesaler selling her rice to various retail stores; she works Monday to Sunday with her father who helps her with transportation. She sells each ~45 kg of rice for $27. One of the challenges she faces is that sometimes her customers are slow to pay her. With the loan, she will purchase more rice to grow her business. In the future, she would like to buy her own home and put up a more stable business there.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice sales

loans.name: Thelma Llema Group

texts.en: Thelma L. is from the village of Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Thelma is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. Thelma is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Thelma raises pigs for sale. Thelma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the seccnd loan taken out by Thelma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Madeline's Group

texts.en:
Madeline U. is from the town of Benito Soliven. She is 42 years old. Madeline is the leader of a 14-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Madeline U..

Madeline is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Madeline sells rice in the local community. Madeline has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Madeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Madeline is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Madeline's third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rachabali

texts.ru: Джураев Раджабали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 22 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Живет вместе с родителями. Его жена - домохозяйка. Отец находится в России на зарабатках. Сам Раджабали занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Создал все условия для продвижения своего бизнеса. Он, в основном, откармливает и продает скот. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 3 года. Кредит берет для покупки крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Rachabali DJ. lives in the Yavan district. He is 22 years old, married and has no children. He lives together with his parents. His wife is a homemaker, and his father is in Russia for work. Rachabali is involved in animal husbandry and breeds livestock at home. He created all of the conditions for moving his business forward. He primarily fattens and sells livestock. Rachabali has been involved in this business for 3 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita A. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years-old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Rita owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Rita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Martha Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Maribel Espinosa A.. Es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar, se desempeña como colectora de impuestos de todos los negocios del casco urbano, a diario tiene que caminar para llegar a cada negocio que no ha pagados sus impuestos. Este crédito lo solicito para la compra de todo el techo de su vivienda la cual se encuentra en mal estado por el paso del tiempo. Y de esta manera pasar un invierno sin mojarse.
texts.en:
La Sra. Martha Maribel Espinosa A.. Es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar, se desempeña como colectora de impuestos de todos los negocios del casco urbano, a diario tiene que caminar para llegar a cada negocio que no ha pagados sus impuestos. Este crédito lo solicito para la compra de todo el techo de su vivienda la cual se encuentra en mal estado por el paso del tiempo. Y de esta manera pasar un invierno sin mojarse.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra del techo de mi casa la cual se encuentra en mal estado.

loans.name: Laminyim East Lalam Sylivia Group

texts.en: L. Sylivia is a forty-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has seven children, three of whom are going to school. She also has three dependents. She deals with produce (sorghum, simsim [sesame]), and she has been in her business for over twelve years. She is using the loan to purchase produce such as sorghum and simsim for sale. She is managing to pay fees and her dream is to obtain at least two bulls for cultivation and one cow just for milk.

loans.use: To purchase produce, such as sorghum and simsim (sesame), for sale.

loans.name: Chimed

texts.en:
Chimed N., 35, a married father of three children, lives with his family in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic housing tent) in a rented yard. Having moved from another soum (a small village) called Olziit to their current soum four years ago, they have been residing in their present home for two years. Chimed's oldest two sons, aged 11 and 6, attend a local primary school.

Chimed has been operating an underwear and outerwear clothing trading business since 2007, having gained much experience in previous years. His sister helps him purchase his products from Ereen, a Chinese border town, and brings clothing to him. Possessed of good communication skills and focused on the future, Chimed has built a loyal customer base. He and his wife want to expand their business and build their own house in the future, so he is now requesting a loan of 1,900,000 MNT to purchase a variety of underwear and outerwear clothing for all ages.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of underwear and outerwear

loans.name: Tereso

texts.es: Tereso tiene 52 años, está casado con Maritza de 55 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos y con uno de sus nietos en su  vivienda propia. Hace más de 5 años planta café y plátano, trabajo que le ha ayudado a vivir cómodamente junto a su familia. En ocasiones su esposa lo ayuda en el trabajo y más en épocas de cosecha, ya que deben recolectar en el menor tiempo posible los granos de café. Pese que es tedioso ser agricultor, continua firme en su actividad agrícola ya que lo considera muy rentable por que le permite cubrir sus necesidades. Refiere además que le gusta mucho limpiar sus terrenos, de esa manera facilitaría el crecimiento de sus plantaciones, por otro lado le disgusta que los acopiadores traten de regatearle en los precios de sus cosechas, por la ley de la oferta y la demanda, por eso trata de trabajar con asociaciones o consorcios, quienes le pagan un precio justo que lo incentiva a continuar trabajando. Con el tiempo piensa adquirir terrenos propios ya que en la actualidad están cultivando en chacras arrendados, además planea incrementar su producción sobre todo de plátano que le genera ingresos quincenales. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está orgulloso de pertenecer a un grupo muy bien organizado, por eso le agrada laborar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 7 sacos de fertilizantes, además insumos que impidan el crecimiento de la maleza en sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Tereso, 52, is married to Maritza, 55, with whom he has 5 children. They live with 2 of their children and one of their grandchildren in their own home. For more than 5 years he has cultivated coffee and bananas, work that has helped him to live comfortably with his family. At times his wife helps him with the work, especially during the harvest seasons, since he has to harvest the coffee beans in the least amount of time possible. In spite of the fact that it is tedious to be a farmer, he is committed to his farming activities because he considers them to be very profitable, and this allows him to meet his basic needs. He says also that he very much enjoys clearing his lands, which makes it easier to grow his plants. On the other hand, he dislikes it when the wholesalers haggle over the prices of his harvests referring to the law of supply and demand. For this reason he tries to work with associations or consortia, who pay a fair price that encourages him to keep working. Over time he is thinking about acquiring his own land, since he is currently cultivating on rented fields. In addition, he plans to increase his production, particularly of bananas, which generate bi-weekly income. This is the second time that he has taken a loan with MFP, and he is proud to belong to a well-organized group and is pleased to work with its members. With the loan he requests he will buy 7 bags of fertilizer and supplies to prevent weed growth on his land.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 7 bags of fertilizer and supplies to prevent weed growth

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda, de 38 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Andres de 40 años y sus 3 hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. Trabajando arduamente, Lucinda ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora y media para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa, arveja, habas y olluco, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, para que pueda mejorar su economía. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, está muy feliz y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga este aporte que necesita. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas semillas de arveja, papa y olluco, asimismo comprará abono para aplicarlos a esta nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Lucinda, 38 years old, is a loving and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Andres, who is 40 years old, and their 3 children, for whom they wish to provide a better education. By the sweat of her brow, Lucinda has been able to bring from her fields the necessary products to support her family. She leaves her house before dawn every morning and walks close to an hour and a half to arrive at her land, where she has sown potatoes, peas, beans and olluco (an Andean tuber). She will later bring these products to sell at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What Lucinda likes most about her work is cultivating her land, as she feels that she is putting it to good use. She has working the land for 30 years. Lucinda feels that the most difficult aspect of her work is transporting the produce to Tarma, because the sacks that she carries are very heavy, and she gets tired. With time, she would like to put in grocery store so that she can increase her income. This is her ninth loan with MFP; she is very happy and would like to thank all the people who have made it possible for her to obtain the support that she needs. She is a very respected member of her community group because of the order that she brings to their meetings. With the 1500 nuevos soles that she asks for, she will buy new pea, potato, and olluco seeds, as well as fertilizer to put on this new crop.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pea, potato, and olluco seeds, as well as fertilizer

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
Roldan L. is from the town of Santa Josefa. He is 27 years old and has a one-year-old child. To make a living, Roldan owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Roldan has been engaged in his business for over 3 years.

Roldan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Roldan has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Roldan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ledelyn

texts.en:
Ledelyn S. is from the village of Olango. She is 45 years old, married and has 1 adult-aged child. Ledelyn owns and operates a business making and selling cooked food for daily meals. Ledelyn has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Ledelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ledelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Ledelyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Ledelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shara

texts.en: Shara J. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Shara is 39 years old and is married with a husband that is a security guard. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar in the market premises.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: C2133 Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
Caline was born in 1975 and is married with 3 children; the first one is 12, the next is 10, and the last is 7 years old. Caline is  a businesswoman but her husband is jobless and because of that, Caline works hard in order to provide for her family. Caline's business is well-known which is an advantage for her; the hours of her daily activities are from 8 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day except on Sunday. She has her own business, but she is also group leader of three people with various businesses.

Caline is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more bales of clothes. Once this loan is given, Caline will be able to attract more customers and satisfy their needs. With this customer satisfaction, she will be able to earn more profit to use in her business and for her family.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Floriza

texts.en:
Floriza J. is 39 years of age and is married to Ramon J.. They were blessed with three children whose ages are 23, 18 and 7. Unfortunately, they failed to send their two eldest children to college due to financial limitations. Their family income can only suffice to cover their daily consumption, and that is why the schooling of their children was limited to high school. Yet you can understand the determination of the couple to send their children to college to complete a degree. Both parents are hardworking and full of hopes and dreams; however, chances seldom come to them. 

That’s why in 2009 when the couple heard of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. a partner micro-finance institution of KIVA in the Philippines, Floriza immediately joined the program. Because of her dedication and commitment as a member, she was awarded several loans which she used in raising hogs. Now she is applying for another loan of 12,000 PHP to use as additional capital in her hog raising business. She plans to buy two more piglets and sacks of feed for them. 

She is hoping that this new capital will increase their profit so that she can earn for the schooling of her children and sustain their daily financial needs. Now that her skill in hog raising has developed, she plans to increase the number of pigs she is raising and build much better housing for them. She has plans for a piggery in the future. She is praying that the partnership of ASHI and KIVA will prosper so that she can have easy access to capital without collateral for her business plans.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Eudomilia

texts.es:
Eudomilia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito D. Mostaza y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro.
Eudomilia es casada, tiene 66 años y 7 hijos D. los cuales solo 1 esta a su responsabilidad y estudia en la ciudad D. lima.
Eudomilia junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, bebidas, productos para helados, vasos D. tecnopor.
Eudomilia solicita un préstamo D. 1700 para la compra D. vasos.
Los sueños D. Eudomilia son que sus hijos salgan adelante y comprar un carro para salir D. vacaciones.
texts.en:
Eudomilia is a member of the Granito D. Mostaza (Mustard Seed) Communal Bank and what she likes best about it is the incentive to save. She is married, 66 years old, and has 7 children, one of whom remains her responsibility and still studies in the city of Lima. Eudomilia, with her husband, operates a store in her home where she sells groceries in general, drinks, frozen products, and tecnopor glasses. She is soliciting a loan of 1,799 new sols to buy more glasses. Eudomilia's dreams are that her children should get ahead, and to buy a car to take on vacations.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING GLASSES TO SELL

loans.name: Corsine

texts.en: Corsine F. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Poblacion, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fish vending and pig fattening businesses. Her husband, Carlito F. Sr., age 31, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have three children who are 5 to 10 years old. This picture was taken after the center meeting because her fish business was already sold out early in the morning. Corsine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Corsine has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000; thus, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her fish vending business. She will continue to save up for the future and meet the daily needs of her family. Corsine F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Adilia Judith

texts.es:
ADILIA JUDITH V.  D. C.
Judith como socia del banco comunal Mujeres Valientes.  distrito D. calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. A sus 47 años queriendo  ayudar a su esposo  y ser  también quien apoye económicamente deciD. dedicarse a la venta D. perfumería  tiene muchos años vendiendo productos jomy.
Estos últimos años sigue con la venta D. perfumes y también lo combina con la venta D. productos que están por campañas como son los turrones en el mes D. octubre. Que los trae D. la cuidad D. lima, también confecciona sandalias con aplicaciones.
Con los ingresos que genera con su negocio pueD. solventar los gastos D. los 6 hijos que tiene en su poder.
Los  S/.2300 nuevos soles que tiene del préstamo que Manuela Ramos lo distribuirá comprando 50 kilos D. turrones  que lo envían D. la ciudad D. lima, lo D. mas lo invertirá  s/. 500.00 soles  en lo que es  perfumes  y lo complementara comprando 20 pares D.  zapatos D. la ciudad D. Trujillo.
La señora Judith se siente tranquila porque su negocio ha mejorado y  da gracias a Dios por la vida y a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad a tener acceso a su crédito.
texts.en:
Adilia Judith V. D. C.

Judith is a member of the community bank "Valiant Women". It is located in the district of Calleria within the community of Ucayali. She is 47 years old and she wanted to help her husband with the financial support of the family so she started her own business selling perfumes. She has been selling Jomy brand products for many years. These last several years she has been combining her perfume sales with the sale of other products featured in campaigns, as are fudge bars in the month of October. She imports quality products from Lima, though she makes sandals with appliqués for sale, too. 

The income that is generated by her business is used to proviD. for her 6 children who are in her care. 

She requests a loan of 2300 nuevos soles from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) will be used to  purchase 50 kilograms of fudge that are imported from the city of Lima. The remaining 500 soles will be used to purchase perfumes and 20 pairs of shoes from the city of Trujillo. Judith is very happy to see her business progressing and thank god for life and for Manuela Ramos for the opportunity to access this loan.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and fudge.

loans.name: Juana Salvadora

texts.es: Juana Salvadora tiene 48 años, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, uno mayor de edad. Tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de manualidades (arreglos florales para quince años, fiestas, misas entre otros) es una Señora muy creativa pues siempre está pensando en sacar a su familia adelante y así enseñarles a sus hijos esta actividad que es muy constructiva.  Este crédito es para la compra de materiales necesarios para sus arreglos como flores, papel, plástico entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Juana Salvadora is 48 years old.  She is a single mother and has two children, one of whom is grown up.  She has been making manual crafts for 8 years (flower arrangements for 15th birthday celebrations, fiestas, masses, etc.)  She is a very creative lady who is always thinking about getting her family ahead and teaching her children this activity which is very constructive.  This loan is to buy the necessary materials for her arrangements such as flowers, paper, plastic, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.en:
Pelegrin M. is in his early sixties and is a musician. He is married with six children and has been working as a musical performer for the past six years. Pelegrin works daily between 6:00 pm and 1:00 am, and his job earns him a low monthly profit.

This will be Pelegrin's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Pelegrin used his previous loan to buy an amplifier. This loan has since been successfully repaid. With his second loan, Pelegrin aims to purchase two microphones and a crossover machine. His dream is to one day open a studio from where he can produce his own music.

Pelegrin will share this loan with his loan group, Royal, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Pelegrin can be seen on the far right in the front row wearing suspenders.

loans.use: To buy Two mikes and crossover machine.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Christine has a business selling charcoal.  She changed her business enterprise from a bakery to charcoal selling.  She has been in this business for two months, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Christine sells her products at the market by means of retail. Christine has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling firewood.

The main business challenges for Christine include seasonality and thieves.  Her goal/aspiration for her business is to start selling wholesale only. Christine lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tools for his workshop

loans.name: Leah Chepkiriu

texts.en:
Leah Chepkirui K., a 39-year-old single woman, has a five-year-old son who is in primary school. They live in Moi's Bridge in Kitale, where she operates a retail shop selling sugar, milk, rice, soap, etc. Leah has been in this business for six years now, earning a monthly income of five thousand shillings.

This will be Leah's first loan from KADET LTD with which she plans to buy two bags of sugar worth Ksh.6,000, and one-and-a-half bags of rice worth Kshs.4,000. Additional income arising from the loan will be put toward the purchase of a dairy cow whose milk will be sold.

In the future Leah would like to educate her child to the highest level and also own her own wholesale shop where she can sell goods to retailers.

loans.use: To buy more stock including sugar, rice, tea leaves, and milk for sale

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang L. is a 41-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Kompong Thom Province. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. Seang L.’s husband also helps her in the business. Currently, Seang L. uses this land to grow a rice crop in the dry season for two months, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy many sacks of fertilizer for her crop to grow well.

loans.use: To buy many sacks of fertilizer for her crop to grow well.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S. is a 53-year-old woman who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. To earn a living, she cultivates rice on her own land which she inherited from her grandparents. Her husband also helps her with the farming. They have seven children; two are single and five are married. Two of their children are employed in various occupations and they always share their profit with Sem S. to use for daily expenses.

Sem S.’s daughter has been spending money on taxis to get to work because she doesn’t own a vehicle. To encourage her daughter, Sem S. is applying for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle, which will allow her daughter to commute to her work location.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.en:
Joaquin C. is from the village of Barucboc. He is 33 years old. Joaquin is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Joaquin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joaquin has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2009, Joaquin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joaquin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Joaquin is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Joaquin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel B., age 32, operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, raising pigs in their backyard. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. She is from the village of Taguilon near Dapitan City. She and her husband have four school-aged children. 

In 2009, Mabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for renovating the pig fence that surrounds the animals she tends. 

Mabel is now requesting a second loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase pig feed and additional piglets to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles G. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Angeles owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, junk foods and detergents in the local community. Angeles has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Angeles joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Angeles is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages and junk foods. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages and junk foods

loans.name: Nally

texts.en:
Nally is 42 years old and married with 1 child.  Nally runs a Sari-sari Store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, groceries, etc to sell in her sari-sari store.Nally  has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, milk, shampoo, sugar etc. 

In the future Nally would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase items for her general store

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a hardworking gentleman who is 25 years old.  He owns a general store in which he sells water, biscuits, exercise books, soap and juices. He has owned this store for 3 years.  Samuel is requesting a loan to buy more items such as soap, drinking water, and books in order to make more profits.  With the profits he plans to buy goats to raise. His future plan is to save money and later on open up a wholesale store.

loans.use: buy more items to sell in his shop

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas, tiene 59 años, es madre soltera con 5 hijos.
Emilia se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de aceites y accesorios para motos. Emilia tiene un puesto de venta de aceites y repuestos para motos en el Ovalo de la Magdalena. Está en FINCA Perú hace tres ciclos le gusta por la facilidad de los créditos, es una institución de confianza y puede ahorrar, con sus ahorros pudo comprar más mercadería par su puesto. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en: Emilia is a member of Las Entusiastas communal bank.  She is 59, single with 5 children.  Her business is selling spare parts for motorbikes.  She will use the loan to buy oil and motorbike accessories.  Emilia has a stand where she sells the oil and spare parts for the motorbikes in the Ovalo de la Madgalena.  She has been with FINCA Perú for the last three cycles and she likes the easy  facilities for the financing.  It’s a reliable institution and she can save.  With her savings she was able to buy more merchandise for her stand and her dream is that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: To buy oil and motorbike accessories

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is from the village of Kulasihan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Teresa is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Teresa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and beverages. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Teresa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres de BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées   qui, ont une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. EIles vivent avec leurs maries et leurs enfants à MEMISSALA, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo, pois de terre etc 
FATOUMATA compte acheter, 3 sacs d’urée 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 à 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of BENKADI 4 are married women who average 32 years of age with an average of 4 children. They live with their husbands and their children in Memissala, a place about 30 km from the city of Niena in the Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They are on their fifth Country Loan cycle with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to obtain production means and farm inputs. Their previous loans were repaid in full.
The group grows corn, rice, peanuts, okra, and peas.
Fatoumata plans on buying 3 sacks of urea, 2 sacks of complex cereals, and the rest of the money will be used for labor costs and hoeing. They hope to make an average profit of 50,000 to 55,000 FCFA which will be used to pay for their families' daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for labor.

loans.name: Glorious

texts.en: Glorious is 22 years old and has a 7 month old baby. Her husband is a carpenter. She sells food items and rears animals such as goats. She has done this business for 2 years. This business enables her to meet her needs and everything is going well. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs. With the expected profits, she wants to buy a piece of land on which she plans to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Maria de los Ángeles tiene 61 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, por motivos económicos la señora no pudo terminar su primaria ya que desde muy pequeña trabaja.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito a la Fundación, la señora se dio cuenta por una organización llamada INAMU la cual fueron ellos la que a refirieron.
La señora hace alfombras de tela en pedazos, bolsos, cubre sillas, y unos huesitos ortopédicos para el cuello, ella piensa invertir en materia prima para hacer sus  productos y tener capital para seguir invirtiendo.
Doña María empezó con un monto de 20,000.00 colones para la compra de su primer máquina de coser desde hace 30 años, ella diariamente se levanta temprano hace las labores domesticas y después se pone a coser hasta la tarde y después se dedica a vender
Un obstáculo que tiene es que tiene a la mama muy enferma y ella tiene que viajar cada 15 a Guanacaste para cuidarla, su meta es llegar a tener un taller con mucho trabajado
Este crédito otorgado será de gran beneficio a la señora porque asco  podrá tener más capital de trabajo y podrá comprar más telas y de mejor calidad
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles, 61, lives with her husband and two children.  Due to economic reasons she was unable to complete elementary school and has worked since she was a little girl.  This is the first time she’s asked for a loan from the Fundación which she learned about through an organization called INAMU; they were the ones that referred her.

She makes rugs out of pieces of cloth, purses, seat covers and some orthopedic neck braces.  She intends to use the loan to invest in raw materials to make her products and to have capital to continue investing.

María started out with the amount of 20,000 colones to buy her first sewing machine 30 years ago.  She rises early every day to do her domestic chores and later she starts sewing until the afternoon and after that she focuses on selling.

An obstacle she faces is that her mother is sick and she has to travel to Guanacaste every two weeks to care for her.  Her goal is to eventually have a shop with a lot of work.

This granted loan will be of great benefit for her because she’ll be able to have more working capital and will be able to buy more, better quality fabric.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make rugs and orthopedic neck braces.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Thuan is 37 years old and married. She has two children and together with her husband, they live in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. 

To earn a living, Thuan runs a general store from the front of her house. She has run her store for five years. She sells many kinds of basic products from her general store to serve her customers' daily needs.

She would like a loan to buy larger quantities of basic items in bulk to sell in her general store. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and that in the future, she will be able set aside part of her income for family emergencies.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of basic items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a social and hardworking 43-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with three children who are going to school. She has been operating a general shop for the last 13 years to make ends meet. She wants in the next five years to have transformed her business into a wholesale one.
 
She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy electrical materials like bulbs and sockets. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to maintain customer relationships and to keep records.

loans.use: to buy bulbs and sockets

loans.name: Ndamu

texts.en:
Ndamu is a married man with seven children, one of whom still attends school. He lives in a rented house without electricity or running water and his greatest monthly expense is food for his family. For the past 10 years, Ndamu has operated a cashew-nut selling business, selling cashews to his neighbors and passersby. His major business challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Ndamu is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. In the future, Ndamu dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres trabajadoras es D. la ciudad D. Lambaré, cuenta con 15 integrantes, todas ellas vecinas y amigas D. esa ciudad. Las señoras integrantes del comité se destacan por el sacrificio y las ganas D. progresar, muchas D. ellas madres solteras que inician su día a día desD. muy tempranas horas. Saliendo a recorrer las calles para hacer su ventas, por toda la ciudad D. Asunción; capital del Paraguay.
La señora Lorena tiene un taller D. costura, comenta que siempre está muy atareada con los trabajos que le llevan sus clientes. La mayoría D. sus vecinos y personas D. la zonas aledañas concurren a su taller ya que ella es muy conocida por su buen trabajo y amabilidad. Desea poder seguir trabajando en su taller y D. paso si es posible dar empleo a otras personas. Uno D. sus sueños es tener una tienda D. ropa donD. mostrar todas las prendas que confecciona.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, hilos, botones y demás artículos necesarios a ser utilizados en el taller D. costura.
texts.en:
The committee of "Working Women" is from the the city of Lambaré and has 15 members who are all neighbors and friends of the city. The members of this committee stand out because of their sacrifice and desire to progress. Many of them are single women who begin their days during the early hours, leaving to walk the streets to make their sales throughout the whole city of Asunción, capital of Paraguay.

Señora Lorena has a sewing shop and is very busy with the work that her clients bring to her. The majority of her neighbors and people in the surrounding area go to her shop since she is very well known for her good work and friendliness. She would like to continue working in her shop and it's possible that she will employ other people. One of her dreams is to have a clothes store where she can show all of the items that she sews. 

She is asking for the credit to purchase cloth, thread, buttons and other necessary articles to be used in her store.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, buttons, and thread for her store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale distributor of cashew nuts in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Imparirwamihigo Group

texts.fr:
Stanislas fait partie du groupe Imparirwamihigo. Le nom du groupe signifie « héros ensemble ». Stanislas est né au Rwanda et a 36 ans. Il est marié avec 4 enfants de 4 à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans de primaire. 

Stanislas est agriculteur de tomates. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour la culture de tomates. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d‘améliorer ses activités actuelles de tomates. Dans les prochaines années, Stanislas voudrait être grossiste et payer les frais médicaux pour sa famille et les frais scolaires pour ses enfants avec les profits.
texts.en:
Stanislas is part of the group Imparirwamihigo. The group’s name means “Heroes Together”. He was born in Rwanda and is 36 years old. He is married and has four children, from 4 to 12 years old. Three of the children are in school. He has a 2nd grade education

Stanislas is a tomato farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy some fertilizer for growing tomatoes.

His strategy for business growth is to improve his current tomatoes business. In the next few years, Stanislas would like to be a wholesale merchant and to use his profits to pay his family’s medical expenses and his children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing tomatoes

loans.name: Ngouye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui vit avec son épouse et ses deux enfants.Il exerce depuis 2002 dans le commerce d'habits, de sacs et de tissus.Il pratiqe aussi l'élevage de poulets pour améliorer ses revenus.Ces revenus lui permettent aujourd'hui de faire face à tous les besoins essentiels de sa famille.Il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter des prets à porter homme et dame, des sacs ainsi que des tissus pour préparer la féte de la Tabaski. Son ambition est de s'installer dans un grand magasin de vente en gros.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young man who lives with his wife and two children. He has been selling clothing, bags and fabrics since 2002. He also raises chickens as an additional source of income. His revenue allows him to support his family’s basic needs. 

He is seeking a loan of 300,000F to buy ready to wear apparel for men and women, bags and fabrics ahead of the Tabaski celebration. His goal is to set himself up into a large wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy ready to wear apparel for men and women, bags and fabrics

loans.name: Abong

texts.en:
She is 46 years old. She is single and has four children, three of whom are younger than 15 years old. She lives in a 10-bedroom apartment with her children at Ntamulung in Bamenda, Mezam Division in the North West Region of Cameroon. The main challenge she has faced in her life has been the death of her father, sicknesses and the lack of capital to start up a business. 

She joined GHAPE in 2005 and has since then received and repaid Empowerment Credit four times. She invested her past loans in farming, neathing and in the retail of some Tianshi products. She used the profit from these activities to buy books, pay school fees and to feed and clothe her family. Given a loan, she will invest in the retail of Tianshi food supplements, in farming and to buy and sell raw foodstuffs. She believes that this business will be a success because her prices are moderate and she already has a good number of customers. This business activity will be of help to the community in that it will reduce the distance they would have traveled to the market to get foodstuff. Her farming activity will increase the quantity of food available in the market for the people in her community.

She will use the profit from this business to pay fees for her children and to dress them. In addition, she will use part of the profit to buy a plot and build a good house for the family. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rate is lower and she likes the method of repayment.

loans.use: to buy Tianshi food supplements, foodstuffs and farm seedlings.

loans.name: Awen Indah Group

texts.en:
Awen Indah group received a second loan of Rp 13,500,000. Nothing has changed in the membership and composition of the board. The loan in this period is used to buy piglets and sows.

Ni Komang, head of the group, is using part of the loan to buy two piglets and the rest to fix the cage. She plans to keep sows and become a piglet seller. Currently, the price is quite expensive for piglets, Rp 450,000 per piglet. Ni Komang has a dream that this business will become a major source of family income.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and fix the cage

loans.name: Ndeye Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Coumba habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 48 ans  et s’active depuis plusieurs années dans le commerce et la vente de tissus, d’accessoires de  femmes et autres produits divers. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par nécessité  dans le but de se procurer des revenus qui serviront à régler  ses besoins sociaux. Elle  est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits qu’elle commercialise. Elle souhaite développer davantage son activité de commerce et accroitre ses bénéfices dans le but de mieux se prendre en charge et  en même temps  soutenir sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. Ndeye Coumba lives in Senegal. She is 48 years old and has been involved in selling fabric, women's accessories, and various other products for several years. She chose this business by necessity with the goal of earning an income that would serve to meet her social needs. She is a member of a branch of U-IMCEC and is seeking a loan of 150,000 Frs to buy the products that she sells. She hopes to further develop her business and increase her profits with the goal of taking better care of herself and supporting her family at the same time.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell fabric and women's accessories.

loans.name: Susana Trinidad

texts.es: La señora Susana Trinidad es bibliotecaria del colegio, también recibe una pensión por parte del Seguro social y trabaja para una organización no gubernamental dando clases de manualidades varias y su esposo es obrero de trabajos vaR. y trabaja de forma independiente. Ella es una persona muy responsable y se compromete a pagar las cuotas de este crédito que lo solicita para la compra de cemento, bloques, arena, entre otros. Su sueño o meta del es mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia. Susana está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Susana Trinidad is a school librarian and also receives a Social Security pension; she also works for a nongovernmental organization giving crafts classes and her husband’s a laborer working independently at various jobs.

She is a very responsible person who commits to make this loan’s payments.  She is requesting it to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.  Her dream or goal is to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  Susana is very grateful for the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.

loans.name: Naire

texts.en: Naire is engaged in agriculture. Due to her hard work and patience, Naire has created favorable conditions to develop her business, but to do so she needs sufficient financial capital. With the requested loan, Naire plans to purchase livestock, which will allow her to expand her farm and increase her income. This will help Naire to increase her family's present standard of living and ensure a sustainable future for her son, who plans to get married. Naire lives with her husband and son.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: Segunda Celia

texts.es:
La Señora. Segunda es socia del banco comunal Esmeraldeñas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una gran riqueza cultural, natural y gastronómica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es amable y gentil.

Doña Segunda tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos hijos menores en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora Segunda se dedica a la venta de mariscos y labora 4 días de la semana, trabaja en esta actividad hace 10 años y labora desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
  
Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pescado, camarones, cangrejos, langostinos, etc.
 
Su meta es  tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Segunda is a member of the Esmeraldeñas communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with great cultural, natural and gastronomic  wealth. It's people are friendly and kind.

Segunda is 30 years old. She is a single mother of 3 children, aged 14, 11 and 8. Her oldest daughter goes to high school, and her two youngest children go to a little school in town. She doesn't own her own home, so she rents.  
 
Segunda sells seafood. She works 4 days a week. She has done this for 10 years and works from 6 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon. 
  
She has been a member of the bank for a year and she will invest her new loan in buying fish, shrimp, crab, prawns, etc.
 
Her goal is to own her own house.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, crabs, prawns, etc.

loans.name: Parmuat

texts.en:
Parmuat is 43 years old and married with six children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 16 years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode. This is his second loan and he is planning to use it to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds, and chemicals and also to buy cows and goats for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to plow back into farming and also to repay the loan.

His dream is to become a famous farmer in the area and to help his kids to get a higher level of education. He is a hard-working man who struggles to achieve.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds, and chemicals

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Муж работает охранником. Рохат занимается купле- продажей книг. Она сама занимается в бизнесе и помогает мужу. Продажа книг принесет ей радость, всегда она читает что-то новое и рассказывает внукам. Рохат хотела бы получить займ в размере 2000$ США для покупки новых книг. Рохат надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Rohat is married and a loving mother of two children.  Her husband works as a security guard.  Rohat is involved in buying and selling books.  She is involved in the business herself and helps her husband.  Selling books brings her happiness, and she always reads and narrates something new to her grandchildren.  Rohat wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 to purchase new books.  She relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to purchase new books

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José, solicita un nuevo préstamo para seguir mejorando su negocio, puesto que en esta época se vende mucho las frutas y desea comprar: naranjas, sandia, melones, guineos, manzanas, fresas, para tener variedad de fruta fresca, y de esa manera incrementar las ventas y los ingresos sean mejores. El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho porque el negocio se mantiene estable y en las ventas mejoraron;  el resultado de la inversion es que él y su familia vive en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: José is asking for a new loan to continue improving his business because this season he sells a lot of fruit and he wants to buy oranges, watermelons, bananas, apples and strawberries to have a variety of fresh fruit available to thus increase sales and so that income will be better.  The previous loan helped him a lot because his business maintains stability and sales improve.  The result of the investment is that he and his family live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Gabriel De Jesus

texts.es:
Gabriel es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y esto le ha permitido sacar a todos sus 5 hijos adelante. Gabriel se encuentra separado de la madre de sus hijos, por lo que debe garantizar todo el sostenimiento de sus 5 hijos. Gabriel se ha dedicado a la actividad de la agricultura gran parte de su vida, pues inició cultivando café desde temprana edad. Actualmente Gabriel trabaja como mayordomo de una finca cerca de su municipio, y sus empleadores le han permitido sembrar árboles de aguacate en su finca sin ningún costo para Gabriel. Con el ánimo de poder aprovechar el espacio que le están brindando sus empleadores, Gabriel aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de árboles de aguacate, fertilizantes, fungicidas e insecticidas, para iniciar su cultivo de aguacates.
Gabriel espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues tendrá productos para la venta que el mercado paga a muy buen precio. Además, Gabriel espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y les permita progresar económicamente.

loans.use: Compra de árboles de aguacate, fertilizantes, fungicidas e insecticidas, para iniciar su cultivo de aguacates.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline is a 25-year-old single mother. Upon finishing school she found it difficult to find stable work, was unemployed for long periods at a time, and held odd jobs that paid low wages.  She is ambitious and determined.  She enjoys selling energy-efficient products like fuel-efficient cook stoves and solar lighting products in slums around Nairobi through the iSmart distribution network, as she knows these products help to improve lives.  Her biggest challenge is not having enough capital to buy enough products to sell.  She will use the $1000 loan to buy more stoves and solar lamps to sell, as well as an agent toolkit that includes a uniform and tools that will help her business.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell to customers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Peter. Peter and his family live and practice farming in Nyamira, which is a remote area in the Nyanza region of Kenya. Most of Nyamira’s constituents live in off-grid areas and rely on kerosene lamps to light up their homes. Peter’s family, for instance, is often forced to stay in the dark whenever there is shortage of kerosene in the market.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which partnered with Micro Energy Credits to start a clean energy programme, Peter is seeking a loan to pay for a Pro 2 Solar lantern that will guarantee him a 100% savings on kerosene.

The new lamp has adjustable brightness that makes it possible for the lamp’s application to range from being a desk light for his children to complete homework, to a torch for patrolling his farmland at night. You can help Peter transform his livelihood by lending him a small amount of money that will enable him to quit using a kerosene lamp that emits more toxins than light, and go for an environmentally friendly source of lighting that his kids will enjoy using.

loans.use: To buy a solar lantern

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal aged 40 years. She is married with 5 children aged between 3 and 18 years. 3 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to pay school fees of her children to buy her house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen  is a hard working lady. She initiated her buisness selling  milk as it was diffucult to run household activities with the small income of her husband.  She is 31 years old married woman.  She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Yasmeen ’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Yasmeen  has requested for 45000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Edeisi

texts.en: Edeisi, who was born in Esmeralda, Ecuador, has lived in Guayaquil since she was very young. Now, this 42 year-old mother of two lives with her husband in a marginalized area of the city referred to as Isla Trinitaria. Edeisi and her partner had to wait 10 years to obtain the title to their house as well as many other hardships. They lack potable water which costs $1 per tank, hygienic services, and a mode of transportation. Now 7 years widowed, Edeisi is left with her two children who are almost independent and her husband’s cabinet making business. When he passed away, Sra. B. still had possession of all of the tools, but she took the initiative in finding a worker who could continue the business to continue bringing in money for the family. One of her sons markets the finished products in the local markets. Edeisi is asking for this $365 loan to buy more wood to continue making cabinets as well as a polisher.

loans.use: Buy wood for cabinet-making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is married with four children, all of whom are in primary school. He has not undertaken any training. In 2002 he started his business, which was initially buying and selling cattle. This did not make enough profit for him to sustain his family thus he started selling timber which he does currently. With the proposed loan through PEMCI, he hopes to buy a power saw, which he will use to split his own timber instead of hiring a saw. This will give him an edge over the competition and improve his profit margins. He will also be able to hire out the power saw to other millers, which would bring him some additional income. We believe he has the ability to repay the loan with no difficulty.

loans.use: Timber seller

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
T. T. L. Thanh is 24 and her husband T. Thanh Long is 27. 
They work as day laborers to provide food and other expenses for their family. They have two children (6 & 2 years old). Their average income is US$11.70 per person per month. They have planted 200 green dragon bushes that don't have fruit yet. They want to borrow US$75 to invest in their garden. They feel sure they will be abL. to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: raising green dragon plants

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria de la Luz is a divorcée and has custody of her four children. They have been the motivation for her to start her own business selling tamales (a Mexican dish made of minced and seasoned meat packed in dough and wrapped in corn husks and steamed) for eight years. Due to her good service, her sales increased rapidly and now, she can count on her 16 year old daughter to help her meet her customers’ demands. Recently, she has also incorporated the sales of natural products and has had positive results. Maria wishes to give her children further educational opportunities and to make a better future for them, so she works harder each day.

In these days, Maria is seeking a loan of $925 which will be used to buy merchandise of the new products she is marketing. In this way, she will be able to show them to her clients and allow them to become familiar with the goods. She knows the quality of these products guarantees the growth of her business, and she promises to repay this loan in 6 months. You can be an important part in developing this business – Maria thanks you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.
