Maria de la Luz es divorciada y tiene a su cargo a sus cuatro hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de tamales desde hace ocho años, gracias al buen servicio que ofrece sus ventas se incrementaron rápidamente y ahora cuenta con la ayuda de su hija de 16 años de edad para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, últimamente ha incorporado la venta de productos naturales y ha obtenido buenos resultados. Maria desea darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de continuar estudiando y forjar un mejor futuro para ellos por lo que se esfuerza más día con día.

En estos momentos Maria está solicitando un crédito de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía de estos nuevos productos que comercializa, de esta manera podrá mostrarlos y darlos a conocer a sus clientes, ella sabe que la calidad de estos productos es una buena garantía para continuar creciendo con su negocio y se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Maria agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Fabio

texts.en:
Fabio and his wife are milk producers and small-sized farmers selling vegetables in the city of La Paz. These activities are their main source of income in order to support their family. He lives in Comunidad Palomar Rio – Palomar (2 hours south of the city of La Paz). He will use the loan for buying a milking cow of medium breed in order to increase milk production. This is his first credit through Impro and his financial evaluation shows a good cash flow that qualifies him for obtaining a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Fabio y su esposa son productores de leche de vaca y pequeños agricultores de hortalizas que comercializan en la ciudad de La Paz; estas actividades son su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su familia. Vive en la Comunidad de Palomar Rio – Palomar , al Sur de La Ciudad de La Paz (A dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada muestra un buen flujo de caja y lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Buying a milking cow

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Mr. L. Hor was married in 1994 and has one daughter. Since 2006, he has been in the business of running a motorbike repairing service in front of his house. He learned to repair motorbikes in 1987. His spouse is assisting him at home. His daughter is studying.

She is asking for a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $500. He will use this money to buy more motorbike and bicycle spare parts for his stock so that he can save money and time by going very often to the city to buy them.

loans.use: Purchasing motorbike and bicycle spare parts for his stock.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de Maria is 35 years old, married and has one son who is in school. She lives in the Hialeah district. Flor de Maria and her husband are a young and hard-working couple. Wanting better living conditions, they began their business making mirrors, which they do together. They need this loan to buy raw materials to invest in the sale of mirrors, and with the profits earned that will build a room for their small son and give him a more comfortable life.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Flor de Maria tiene 35 años de edad, casado y con un niño en edad escolar, habitan en el barrio Hialeah. Flor de Maria y su esposo son una pareja joven y muy trabajadora. En busca de mejores condiciones de vida ingresaron al negocio de la elaboración de espejos, el cual lo hacen juntos. El crédito lo necesitan para comprar materia prima para invertirla en la comercialización de los espejos, y de las ganacias obtenidas poder construir un cuarto para su pequeño hijo y darle un vida más cómoda.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make and sell mirrors

loans.name: Karsih

texts.en: Karsih, a 52-year-old widow, has a vegetable stall at her house where she sells various vegetables to earn income for her family since her husband passed away. She could earn $20 a day. Now she is asking for a loan of $150 to expand her business, and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.en:
Carmen María sells men’s and women’s clothing in the Café community of Herrera, Santo Domingo. She lives close to La Pulga, the most famous street market in Santo Domingo. Swarms of people go to La Pulga every Sunday to purchase anything you could possibly need.

Carmen operates her business from her house during the week, but on Sundays she sets up a stall in La Pulga and offers her goods to the passers-by.

With her loan, Carmen will buy more clothing in bulk to replenish her stock so that she can continue selling her goods. It will help Carmen increase her income and improve the living conditions of her two children.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk to restock a small business.

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is 30 years old, married, and has three children, 10 months, and 10 and 5 years old. Scola owns a small food store which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6:30 am until 10 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$120.

Scola would like to receive a loan to buy more food items for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old and is married with one child, aged 15. Mary is a tailor, a business she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $120 from her sales.

Mary wants a loan to buy another machine for her business.

loans.use: To buy another machine for her business.

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.es:
Mará is 30 years old and lives together with her husband and two children at Urbanización La Rinconada in the Trujillo La Libertad province of Perú. María has had a small store at home for about 5 years, during which time she has also worked with Manuela Ramos. She is one of the most active women in her group, eagerly taking part in activities which are organised for the benefit of her community.

María is a member of Banco Comunal "Las Jadeitas". With her first loan of $100 she was able to expand her business.

With this loan of $550, she will buy snacks, rice, sugar, fizzy drinks, grocieries and reading material. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

María wants to continue working on the growth of her business so that she can improve her economic situation.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 26 years old. He lives in a small village near Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Hussein lives with his parents, who are financially dependent on him. He owns a small blacksmith shop. Hussein had to leave school at a young age to support his family, and learned blacksmithing in order to provide for his parents. Hussein is very ambitious and would like to expand his business. He needs a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a new iron-bending machine, which is essential to his work. Hussein has requested a loan before, and repaid it in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To purchase necessary machinery for his business

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is 34 years old and the mother of two children. The two of them are in school now. She has been selling grocery products for seven years in the market to support her family. She says her business is doing well and she therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory.

Vida believes this loan will help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her two children who are in school now. She is a member of the group called “Ebe ba mu” (it shall come to pass). Members agree in unison to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, body pomade, etc.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
For seven years, Miriam has been dedicated to selling clothing by order. She also makes handicrafts that serve as raw material in the creation of earrings and necklaces. She works molding metal wires and then offering them for wholesale prices in stores that sell artesanal materials and costume jewelry.

She has used the loans that she has received to invest in clothing. Miriam would like to have a clothing stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Miriam se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos desde hace 7 años. También hace artesanías que sirven de materia prima en la elaboración de aretes y collares. Ella trabaja moldeando los alambres de metal y luego los ofrece por mayor a las tiendas que venden materiales artesanales y de bisutería. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para invertir en la ropa que reparte por pedidos. A Miriam le gustaría tener un puesto de ropa en el mercado.

loans.use: To invest in clothing that she sells by order.

loans.name: Inick J.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Inick M..  She is married and has a one-year-old child. In 2007, Inick established her crops business. Working 6 days a week, and 9-12 hours a day, she earns about US $260 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Inick has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to buy more maize. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy more maize.

loans.name: Šefika

texts.en: ŠEfika was born in 1952 and lives in Doboj, a small city in Bosnia.  She is married and works with her husband to run a store that sells tools to farmers and mechanics. She requests a 1,500KM loan through Women for Women International in order to import new and second-hand tools, which they will re-sell at a profit.  The store provides their only source of income.

loans.use: To purchase new and second-hand tools to resell to mechanics and farmers.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif was born in 1984. He is single and lives in Khachmaz town. This man has been in this business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of 800 AZN to buy foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Chhneng

texts.en: Chhneng L., 42, is married and resides with her six children and her husband in the Siem Reap, Cambodia. One of their children is married and four are students and the last one is too young to attend the school.  She is a farmer who grows corn and bananas. She has been planting fruit since 2005, and is able to make $2 of profit a day. Her husband Nou Ven, 46, is a construction worker, earning about $4 a day. On average, she spends $80 on food every month, $10 on utility and $30 on children’s education. Chhneng L. would like to take out a loan of $700 to purchase a water pump to irrigate her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce D. is twenty six years old. She is single and seriously looking for her better half. She owns and operates a Rasta hairdo salon in her neighborhood. Rasta hairdo is what most people called it which is plaiting your hair to look like thread. 
Joyce is a very skillful and talented hair dresser who adds a lot of beauty to the hair of her many customers and that is her secret. Joyce uses the weavons and meshes to plait her client’s hair to add beauty to them. For two years now this is what Joyce has been doing to take care of herself.  
She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, mesh, threads etc. to avoid shortage and poor servicing. As a result of this she has two beautiful young ladies as her apprentices, who she is training for their future career. 
She is in a community group called ‘Adehye’ meaning Royals. 
Training was organized for her so that when your help is lent she would be able use it to achieve her business goal to increase efficiency and profitability.
Her picture was taken when she was busily plaiting her customers' hair.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, mesh, thread and needle etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia K. is thirty six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a daughter and two sons. She says two of her children are in school at the moment. The other one has yet to start school. Lydia’s husband is a commercial driver. She lives with her family in a rented apartment at Offinso, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a business/farming community. Lydia trades in fresh fish. She procures fresh fish from the big cold store operators in nearby cities at wholesale prices. She sells the fresh fish on a table, in the local market square. She distributes mostly to food vendors in her community. Lydia has been in business for over ten years. She wants a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk to be able to supply more customers. She would like to acquire refrigerators to store some of the fresh fish she procures and to help her husband to put up a building of their own.

loans.use: To procure a larger supply of fresh fish

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Doña Jesús P. P. Con residencia en la aldea Nimasac es conocida por su nombre grande campo se encuentra a cuatro kilometros del cabecera departamental de Totonicapan es un lugar muy trancitable, y muy habitable su  altura 2,532 metros sobre el nivel del mar, doña Jesús Viene ejerciendo su actividad desde cuando tenia 16 años en bordados de delantales y cortes tipicos al momento de casarse, unificaron ideas para crecer su negocio hoy en dia vende los dias martes y sabado en la plaza municipa, hoy se ven con la necesidad de un credito para aprovechar la epoca de semana santa en la cual solicitan un credito para incrementar sus ganancias para el bienestar de su familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Jesús P. P., whose name is widely recognized, lives in the town of Nimasac, which lies in the countryside, four kilometers from Totonicapan, the departmental (state) capital. The area is an important transit zone and is very livable, at 2,532 meters [8,300 feet] above sea level. Jesús has worked since she was 16 years old, embroidering pinafores and other items. After marrying, she and her husband came up with ideas for growing the business. She currently sells her products on Tuesdays and Saturdays in the town square. She and her husband currently need a loan to take advantage of Holy Week festivities. They are requesting a loan to increase their revenues for the wellbeing of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased capital

loans.name: Bety

texts.en:
Bety G. has been a used clothes seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for 3 years. She belongs to the Mlamke group loan (Group code 2024).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70.  Every day she works for 6 hours at her business.  Bety is 40 years old, married, and has three children: ages 20,14, and 7. 
 
Bety is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more used clothes for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and get more food for her family.

loans.use: To increase used clothes inventory.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elsa es una señora de edad adulta que no por ser grande no le permita desarrollarse en algo. Desde hace cinco años ha atendido una tienda la cual es llamada “estanquillo González” donde ella vende de todo como; refrescos, papitas, abarrotes en general. Su tienda antes la tenía ubicada en una casa de renta ya que aun a su marido no le entregaban la que ahora tiene. 
Los clientes que acudían al local aquel recurren al nuevo con la confianza de que la señora Maria Elsa le va a tender con tal amabilidad. Ahora ella requiere de compra de mas mercancia para tener mejor mercancia y calidad.
Su esposo trabaja de chofer en una constructora de la cuida con lo que ella le apoya es con su negocio para mantener el hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Elsa is an adult woman who has a desire to take on some type of activity. For five years now, she has tended to a store called “General Store González” where she sells all types of items such as beverages, potato chips, and an assortment of groceries. Her store was previously located in a rented house. The customers she had at that location now frequent her new site, confident that Maria Elsa will care for them with the same level of friendly service. Currently, she needs to buy more products to have more to sell and a higher quality of items. Her husband works as a driver at a construction company and her contribution helps to support their household.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is 26 years old and he is single. He makes beautiful furniture like chairs, tables, cabinets, etc. He is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more woods to make more furniture to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more woods to make more furniture to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The street saleswomen will use the loan to buy more products to sell. The vegetable and clothing saleswomen will use it to buy more merchandise and also to buy more fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
CAMILA B. S., pertenece al Banco comunal “LORETO” su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr comandante suares Nº 344, Distrito de Calleria, tiene 27 años, 2 hijos pequeños, y su esposo es también comerciante.

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra de algunos abarrotes, para surtir su pequeña bodega, y desde hace 2 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos.  Su negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con este préstamo  de S/.2,500.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en ampliar su local y además comprar 1 paquete de tallarines, 1 caja de atún y 1 caja de leche para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Camila B. S. belongs to the “LORETO” Communal Bank. Her home is located at Jr comandante suares Nº 344 in the Calleria District. She is 27 years old, has two small children and her husband is also a merchant.
She invested the first loan of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of various groceries to stock her little store. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her business has kept growing such that it has been necessary to increase her loan amounts.
With this loan of S/.2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, she will expand her business and also purchase 1 pack of noodles, 1 case of tuna, and 1 case of milk to stock her store.
She thanks Manuela Ramos for being an organisation that serves the community and helps out the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, tuna and milk.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie J. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Rosalie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a chainsaw business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from purchase motorcycle. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rosalie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a transport motorcycle to improve the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Rosalie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport motorcycle to improve the business

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en:
Kanfee is a woman with four children: 16, 12, 10 and 8 years old. She sells dry goods: pepper, salt, etc. and has been running her business for the past six years. She is taking a loan from LEAP to improve her business.

Kanfee says the goods she sells are good and the customers really go for them. Her approach to customers is also good. Her goal is to improve her business and have a shop on her own.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Rosa Milagritos

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Milagritos P. B. tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta nivel superior, estudió Educación Inicial y por eso se dedica, dentro de sus actividades, al cuidado de niños de 6 meses y hasta 3 años 11 meses en el wawawasi (centro de cuidados de niños). No tiene hijos.
Rosa aparte de dedicarse al wawawasi, se dedica a la venta de balones de gas en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro 10 balones de gas, para venderlos a los vecinos.
El crédito de 1300 lo invertirá para comprar mas balones de gas e invertir en el locutorio de su hermana. 
Rosa Milagritos sueña con aumentar la venta de gas para así obtener dinero para así modificar la estructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Milagrito P. B. is a 43-year-old woman who lives in the Víctor Larco district of the Trujillo province, departament of La Libertad, Perú. This entrepreneur obtained a higher education. She studied Early Childhood Education, which is why she now takes care of children ages 6 months to 3 years and 11 months at the wawawasi (day care center). She has no children of her own.

Aside from working at the wawawasi, Rosa sells propane tanks from home.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased propane tanks to sell them to her neighbors.

She will use the 1,300.00 PEN loan to purchase more propane tanks, and to invest in her sister’s call shop.

Rosa Milagritos dreams of expanding her propane business so that she can increase her income to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase propane tanks and invest in her sister’s call shop

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Huinco Group

texts.es: Está conformado por diez integrantes, ellos residen en la comunidad rural de Huinco-provincia de Huarochirí, en este pequeño pueblo se encuentra la central hidroeléctrica de Huinco, que es la que provee agua potable a la ciudad de Lima. El grupo se dedica al comercio minorista, la mayoría de ellos empieza a trabajar desde temprana edad, sus negocios son: venta de bebidas gaseosas, golosinas, frutas, comidas, ropas, helados; que son la fuente de subsistencia para sus hogares. Sonia quien es la presidenta del grupo trabajó desde los doce años, ella ya no contó con el apoyo de su padre; porque falleció cuando tenía cinco años. Desde entonces empezó a trabajar con sus hermanos vendiendo papa rellena, gelatina, canchita. Sola tuvo que pagar sus estudios de colegio y de instituto de enfermera técnica, no pudo concluir su carrera por la carencia de dinero. Hoy a los veintiocho años de edad Sonia ha recibido su noveno préstamo en la entidad financiera EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, con éstos préstamos lo ha invertido en la compra de mercadería surtiendo así de a poquito su negocio, ella se dedica a vender gaseosas, paltas, chirimoyas, papa rellena, en una pequeña canasta ofreciendo su mercadería a los turistas, a los carros que se estacionan allí por unos minutos para continuar su recorrido a los pueblos de las alturas (sierra del Perú). Ella sabe que con estos ingresos apoya a su esposo, en la educación, alimentación para sus hijos de ocho y tres años. Sonia quiere darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus niños, algo que no pudo conocer debido a las circunstancias. Con el reciente capital que recibió lo invirtió para comprar otra cesta porque la que tenía estaba maltratada por el uso.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 10 members, who live in the rural community of Huinco, in the province of Huarochirí. The main hydroelectric dam of Huinco is located in this small town, and it provides safe drinking water to the city of Lima. This group works in the retail business. Most of them began working from a very young age. Their businesses include selling sodas, sweets, fruit, food, clothes, and ice cream; these activities are the sources of income for their families. Sonia, who is the president of the group, has worked since she was twelve years old. She didn’t have the support of her father because he passed away when she was 5 years old. Since then, she started to work with her siblings selling stuffed potatoes, jelly, and popcorn. She alone had to pay for her high school education and for her technical nursing education. She couldn’t complete her education, however, because of a lack of money. Today, at the age of 28, Sonia has received her ninth loan from the financial institution, EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD (prosperity). With these loans, she has invested in the purchase of merchandise to supply her small business. She sells sodas, avocadoes, custard apples, and stuffed potatoes in a small basket, offering her merchandise to the tourists and to the cars that are parked there for a few minutes before continuing their journey to the towns in the mountains of Perú. With this income, she supports her husband and the education and nutrition of her children, who are eight and three years old. Sonia wants to give them a better quality of life, which is something that she didn’t have because of her circumstances. With the recent capital that she received, she invested in the purchase of another basket because the one she had been using was in poor condition.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Kulmira's Group

texts.en:
Nowadays, time has made people such as Kulmira, the leader of this group, and her family members become Jacks of all trades. Conducting business at home, her husband regularly works as a welder, while Kulmira trades in milk, buying from villagers and reselling it in a market. One of her sons mends cell phones and the other son sells milk and cheese. As well, the whole family receives orders and provides Western-style renovation services. The family’s eight-year activity has allowed them to buy a car and furniture. Kulmira’s current income is around $240 per month.

Now, the next project is to buy a milk cow. Because Kulmira values time and does not want to lose time saving money, she hopes to get a loan to hasten the process of acquiring the cow. In the future, she has pretty determined plans of opening a cheese-producing factory, increasing the number of livestock, and buying new furniture for the house.

Kulmira’s partners are Kulsina, Salyi and Nurgul. Kulsina, 59, married to a metalworker, has five children. In addition to being a housewife, she manages to keep a cow and four sheep for reselling. Even though they do not have much livestock, they have been able to increase their number. She is requesting a loan to purchase sheep.

Salyi, 51, is the divorced mother of a 19-year-old-daughter. To earn a living, she sells traditional items of manufacture, beddings and pillows, a craft she learned from her relatives. Salyi requests a loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

Nurgul, 34, is a married mother of two children. Nurgul’s husband vulcanizes tires, while she manufactures traditional articles, a skill she learned from her mother. She is in need of a loan to buy materials for manufacture. Her plan is to expand her range of goods, buy an electric sewing machine, and renew the furniture.

====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow to increase milk sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des fertilisants et payer du labour

loans.name: Badia

texts.en:
Badia R. is currently in the business of selling beads in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more beads to sell. Badia is 25 years old and is widowed. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more beads to sell

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.es: El Grupo de " Las Golondrinas " están representadas por el señor Oscar Ciro  y conformada por 12 socias  muy trabajadoras que van cursando juntas ya su  segundo ciclo  con expectativas de lograr mas ingresos y mejorar así cada día para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. Las señoras tienen una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo conociéndose en sus actividades comerciales y como vecinas del mismo  barrio. Una mayoría de las socias desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales como la venta de pan, frutas,  tienda de abarrotes, venta de comida y venta de cosméticos algunas de las socias atienden sus negocios en sus domicilio y otras tienen puestos ambulantes. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias tienen mucha experiencia así que cuando no tienen ventas mueven su mercadería a otros lugares con mayor demanda y algunas salen a ferias vecinales para lograr el ingreso que es el sustento de sus familias. El destino del crédito  es para la adquisición de materia prima e insumos como la compra de harina, frutas y para incrementar sus productos como compra de cocinas con más fuerza para servir almuerzos y comida en las paradas de trufis o implantar ya un negocio mas fijo. En cuanto a sus experiencias las socias desean agrandar sus negocios y establecer negocios de comida fijos para generar un ingreso mayor que permita darle a su familia la calidad de vida que merecen.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa is 35 years old, married and mother of two children. She is a very hard-working woman who works hard to provide for her children. Her children are in school. She is a producer of gari grains. She sells gari grains in bulk in the market. Gari is prepared from milled cassava. She takes delivery of stock from the nearby communities and distributes or vends them during market days. She has a large customer base but her problem has to do with not having adequate funds to buy stock. With the loan assistance, she believes she can be fully resourced to realize her dream of providing education for her children.

loans.use: To buy gari grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items in bulk for her shop

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida Y. is a 51 year old hard working mother and entrepreneur. She has been a member of ASHI for almost 5 years and received 7 loans, with good repayment performance. Leonida is still seeking bigger opportunities for her business and aims to have a good life and comfortable standard of living.

Leonida has 3 children; Jennifer a 28 year old who didn’t finish college, Janice a 27 years old, who still studies at college and Joann a 16 years old first year college student. Even at Leonida's older age, she still needs to support her children and provide them with education. Leonida is married to her good-looking and caring husband Edward Y., who is 54 years old and a company driver.

Leonida is seeking a loan of Php 40,000 to expand her business selling rice, sugar and balot penoy (a local specialty food). She will use half the money to purchase a tricycle for her business. Leonida asks for your helping hand to help her make her family's dreams and hopes come true.

loans.use: Purchase a tricycle and rice & sugar for business

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn N. is a villager in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. To deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and water to support the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Neang Sokun, is a teacher in the local school. She is 53 years old and the mother of four children, two are teachers and two attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and water

loans.name: Noella

texts.en:
Noela A. is 46 and married with 8 children (ages 1 - 24).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Noela has many years of experience in this business.  Noela needs a loan of WST $1300 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Noela joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Noela's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Noela A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Rutbel

texts.es:
Rutbel N. C., tiene la edad de 45 años, está en unión libre, y tiene 3 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen  21,17 y 1 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de terneros y para comprar el alimento para mantener al ganado,el señor cuenta con una área de pasto donde tendrá a los animales para su crianza, el está seguro de que puede darle un buen mantenimiento y así cuando las venda obtener una ganancia. Es la primera vez que se financea con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, ya que por la ayuda ha logrado sacar adelante los diferentes proyectos que se ha planteado, además que está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, estudios y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Rutbel N. C. is 45 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. He has three children who are his biggest priority. His children are ages 21, 17 and 1 respectively. The loan he is requesting is for buying calves and food for the livestock. Rutbel has an area of pasture where he will raise the animals. He is certain that he will be able to raise them well and when he sells them he will make a profit. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he says that the loan committee has helped him a lot. Already they have helped him move forward the different projects he has proposed. In addition he is very happy with how easily he has received help. He hopes in the future to give his children a better quality of life, school and more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma D. is 44 years old. She ensures that her family has enough provisions to meet their daily needs by selling firewood and charcoal, which she has been doing for quite some time now. Welma is married to Gualberto D., who is a driver, and they are blessed with six children. She helps her husband provide for their family so that they can have a better life.

Welma has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow six times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her natural fuel business.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 PHP. This amount will be used to buy raw materials and supplies needed to continue the production of her fuel and expand her business.

Welma dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a good and stable education for her children.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies needed to continue the production of fuel.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin M. is from the village of Brgy. Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 30 years old. Melvin is single. To make a living, Melvin owns & operates a motorcycle transport service. Melvin has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melvin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melvin is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melvin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Aynura's Group

texts.ru:
Город Балыкчи издавна был известен рыбным промыслом и множеством промышленных объектов, так как город находится на берегу красивейшего озера Ыссык – Куль. Сейчас же, в городе довольно таки плачевная ситуация. Огромная пустота, и лишь бледные каскады огромных предприятий напоминают о былой мощи этого города. Чуйтиева Айнура, лидер данной группы, живёт в г. Балыкчи. Ей сорок один год. Айнура – заботливая мать, жена, а также добросовестный педагог. Она растит троих сыновей. Старшему сыну уже восемнадцать лет. Он учится в консерватории и мечтает стать народным артистом. Среднему и младшему по четырнадцать и двенадцать соответственно. Оба пока ходят в школу. Муж Айнуры пасёт скот и занимается животноводством. Он откармливает скот, забивает и сдаёт мясо оптом. Айнура работает учительницей русского языка в средней школе. Поскольку Айнура сама тесно связана с сферой образования, она понимает всю его значимость для будущего своих детей. И на протяжении многих лет, Айнура вместе с мужем планировали финансирование обучения детей. Четыре года назад они на свои сбережения начали покупать мелкий рогатый скот, который затем распродавали на рынке и среди своих знакомых. Так у них появилась возможность немного зарабатывать дополнительные средства. Однако, одной зарплаты мужа-пастуха и зарплаты учителя средней школы, а также небольшой доход от своего бизнеса конечно же совсем не достаточно для того, чтобы дать детям полноценное образование. Сейчас Айнура нуждается в кредите. Ей надо погасить задолженность за обучение сына. 

У Айнуры три партнёра по группе:

Султаналиевой Айгуль сорок два года. Муж Айгуль работает в отряде специального назначения. Айгуль – учительница средней школы. У неё очень низкая заработная плата всего 1850 сомов. Однако зарплата мужа выручает всю семью. Айгуль обратилась за кредитом, с целью купить мебель  или холодильник.

Абыкеевой Назгуль тридцать восемь лет. Муж Назгуль работает диспетчером. Вместе с мужем Назгуль воспитывает троих детей. В этом году дочь Назгуль заканчивает одиннадцатый класс. В связи с этим, Назгуль обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить дочери одежду. На оставшуюся сумму Назгуль хочет купить домашнюю утварь. 

Мусагуловой Дамире сорок семь лет. Дамира работает в средней школе библиотекарем, а заодно ещё и учительницей. У Дамиры пятеро детей. Из них двое уже учатся в институтах. Муж работает в котельной горбольницы. Дамира решила обратиться за кредитом, так как ей нужно погасить контракт дочери.  У неё есть мечта купить машину для сына. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
The town of Balykchi has been known for its fishing trade and many industrial sites for a long time. This is because the town is located on the coast of the beautiful Yssyk Kul Lake. The current situation in the town is fairly sad. Emptiness and pale cascades of huge factories remind us of the former might of this town. Aynura C., who is the leader of this group, lives in Balykchi. She is forty-one years old. Aynura is a caring mother, wife and also a conscientious teacher. She is raising three sons. The oldest son is already eighteen years old. He attends a conservatory and dreams of becoming a national artist. The middle and youngest sons are fourteen and twelve years old respectively. They both attend school for now. Aynura’s husband tends livestock and is involved in animal husbandry. He fattens the livestock, butchers it and sells the meat wholesale. Aynura works as a Russian language teacher at a secondary school. Because Aynura is closely involved with the education sphere, she understands the importance of education to the future of her children. Aynura and her husband spent several years planning the financial aspects of their children’s education. Four years ago, they started using their savings to buy small livestock, which they then sold at the market and among their acquaintances. This is how they found an opportunity to earn some extra money. However, one salary of a shepherd and a salary of a school teacher, and a small income from their business are not enough to provide their children with a valuable education. Currently, Aynura needs a loan. She needs to repay a debt for her son’s education. Aynura has three partners in the group: Aygul S. is forty-two years old. Her husband works at a special purpose squad. Aygul is a secondary school teacher. She has a very low salary of just 1850 som. However, her husband’s salary saves the whole family. Aygul requested the loan in order to buy furniture or a refrigerator. Nazgul A. is thirty-eight years old. Her husband works as a dispatcher. Together, they are raising three children. Nazgul’s daughter will complete eleventh grade this year. Due to this, Nazgul requested a loan in order to buy clothing for her daughter. And she wants to use the rest of the money to buy household goods. Damira Mysagulova is forty-seven years old. She works at a secondary school as a librarian and also as a teacher. Damira has five children. Two of them already attend colleges. Her husband works at the boiler-room of the municipal hospital. Damira decided to request a loan because she needs to repay her daughter’s contract. She dreams of buying a car for her son.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repaying son's education loan

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en:
Purevjav is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in a rental yard.

During the day, Purevjav operates a carpentry business in his town. He designs and produces a variety of wooden products to sell to his many customers. He started his business in 2000, and has expanded his business and increased his working capital as well. He is well-equipped and has gained much experience in previous years.

Purevjav is a very hardworking person with a good personality. He would like to expand his business by investing more money in his business and increasing his business profit in the future. He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan to purchase more wood for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for his carpentry business

loans.name: Juana Marina

texts.es:
Juana tiene 35 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a su hermano y a su hijo de 11 años de edad en el distrito de Guadalupe, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de cabinas de internet (internet café) y videojuegos (play station) desde hace mas de un año. Ella brinda su servicio a los escolares y jóvenes de la zona durante todo el día; el negocio goza de muy buena acogida ya que son muy pocas las viviendas que gozan de este servicio en el distrito y actualmente Internet facilita a los estudiantes una fuente amplia de información con la que pueden complementar sus trabajos escolares.

Juana se encuentra contenta con la acogida que tiene su negocio y se esfuerza diariamente para que este salga adelante ya que de el depende el sostenimiento de su familia. La creciente demanda con la que cuenta su negocio ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarlo con la compra de otra computadora, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Juana es una madre de familia responsable y entregada a los suyos, su mayor anhelo es seguir ampliando su negocio para hacer progresar a su familia. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Juana, 35, is separated and lives with her 11-year-old son and her brother in Guadalupe district, Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She has had an Internet café and play station for over a year. She offers her services to students and youngsters of the area all day. The business is well-received because there are few households in the district that enjoy this service and Internet is very useful to students for it is an extensive source of information that they can use to complement their school work. Juana is very happy with the reception her business has had and daily strives to have it succeed since it is her family’s source of support. The growing demand her services have had has inspired her to think of enlarging it buying an additional computer. This has motivated her to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach this goal. Juana is a responsible mother who is dedicated to her loved ones; her greatest wish is to continue to expand her business so that her family can progress. People who know her consider her to be trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Kingdom Promoters Group

texts.en:
Keh William M. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Kingdom Promoters. She 47 years old and is married with six children. She could not continue her education through elementary.

For six years, Keh has been selling crushed rock for construction at the SKD Boulevard market in Paynesville, Liberia. She started her business with 2,000 Liberian dollars as working capital but has now increased it to more than 5,000 Liberian dollars.

Keh encourages customers to continue buying from her. Her goal and dream is to expand her business to a shop in the near future. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 34,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more goods to sell.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Keh is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Tes

texts.en: Tes V., 30, is married and resides with her husband and young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of about $2 per day, while her husband sells cows, earning an income of $3.3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  V. is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk and rice for resale, and in the future would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy silk and rice for resale

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna BÂ est âgée de 60 ans, elle est mariée coépouse et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de CENTRE2 depuis le 08 avril 2004 et a 06 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé régulièrement. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus teintés. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va augmenter son renforcer son activité en augmentant sa quantité d’approvisionnement. Son objectif principal est de participer à la nourriture de la famille et au payement de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Maïmouna BÂ, 60, is married (as a co-spouse) and the mother of 9 children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of CENTRE2 since April 8, 2004 and has received 6 consecutive loans, all of which she reimbursed correctly. She has a small business selling dyed cloth. With her new loan, she is going to expand her business by increasing her inventory. Her principle goal is to help feed her family and pay school fees for her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and expand her cloth business

loans.name: Alcira Isabel

texts.en:
Alcira is a women who is particularly interesting because of her profound creativity and incredible capacity for work. She is a native of San Bernardo del Viento, near Cartagena, where her father worked in the fields and her mother tailored clothing for friends and relatives. Alcira learned the art of dressmaking watching her mother and even started out by making clothing for her dolls as a child. 

When she was 19 she got married and moved to Barranquilla, where her husband worked and where she would eventually have three children. Alcira began taking a course in tailoring to learn more and perfect her art. 

At 27, her husband abandoned her with her young children. Until then she had been working as an employee at a well-known clothier, but her salary  wasn't enough to cover rent, food and the cost of a babysitter for her children while she was at work. So after 16 years, she quit and used her cash on hand to begin her own business that she could run out of her home. 

She bought two simple, pedal-powered sewing machines and with her mother started to sew and sell her products to shops in malls around Barranquilla. Since then, she has stopped working, meanwhile raising her children to become professionals: an electro-mechanical engineer, an electro-mechanical technician and a doctor. She came to  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo at the recommendation of a friend. Since then she has received three loans, ranging in size from approximately $400 to $1,500, that have helped her buy equipment and grow her business to the point that she was able to hire three employees, all women heads-of-family. 

With this loan from Kiva, Alcira plans to buy supplies, including linen, zippers and accessories, to make into clothing for women, men, and children. Currently, her fixed assets include three electric sewing machines, two more advanced/industrial sewing machines for working with denim, a fabric cutter and a cutting table. 

Alcira is very grateful to her parents, her children and FMSD for giving her a hand in building her business. In the future, she hopes to continue becoming more and more successful so that she can employ more women heads-of-family so that they too can develop as she has.

[EN ESPANOL]

Alcira Isabel Ramírez D. es una mujer muy interesante por su gran creatividad y su gran capacidad de trabajo; oriunda de San Bernardo del Viento, en el departamento de Córdoba, lugar donde su padre realizaba labores del campo y su madre confeccionaba ropa a familiares y amigos, aprendió el arte de confeccionar viéndola a ella, e inició haciéndole ropa a las muñecas que tenía en su niñez. De 19 años se casó tuvo 3 hijos, como su esposo trabajaba en Barranquilla y los veía muy poco se vino a esta ciudad e inició un curso de confecciones para tener mas conocimiento y perfeccionarse su arte. Contando con 27 años y con sus hijos pequeños su esposo la abandonó. Así fue como empezó a trabajar de empleada en empresas de confecciones muy importantes, pero su remuneración no le alcanzaba para el alquiler de su vivienda, la alimentación y sueldo de la persona que cuidaba a los niños. Fue así como decidió renunciar después 16 años de trabajo y creó su propio negocio con su liquidación, Alcira inició comprando dos maquinas familiares y con la ayuda de su mamá empezaron a coser en la casa y vender en las colmenas de centro de Barranquilla, y de ahí no ha parado de coser, cuenta que esto le ha servido para el sustento y bienestar de sus hijos que ahora son profesionales de la Ingeniería electromecánica, Técnico electromecánico y Medicina. Conoció a la Fundación cuando una amiga le habló de esta organización y con sus créditos ha logrado adquirir maquinarias y crecer como empresaria generando empleo a otras mujeres cabezas de familia. Hasta la fecha ha obtenido 4 créditos desde $990.000 COP- hasta $3.000.000 COP y actualmente esta solicitando uno por valor de $2.000.000 COP para comprar materias primas como telas e insumos como hilos, correderas y accesorios para elaborar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Actualmente cuenta con 4 empleados, dos de llos son familiares y tambien con unos activos fijos entre los que se encuentran 3 máquinas planas, 2 máquinas de puntadas de seguridad, una cortadora, una familiar y una mesa de corte. Está muy agradecida con sus padres, sus hijos y la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo porque cuando necesitó de ellos le dieron la mano para salir adelante. En sus planes para el futuro está el de seguir siendo exitosa en su negocio para y darle empleos a muchas mujeres cabezas de familia principalmente para que progresen como ella.

loans.use: To buy supplies, including linen, zippers and accessories, to make into clothing for women, men and children

loans.name: Abror

texts.ru: Хайдаров Аброр проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 44 года.  Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Аброр имеет средне - специальное образование, механизатор. Работает по профессии. Кроме того более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и фрукты. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Abror H. lives in the Shahrituz area. He is 44 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a housewife. Abror has a vocational education as a machine operator. He works in his trade. Additionally, he has been farming for more than ten years. He rents the plot where he grows vegetables and fruit. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en: Artemia O.'s main source of income comes from selling personal products such as lotions and deodorants from different suppliers in her community. She is 50 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. Artemia has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Artemia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Artemia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Jorito

texts.en:
Jorito P. is from the town of Talibon. He is 32 years old, married and has 7 school-aged children. Jorito owns & operates a fishing business: he operates a fishing boat and sells the catch of assorted fish at the market. He plans to invest in other types of businesses and he is working hard to achieve his goal.

Jorito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay his children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare spring rolls for sale

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is an active member and treasurer of Nkumari Group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He has been farming for the past 6 years and has employed 2 casual labourers. His main products are bananas and milk which he sells through middlemen and through the Imenti Dairy Society respectively. He also earns income from his commercial buildings at a local market and rental houses.

Andrew fully repaid his previous loan from Juhudi and has requested this loan of 50,000 KES to construct a zero-grazing shed. He says that the income from his farming will help pay college fees for one of his children. His primary challenges are high prices for dairy feed, high cost of labour, and insufficient water for irrigation.

In future, he intends to replace his current dairy cows with high yielding dairy cows and expand his banana plantation from the current 2 acres to 3 acres. He is happy with the services he has been getting from Juhudi. He says that Juhudi is the true financier of farmers.

Andrew is 62 years old. He is married with 7 children who are all adults.

loans.use: To constuct a zero-grazing shed

loans.name: Saeeda's Group

texts.en:
Saeeda lives in Lahore which is the second largest city of Pakistan and is famous for its history and culture. She is 45 years old and is married to M. R. who is a rickshaw driver by trade. He provides transport facilities to earn an income for the family, while Saeeda supports her family through her sewing business. She gets regular orders from her nearby clients and charges between 100-150 PKRs. Her timely completion of orders and well-stitched clothes bring her customers back again and again for her services.
   
She has given birth to three children: two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son and daughter are in the 10th grade while her younger son is in the 8th.
 
Saeeda has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy a rickshaw. Currently he drives a rented rickshaw which doesn’t make enough income for him even if he works harder and longer.
  
Saeeda hopes that her husband will be able to increase the household income and that he will work harder and with more dedication being the owner of his own rickshaw. 
 
She is a regular user of Asasah and is in her 2nd loan cycle. In the previous loan year she has proved herself a responsible person who has never missed any meeting and paid installments on time.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed lives in a small city in Pakistan called Pakpattan It is located in Punjab and known for its sugar production. She lives in the small area named 16SP. She is 38 years old and settled here in a three-room brick house four years ago. She is married to M. S. and has no children. Her husband has a business of livestock. He has been doing this business for the last 15 years. He buys young animals from animal markets at cheap rates, raises them and resells them at a good profit. 

Naheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy young animals (goats & cows) and grow his business. She is hopeful that by using his 15 years of experience, her husband will be able to get positive results from his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy animals for animal selling business

loans.name: Humberto Eduardo

texts.es:
Humberto Eduardo Espinaza Powell  tiene 50 años.  Vive en unión libre con su señora tiene tres hijos Jeyson de 23  años, Heidi de 20 años y Eduardo de 1 año siete meses de edad  en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza. 

Humberto es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio. 

Humberto trabaja como constructor, además tiene un negocio de salón de cervecería.  Realiza sus compras en la cervecería Pilsener de ventanas.

Solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio del salón de cervecería y comprar una maquina soldadora para los trabajos de constructor.  Piensa que el crédito le cambiaria le ayudara al crecimiento de su hogar. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para ir prosperando en su hogar. El desafió que enfrenta es que de pronto le hagan competencia. 
En sus tiempos libres se a jugar indor fútbol y alzar pesas.
texts.en:
Humberto Eduardo E. Powell is 50 years old. He lives together with his partner and their three children: Jeyson is 23 years old, Heidi is 20 years old, and Eduardo is 19 months old. They live in the community of Ventanas within the Los Rios province in Nueva Esperanza.

Humberto is a member of the community bank Nuevo Porvenir. It is located in the community of Nueva Esperanza in Ventanas. This group is made up of 10 members, the great majority of whom are merchants.

Humberto works as a construction worker. He also has a bar. He purchases Pilsner brand beer in the city of Ventanas. 

He requests a loan to supplement his bar and to purchase a soldering iron for his construction business. He believes this loan will help him with the support of his homestead. His dream is to keep working and to keep prosperity within the home.  His greatest challenge is facing steep competition. 

In his spare time he enjoys playing indoor soccer and weightlifting.

loans.use: To supply his bar and to purchase a soldering iron.

loans.name: Elvia Del Socorro

texts.es: Elvia García conoce muy bien lo que significa tener  negocios,  por eso  no solo se dedica a alquilar sillas para diversos eventos como fiestas, reuniones comunales y grandes celebraciones, sino que también vende ropa, cosméticos, adornos de fantasía y detalles que solicitan sus clientes, en especial las amas de casa para regalos. Como ya se acerca el fin de año y Elvia conoce perfectamente lo que se mueve en el mercado  durante la época navideña, está  solicitando su credikiva para comprar sillas y alquilarlas en  eventos, pues las 210 que tiene no son suficientes, tambien comprará mercancia para renovar la que tiene; este su credikiva es el crédito numero 16 que tiene con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo;  con los anteriores ha logrado un gran progreso en su negocio, porque ha aumentado sus clientes y la posibilidad tener disponible lo que ellos necesitan;  en su vida personal también existen mejorías, en términos de autonomía y en su hogar a nivel de incremento de su bienestar familiar.   En la actualidad sus clientes lo conforman personas naturales, recomendadas de ellos mismos, amas de casa y jóvenes que les encanta los detalles para lucir bellas. Su horario de atención es de 9:00 a 5:00 de lunes a sábados; el negocio de Elvia tiene su capital de trabajo  representado en las cuentas por cobrar y en algunas mercancías en stock,  que necesitan ser renovadas, su rentabilidad sobre las ventas es de  un 32%  y su endeudamiento futuro del 52, por eso un financiamiento le caería muy bien en esta temporada de gran repunte en sus ventas y de su oferta de servicios de sillas en eventos lúdicos.
texts.en:
Elvia García knows very well what it means to have businesses.  She doesn't only work hiring out chairs for different occasions such as fiestas, community meetings and big celebrations but also sells clothes, cosmetics and decorations and small trinkets which her customers request, particularly housewives, for gifts.  As the end of the year is approaching Elvia knows perfectly well how busy the market is over the Christmas period, she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy chairs to hire out for events since the 210 which she already has are not enough.  She will also buy merchandise to renew what she already has.

This is her 16th loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She used her previous loans to make great progress in her business because she increased her number of customers and was able to have available what they needed.  She has also seen improvements in her personal life, in terms of her own independence and, in her home as well, as she has managed to improve her family's well-being.  Currently, her customers are people to whom she has been recommended, housewives and young people who love the trinkets she sells as they look beautiful.  She serves her customers from 9.00am to 5.00pm, Monday to Saturday.  Elvia's business has its working capital in amounts receivable and in some in-stock merchandise which needs to be renewed.  Her profitability on her sales is 32% and her future debt 52.  For this reason, she would find a loan very useful in this season where she sees a definite rally in her sales and an increased demand for her chair-hire services.

loans.use: To buy chairs to hire out for events since the 210 she already has are not enough.  Also, to buy merchandise to renew that which she already has

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ar:
حسن عمره 43 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في تعهدات الكهرباء للمنازل والمكاتب وغيره له في عمله 15 سنة يحب عمله وهدفه
ان يعلم اولاده في مستوى عال وايضا محب لعمله كثيرا ويهدف الى انشاء مصلحة خاصة له من خلال فتح محل خاص لذلك يطلب قرض من المجموعة
بهدف فتح محل كهرباء عامة لأنه يعمل متجول وهو يهدف الى الاستقرار في عمله وبيته طموح محبوب في محيطه العملي ولكنه يلقى منافسة عالية
لأنه يسكن في منطفة شعبية يحتاج الى المال لكي يرقى عن مستوى التنافس العادي  عائلته تدعمه دائما وتساعده لتخطي الصعاب العملية التي يمر بها
texts.en: Hasan is a 43-year-old husband and father-of-three who receives a lot of support from his family and who in turn wants to make sure that his children are given an excellent education. For the past fifteen years, Hasan has worked as an itinerant electrician for homes and offices, a field which he finds engaging. He is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to set up his own electrician’s shop so that he can achieve some sort of stability. Although he is very well-liked by his customers, he nevertheless faces stiff competition given that he is operating in a working-class district; hence he needs more capital to be able to rise above the rest.

loans.use: Set up own electrician's shop

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dolores; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara por la mañanas desayunos y ceviches (es un plato a base de pescado) y en las noches prepara salchipapas (es un plato a base de salchichas fritas y papas fritas),la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el pL. establecido.
texts.en:
Dolores belongs to the “Liderando las Palmeras” Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and  department of Cusco.

Dolores  is 55 years old, single, and has 6 children.  She alternates her daily activities according to her restaurant business.  Mornings, she prepares breakfasts and ceviches (a fish plate), and at night she prepares salchipapas (a plate based on fried sausages and fried potatoes).  Dolores works from 9:00am until 11:00pm.  She wants to improve her restaurant business.  Dolores is requesting a loan to expand the restaurant.

Dolores is grateful to those who form a part of her dream by this means, and she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: TO EXPAND HER RESTAURANT

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. sells firewood and fante kenkey in Takoradi. This divorced mother, who lives with her five dependents, sees responsibly to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare the kenkey for sale, and she hopes to build a shop from the new profit.

In this photo, Ama is displaying some fante kenkeys. The pan on her right has gari which she sells. On her left is an ice chest containing bags of water to sell to thirsty passersby.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare the kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en:
Clemente A. is from the village of District 4. He is 47 years old and married, with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Clemente plants and harvests rice for sale. Clemente has been engaged in his business for more than 26 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Clemente joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clemente is requesting his first loan,  for 25000 PHP,  to be used to pay for services to increase crop yield.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated  to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Ernalein

texts.en:
Ernalein G. is from the village of Looc, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Ernalein is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $276 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ernalein joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Ernalein is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods. This will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
