Naomi, 40, is married with two children, ages 8 and 14, who both attend school. She has a mixed farm in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya, that produces tomatoes and milk which are all sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater to the basic needs of her family.

Naomi has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. The proceeds from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Her major challenges have been too little water and diseases which affect her production. She plans to venture into the transport business in future.

loans.use: for poultry farming.

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.en:
Nemesio E. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 54 years old. Nemesio is married and has 1 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nemesio owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice per kilogram in the local community. Nemesio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2010 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nemesio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemesio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional stocks of rice & provide working capital. Nemesio is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional sacks of  rice to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Nemesio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Myla

texts.en: Myla is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a clothing sales business. Her husband Jamal, who is 35 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 3 and 6 years old. Myla joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Myla has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, to buy more clothes to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and for family needs. Myla is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Indelicia

texts.en: Indelicia is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a business making ice cream. Her husband Mauro, who is 36 years old, works as an ice cream vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 5 and 12 years old. Indelicia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Indelicia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,300, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy salt, milk, and peanuts so that she can continue to save up for the future renovation of her house and the education of her children. Indelicia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making ice cream

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 8 children, Felicidad works hard to support her family.  She has a rice and feed retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Felicidad is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of feed and rice for her rice and feed retailing business.

Felicidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of feed and rice to sell

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.fr: Kahambu M. M.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire « Nyota »,  âgée de 30 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Son mari est un ingénieur dans une entreprise de communication « Air Tel ». La cliente Kahambu M. M. est vendeuse des pagnes. Elle  s’installe au marché central de Virunga. Il ya 7 ans qu’elle est exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec de fonds propre reçu de sa grande sœur. Le capital initial fut 100$. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouvelles marchandises (15 doubles des pagnes). En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et scolariser ses enfants.  La cliente Kahambu M. M.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Nyota » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Kahambu M. M. is a businesswoman and president of the business group "Nyota." She is 30 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband is an engineer for the telecommunications firm "Air Tel." Kahambu M. M. is a retailer of pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth). She is based at the central market in Virunga, and has run this business for 7 years. She launched her business with her own funds, which were given to her by her older sister. The initial capital was $100. This new loan is meant to help her supply herself with new merchandise (15 sets of pagnes). In addition, her ambition is to enlarge her business and educate her children. Kahambu M. M. is thankful to Hekima (one of Kiva's field partners) for its actions on behalf of the poor who are excluded from the traditional banking system. It is to be noted that the business group "Nyota" is composed primarily of women.

loans.use: To buy 15 sets of pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth)

loans.name: Elsa Gioconda

texts.es: Elsa tiene su pulpería ubicada en la casa de habitación. Tiene más de 12 años con este negocio, pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una forma muy humilde. Ella siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos pues tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a ellos les proporciona todos los ingresos necesarios para que puedan ser personas de bien. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, fósforos, sopas, enlatados, bolsas entre otros. Sueña con mejorar cada dia mas su pulpería.
texts.en:
Elsa has a grocery store located in her home.  She’s had it for over 12 years.  She’s always enjoyed working and earning her livelihood in a very humble way.  She’s always seeking ways to improve her income because she has two minor children and she provides them with the necessary income for them to be upstanding citizens.

The reason for this loan is to buy snacks, detergents, basic grains, matches, soups, canned goods and bags, among others.  She dreams with improving her grocery store more each day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 41 years old and married. She has 3 children.

Perla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like bread, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Perla has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 18 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Perla aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nakyinziro Development Group

texts.en:
Rehema is a 35 year old retail business woman operating from Mukono. She has a decade long track record of hard work in her business. With hard work she says success can be at anybody's feet. 

This happily married mother of 5 says she was inspired by her husband to take root in this business. Teaching was her first profession. Rehema is a qualified teacher. She still teaches in many of Mukono's mushrooming private secondary schools. Weekly, she says, this business generates her shillings 150,000 as profit. With this kiva loan, she says she is going to purchase more sugar, rice, beans, salt, soap and other commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, beans  and other retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two children. One of her children attends school and one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a grocery business selling vegetables, onions and potatoes at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanasiti dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of cabbages, sacks of onions, and 1 sack of potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cabbages, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 38 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad; el socio se dedica a la realización de diferentes trabajo en construcción de diferentes estructuras metálicas, el socio tiene un taller de soldar, le socio realiza escaleras, trabajos diversos en metal, como rejas, puertas y todo lo referente a estructuras metálicas. El socio desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de herramientas, el socio tiene en mente comprar cortador de metal, cierras, planchas de metal. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para su taller. 

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Sumac Ayllu” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.

He is 38 years old, has a spouse and two children who are 13 and 8 years of age.  He makes a variety of metal structures.  He has a welding shop where he builds ladders and various metal items like grilles, doors and everything else related to metal structures.  He wants the loan to invest in tools.  He has in mind the purchase of saws, cutters and metal sheets.  He needs the loan to buy materials for his shop.

He is grateful for the support he’ll get and at the same time commits to make his installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy shop tools.

loans.name: 3 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en: Ms. Huyến operates a restaurant selling rice noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to process for food to sell. Huyến is 49 years old, and she is single with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependent. Huyến has been involved in her business for 8 years. The main hardship that Huyến faces in her business is lack of capital. Huyến is the group leader of the 3 Nam Ngan Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. This is Huyến first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Huyến hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to process for food to sell.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Cheikh Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Cheikh est créé depuis le 27 décembre 2010, il est composé de seize femmes qui sont du même village et qui ont comme activités principales le petit commerce et l'élevage.


Madame Ndéye Codou la responsable est âgée de 29 ans, mariée mère de quatre enfants elle est éleveuse mais mène aussi une activité de petit commerce; elle est debout à droite à l'extrême sur la photo habillée en jaune.

Elle posséde beaucoup de chèvres et moutons qu'elle vend dans les marchés hebdomadaires où elle achéte les fruits et légumes pour les revendre dans son village.


Son prêt lui servira à diversifier son commerce en achetant d'autres produits à vendre pour se faire plus de revenus.


Elle participe à la prise en charge de sa famille par la nourriture et l'habillement.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Cheikh was created on 27 December 2010 and comprises 16 women who are from the same town and are mainly active in running small retail businesses and animal rearing.

Ms. Ndéye Codou, the group leader, is a 29-year-old married mother of four. She raises animals but also runs a small retail business; she is dressed in yellow and standing all the way on the right in the photo.

She owns many goats and sheep that she sells at the weekly market days, where she buys fruits and vegetables to re-sell at her town.

Her loan will serve to diversify her business by buying other products to sell in order to earn more income.

She participates in providing for her family by taking care of food and clothing needs.

loans.use: To diversify her business.

loans.name: Djèkafo  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Djèkafo 1 sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 54 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougou dans la commune rurale de Sanando, dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali (Ségou) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’avoir des intrants disponibles pendant l’hivernage et de se faire aider dans le labour et le sarclage en recrutant la main d’œuvre masculine, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Les spéculations cultivées par les membres du groupe sont l’arachide, le mil et le niébé.
Madame Assitan (1 ère femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs d’urée, 30 kg de semences d’arachide et se faire aider dans les activités de labour et de désherbage par la main d’œuvre masculine. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Tissala et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire  10 sacs d’arachide, 5 sacs de mil, 3 sacs de niébé et des fanes. Une partie de la production est consommée à domicile et le reste avec des fanes de niébé sera vendu pour assurer l’entretien des enfants et les besoins du foyer au quotidien. Madame Assitan à l’instar des autres femmes du groupe Djèkafo 1 a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans leur village.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Djèkafo 1 are married women living for the most part in large traditional families. The women average 54 years of age and five children each. They all live in the village of Sirakorobougou in the Rural Commune of Sanando, in the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Segou).  They know one another through ties of kinship, marriage, and community. 

With the goal of acquiring farm inputs for use during the off-season and the male labor for helping them with plowing and weeding, the group members turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first farm loan cycle. The crops grown by the group members are peanuts, millet, and black-eyed peas. 

Ms. Assitan (the first woman standing from the left in the photo) intends to use her loan to buy 2 sacks of urea and 30 kg of peanut seeds and to recruit male laborers to help with the work of plowing and weeding. Supplies of farm inputs come from the Tissala market, and the labor comes from a youngsters association in the village. 

With 2 hectares of land, she hopes to produce 10 sacks of peanuts, 5 sacks of millet, 3 sacks of black-eyed peas, and some dried fodder. Part of the produce is consumed at home. The rest, plus the fodder from the black-eyed peas, will be sold to ensure the children’s needs are met at home each day. 

Ms. Assitan, just like the other women in the group Djèkafo 1, has the goal of ensuring self-sufficiency in their village.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and to recruit labor

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Benedicta nació en la ciudad de Paruro (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 59 años de edad. Ella es viuda, tiene seis hijos y viven en la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene un puesto de venta de verduras en el centro comercial el Molino II de la ciudad Cusco. La pueden encontrar desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la nocheen su puesto de venta. En esta oportunidad Benedicta requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras como por ejemplo papa, lechuga, cebolla, zapallo, otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Benedicta was born in the city of Paruro (Cusco, Peru) and is 59 years old.  She is a widow, has six children, and lives in the city of Cusco.  She has a vegetable stall in the 'El Molino II' shopping center in the city of Cusco where she can be found from 6 o'clock in the morning until 9 o'clock at night.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy vegetables such as potatoes, lettuce, onions, pumpkins, etc.

The 'El Molinito II' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is a very touristy and commercial area.  It is known for its traditional 'Inti Raymi' fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machupicchu).

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as potatoes, lettuce, onions, pumpkins, etc.

loans.name: Awlata

texts.fr:
Awlata est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un couturier. Elle a 02 enfants tous scolarisés. 
Awlata travaille comme restauratrice (vendeuse de « COMM » une nourriture faite à base de maïs que la population togolaise apprécie) depuis 2000. Elle est aidée par 01 personne et vend en face d’un bar.
Awlata a requis son quatrième  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs et du poisson. Elle veut ouvrir un autre coin de vente. 
Dans les prochaines années, Awlata voudrait voir évoluer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle  veut voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Awlata, age 35, is married to a dressmaker. She has two children, who both attend school. She's been working in the food serving business since 2000, selling "COMM" (a corn-based dish enjoyed by the Togolese population). She's helped by one employee, and has her booth opposite a bar.

Awlata is seeking her fourth loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy corn and fish. She wants to open another sales point. In the forthcoming years, she would like to see her business progress. She says that she will use her profits to help her family blossom.

loans.use: to buy corn and freshwater fish

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo,  se dedica al comercio de ropa, es soltero, vive en compañía de su madre,  comenzó el negocio junto a un amigo, no tiene horario de trabajo, y actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertir en el negocio.
Su inversión será en ropa, de diferentes modas y colores, para ambos sexos como blusas, camisas, short, ropa interior, esta compra le permitirá ampliar la mercadería, ofrecer a los clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.
La Aspiración de Gerardo es tener éxito en el comercio de ropa, vivir que este sea rentable, para obtener las ganancias necesarias para ayudar a su madre a cubrir los gastos.
texts.en:
Gerardo works selling clothing.  He is single, and lives with his mother.  He began this business with a friend.  He doesn't have a formal work-schedule, and currently is requesting a loan to invest in the business.

His investment will be in clothes for both sexes in different styles and colors, such as blouses, shirts, shorts and underwear.  This purchase will allow him to grow his merchandise on offer, and to meet his customers needs.

Gerardo's aspiration is to have success in his clothing business, to see it be profitable, and to earn the money necessary to help his mother cover her expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing: blouses, shirts, shorts, and underwear for his business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last two years, he has been making and selling doughnuts. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. He also works as a contractor to supplement his income. In the next five years, he wants to open a hotel. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy ingredients such as cooking fat and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making doughnuts

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married and blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. For the last three years, she has been practicing poultry farming to make a living. Previously, she sold vegetables. In the next five years, Florence wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seats for her house.

loans.use: to buy seats for her house.

loans.name: Navin

texts.en:
Navin is 53 years old.  She is a farmer and also sells cakes.  She earns $2 per day.  Navin is a single mother who lives with one daughter who is studying.  Her other children got married and live with their families.   

Every month, Navin has to spend $37 on food, $2.50 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $3 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy fabric for her daughter, who just got married, to make clothes to sell. She doesn’t want to change her career to do anything else because she only lives with one daughter and her income can support the family well.

loans.use: buy fabric to make clothes to sell

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Don Emilio  es casado con la señora  Berenice  y con quien procreo seis hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y estudian.

    El oolito el préstamo par invertirlo ene la compra  de madera para elaborar muebles, como  son: roperos, estante, cillas, comedores, puertas, entre otros, en donde lleva trabajando  hace  once años y comentó que le va bien ya que ha logrado mejorar día con día sus ingresos.

     Quien lo motivo a esta actividad fue su padrino quien le enseño a como se elaboran este tipo de trabajos y le gusto y desde entonces lo viene practicando y si le da ingresos.
texts.en:
Emilio is married with Berenice and they have six children who are students and are economically dependent on them.

He has requested a loan to buy wood to create furnishing items such as wardrobes, bookcases, chairs, dining room sets and doors. He has been engaged in this activity for eleven years and he says he is happy with it as he has succeeded in increasing his income day by day.

He started his activity thanks to his godfather who taught him how to create this kind of products and, since he liked it, he decided to engaged in it in order to earn an income.

loans.use: To buy woods to create furnishing items.

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun (pictured above) is a tailor. She makes bags. She does not have her own business, she is hired to make bags and she gets paid a fee. Her husband, Sophin is a technician. They have been married since 2007 and have one young son. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Choeun is asking for a loan of $300 to build a restroom for her family use.

loans.use: To build a restroom for her family use.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 52 years old, married to Nancy and they have three school-going children. He has been in farming for the last 21 years with an income of KES.80,000 a month.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this is his third loan from KADET LTD. He will use the entire loan to buy seeds and pesticides.

With the anticipated profits, he will purchase a plot and build rental houses. He hopes to be able to grow his business and be a great farmer and invest more in real estate in the future

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is from the village of Santa Cruz, Kapatagan, lanao del Norte. She is 43 years old and married. To make a living, Luisa owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business in her local community, selling a variety of products . She has been in the business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month.

In 2011, Luisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Luisa is requesting her second loan, in the amount of 10,000 PHP, to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital.

location.town: Santa Cruz, kapatagan, lanao del Norte

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Lea works hard to support her family.

She has a banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and sari sari store. Lea is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of banana for her business.

Lea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her 3 children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of banana to sell

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Tbaung Khmum district, Yorn is 38 years old and has four dependent children who help her with rice farming and sometimes work for others to earn income. Yorn is a rice farmer and she has worked in this field for 12 years. She supplements her income by raising pigs and sometimes works for others in the village. With her current business, she earns US $10 per day and saves US $5 daily.

Due to a lack of capital for her business, Yorn is requesting her first loan from VisionFund in the amount of $500. She wants to use the loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and feed for her pig raising business. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and feed her pigs to be fat and also hopes to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizer and pig feed for her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lorenzo Urbano

texts.es:
Lorenzo Urbano tiene 53 años es casado , y vive con su esposa  y su hijo de 14 años. Vive en el Recinto Caimito 1en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito 1, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Lorenzo Urbano  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz.  Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, líquidos para la maleza para la siembra del maíz, El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño es poder comprar una finca y así poder  gozar de  buena salud y  estar unidos con la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta leer la Biblia y conversar con los amigos de la palabra de dios.
texts.en:
Lorenzo Urbano is 53 years old and is married.  He lives with his wife and 14-year-old son in the Caimito 1 district in Ventanas Canton.

The communal bank "LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES" ["The Truth Will Set Us Free"] is located in the Caimito 1 district, which is part of Ventanas canton.  The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Lorenzo Urbano works in agriculture growing corn and rice.  He purchases his supplies in Ventanas, and makes his sales in the market there.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies, fertilizers, and weed-killers for growing corn.  The loan will help him to increase his income for his family's use.  His dream is to be able to purchase some property, and so be able to enjoy good health and be together with his family.

In his free time, he likes to read the Bible and discuss the word of God with his friends.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, fertilizers, and weed-killers for growing corn.

loans.name: Ronnielyn

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Ronnielyn did not pursue her college, she is married to a farmer and they raised their family in a village. She is now 30 years old and has four children. She helps her husband in managing their farm lots by planting rice and vegetables for sale. They planned to improve their rice farming business to increase their yields and income to satisfy their necessities and finance the schooling of their children.

Ronnielyn is asking for a loan of P13,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting rice. They mentioned that the loan will help them to improve their rice farming and hoping that they will be having a fruitful harvest. They believe that hard work will make them possible to increase their yields and achieve their plans in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting rice

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Ma. Caryl is 20 years old and is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Secondary Education. She is currently in the third year of this four-year course. Eustaquia is the mother of Ma. Caryl (the student in the picture).

Ma. Caryl needs 5,000 Philippine pesos to pay tuition for the first semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

When she graduates, Ma. Caryl plans to be a licensed teacher and help her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, sweets, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread and other items.

loans.name: Siengdy

texts.en:
Seng Siengdy is a single mother living with her six children, two of them already grown and employed in sewing and cement factories and three others going to school.

Seng Siengdy was granted a small plot of land after being displaced from Phnom Penh to this new village. As her neighbors, Seng Siengdy would like to build a house very soon and she requested $500 to have the works performed. If everything goes smoothly, she expects her house to be built in 1 week only, considering she will hire 3 workers full-time.

Seng Siengdy used to have a small business in town. She was selling ice for the small restaurant on the streets. She would like to start again but the village is not yet connected to the power grid and the demand for ice is very low, as there is not yet a restaurant. The family is confident about repaying the loans on the children’s salaries, which is $220 cumulated per month. “This won’t be easy, but the house is worth it”, she said.

loans.use: Building a new house

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a self-employed young businessman who started his business in 2002 after dropping out of school due to lack of school fees. He is single and lives with his parents. He is an active member of a local youth group who have motivated each other’s entrepreneur skills. With the help of a Pemci loan he is wishes to increase his stock and use the profits to support his siblings. Through his business Jacob has been able to act as a role model to other youth to start up business ventures to support themselves. Their goal is the eradication of poverty and crime in the community.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Miss Hue and her husband have 3 children. They are 13, 11 and 6. Dung, Hue’s husband, was stabbed his back in the argument with friend and he was paralyzed. The family sold their house to pay for his medical treatment.

Miss Hue doesn’t have any land or a house and she must support 3 children going to school. Selling fish is thus important for them to increase their very small income by about $2/person/month. Their average income is $8/person/month. Miss Hue has already repaid two loans. Now she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her fish business.

loans.use: Selling fish

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a married 34-year-old man with 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, living in Kayidish, a village built for IDPs.  

He opened his own small shop four years ago. He wishes to improve his life and to be able to cover all his  family expenses.  He needs a loan of $725 to expand the area of his shop and to attract more clients.

loans.use: to expand the area of his shop

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es:
I have had this small grocery store for two years. I had to work very hard and make many sacrifices in order to open the store. I am poor and older and the store is my livelihood. My children help me tend shop and it pays for their schooling. Right now I need to stock up on groceries to sell.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Tengo este pequeña pulperia hace 2 años, ahora la voy a surtir de varios productos con las compra que voy hacer. Con este negocio es mi trajo y lo he hecho con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificios ya que soy una apersona pobre y mayor de edad. Tengo el apoyo de de mis hijos que me ayudan a vender con este negocioles les ayudo tambien en sus estudiso.

loans.use: To buy groceries like bread, eggs, rice, beans, instant soup, condiments and snacks.

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesus lives with her partner and have two children. She has a 9 year girl and a 3 year old boy. Her husband works as a truck driver but his income is not enough so she decided to help him with the family expenses. With her work they have been able to pay for a small house. She wishes to continue working to have some income because her kids are growing as well as the expenses. Maria wants her kids to have a good education. She started her business 15 years ago and her first customers were her neighbors, family and friends.

Maria de Jesus is requesting a loan for $475.00 to buy raw material and fullfill her customers tailoring orders. This money will help her increase her customer base while at the same time she will be able to deliver her work on time. She will be repaying the loan in six months. Maria and her family appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

María de Jesús vive en unión libre con su pareja y tienen dos pequeños hijos una mujercita de 9 años de edad y un niño de 3 años de edad, su pareja trabaja como chofer de camión, y sus ingresos no son muy elevados por lo que ella decidió ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, con su trabajo y el de su pareja han podido salir adelante poco a poco y ahora están pagando una pequeña casa que adquirieron, pero desea continuar trabajando para poder tener ingresos ya que sus niños están creciendo y los gastos también para poder darles una buena educación. Ella empezó hace 15 años atrás y sus primeros clientes son sus vecinos, amistades y familiares.

María de Jesús esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 475 para comprar materia prima y poder cubrir los pedidos de confección de ropa que le hacen sus clientes y así poder incrementar su cartera por hacer buenos trabajos y a tiempo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que les das para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: Raw material Purchase

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock for a general shop including footwear, batteries, cell phones, scratch cards, and a TV set.

loans.name: Mina's Group

texts.en:
Mina N. is a tailor. She wishes to purchase an electric sewing machine and build a big table that can be used as the counter in her stall. She also wishes to purchase some chicks to rear for future income.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Majeedan's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Majeedan B. and I come from a mid-size city, Multan, Pakistan. I am the mother of eight: one daughter and seven sons. Currently, two of my sons attend school while the others are working. I am a textile designer and I embroider clothes. I want to expand my business for which purpose I require a loan. I live here with my family in a four-room mud brick house.

I am a group leader of several other women: Nazia B. requires loan for their stitching and embroidery business. Suriya B. requires a loan for her embroidery business. Najma B. buys and sells used items. Razia B. will use the loan in their embroidery business."

loans.use: Expand my textile design business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy one pack of mixed adult clothing and one pack of fisherman clothes.

loans.name: Mayasa's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Mayasa is 37 years old, married, and has 5 children, 6 to 18 years old. Mayasa and her husband also take care of one other child who is 14 years old. Mayasa owns a small stationery which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 8:30 am until 9:30 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140.

In the past, Mayasa has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Now, she hopes to receive a loan to buy more items for her business. Mayasa will share this loan with another businesswoman, Asha , who also has a sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a young, 22-year-old woman. She has been cooking pasta, rice, and vegetable sauce for the past 2.5 years. In addition to her food sales, she sells soft drinks such as Coke, Fanta, and Sprite. Because she sells her food and drinks at the main town’s lorry station, there is always a high demand for her products.

She is seeking a loan to buy more boxes of pasta, crates of eggs, vegetables, and crates of soft drinks in order to expand her operations.

Ama is a member of the group called Alpha and Omega. Group members apply positive peer pressure on each other as social collateral to insure that fellow group members repay their respective loans in a timely manner.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional food products (e.g., boxes of pasta and crates of eggs) and soft drinks

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.es:
Rosa Isela started her own business because she wanted to help out her husband. Furthermore, she likes retail because it gives her the opportunity to meet new people, and because she likes to be an independent woman. She started the business because she needed the extra income to help with both the household expenses and her 2 children’s education, which is vital for obtaining better opportunities in life. She started selling novelty items and ceramics thanks to her mother-in-law, who supported her. She has now been selling seafood to her friends, family, and neighbors for 8 years, and has been prosperous.

She needs a loan of $775.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase more fish and other seafood because there is currently a high demand for it. She would like to offer a wider selection of seafood in order to satisfy her customers’ needs and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Isela inició el negocio por el deseo de ayudar a su esposo, además de que le gustan mucho las ventas ya que de esta manera puede conocer personas y también porque le gusta ser una persona independiente. Inicio el negocio porque necesitaba contar con un ingreso extra para el hogar y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus 2 hijos, ya que querie que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida. Comenzó hace 11 años vendiendo novedades y cerámica gracias a su suegra que la apoyó para hacerlo y tiene 8 años que se dedica a la venta de mariscos entre familiares, vecinos y amistades y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien en esta actividad.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para poder adquirir mas pescado y mariscos ya que en esta época del año existe mucha demanda y quiere tener mayor variedad y surtido para quedar bien con sus clientes y asi obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase fish and other seafood

loans.name: Zita Berenice

texts.es:
Zita is married, and her husband is a painter. They have 3 children: a 10-year-old boy, a 4-year-old boy, and a 9-year-old girl. They are in elementary school. She started her business to help her husband with their children's expenses, primarily their education costs. She started her business 6 years ago by selling linens and cosmetics. Now she sells shoes because she earns more profits this way.

Now she needs a loan of $400, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase new editions of catalogs and to supply pending orders. With your help, Zita will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Zita es casada y su esposo es pintor tiene 3 hijos, un niño de 10 años, otro de 4 años y una niña de 9 años estudian la escuela primaria. Inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos, principalmente los escolares. Comenzó su negocio hace 6 años inicio vendiendo blancos y productos cosmeticos, actualmente vende zapatos lo que le ha dejado mejores ganancias

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar nuevas ediciones de catalogos y surtir pedidos pendientes. Con tu ayuda Zita saldra adelante.

loans.use: To purchase new catalogs and merchandise

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
My name is Jose Guadalupe and my wife and I have a house. Our bathroom is very small and we now need more space to have a comfortable home. We decided to expand it but don't have the resources to do so. In order to complete the construction, we're asking for a loan of 500 dollars.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es José Guadalupe mi esposa y yo tenemos una casa de interés social, nuestro baño es muy pequeño y realmente necesitamos mas espacio para tener una casa mas cómoda así que decidimos ampliarlo hacia un costado de nuestra casa pero por falta de recursos no habíamos podido hacerlo por eso solicitamos la cantidad de 500 dll.

loans.use: Expand his Bathroom

loans.name: Mohammad Dawood

texts.en:
Mohammad Dawood is married. He lives with his own, nuclear family. He has a car parts shop that he has been involved in for more than 5 years in Kabul. Before this he was in Iran where he had a small shop. When he came back 5 years ago, he continued his business in Kabul, but he wants to enlarge his shop and still he can't do it in Kabul. Therefore he needs a loan.

He wants to take out an individual loan to import more car parts for his shop and continue his business with more success in Kabul. He wants to become strong in his business.

He is happy with all members of his family. He has a plan to have anther shop in the next few years in Kabul to help his family better. He wants to thank Kiva.

loans.use: To import more spare parts for cars

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Mary M. from Mwanza.  Married with four children between the ages of seven and twenty, Mary has been running a grocery business selling water, soda, biscuits, flours, and sugar since 2005. Working at the business 16 hours a day, seven days per week and assisted by husband, she currently earns about $400 each month. She is requesting a loan of $950 in order to buy more soda, flours, sugar, and water, and in the future plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. Mary thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more soda, flours, sugar, and water.

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta N., 68 ans, mariée avec 10 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Ndoucoura depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du riz, des arachides, de l’huile de palme et des oléagineux pour renforcer son petit commerce. Elle veut diversifier ses activités avec les bénéfices du commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Anta N., 68, is married with 10 children for whom she is responsible. She has been a member of the village bank of Ndoucoura for three and a half years. She wants to buy rice, peanuts, palm oil and other oils to bolster her little business. She wants to diversify her business using the profit from it and improve living conditions for her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables and various foodstuffs

loans.name: Marco A.

texts.es:
Marco junto con su hermano son productores de queso de vaca, los cuales son comercializados al por mayor en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de La Paz y Viacha; la producción de leche que ellos generan es insuficiente entonces tiene que acopiar leche de la comunidad donde ellos habitan; de esa forma también ellos generan empleo indirecto a los productores de leche de su comunidad.

Viven con sus padres que son de la tercera edad y una hermana que esta estudiando en la universidad estatal en la Ciudad de El Alto UPEA. Viven en la comunidad Achica Baja de la Provincia Ingavi (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para que incremente su producción leche y de esta manera también incrementar su producción de queso.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Marco and his brother produce cow’s milk cheese, which they sell at wholesale quantities in the local markets of the cities of La Paz and Viacha, in Bolivia. The amount of milk that they produce is insufficient and therefore they have to stockpile milk from the community where they live. In this way they also create jobs indirectly for the milk producers of their community. They live with their parents who are retired and their sister who is studying at the state university UPEA, in the city of El Alto. The family lives in the Achica Baja community, located in the Ingavi province, 3 hours away from the city of La Paz. They will use the loan to buy a dairy cow of medium quality so that they can increase the amount of milk and therefore cheese they produce. This is their first Impro loan and our evaluation has determined that they are eligible for it.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase their milk production to levels sufficient enough for them to produce cheese.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Six people living in the Chrolong village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia, make up the group loan. They will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Lim V. is the group leader. She owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Sanh Da, is a fisherman. He does not have enough fishing tools. So Mrs. Lim V. is requesting a loan to buy those tools for her husband's business. Mrs. Lim V. is 24 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy fishing tools for the fishing business

loans.name: Salma Sohail Khalid Group

texts.en:
Salma baji is a 42-year-old married lady. She is married to a person whose name is S. K.. He has a construction supplies business. She lives with her family in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her daughter reads in 7th standard and her son reads in 5th standard.

Salma baji stays at home and spends her time sewing clothes. This activity rewards her in the form of money. She invests her money in a revolving committee and plans to renovate her house when it is her turn to get the amount. She is applying for a loan to buy more construction supplies (sand, cement) to expand her husband’s construction supplies business.

Salma baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Naseem Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy utensils to re-sell. Kalsoom Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, cloth, and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis vive en casa propia con su pareja en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz;  la actividad que el realiza es la venta de peluches los días martes y jueves en la ciudad de El Alto.  La profesión que el tiene es la de mecánico dental, esta actividad la realiza en coordinación con dentistas de la zona Buenos Aires percibiendo también otros ingresos por su trabajo con lo cual puede mantera su familia. El crédito que solicita es para comprar un motor pulidor de dientes y poder continuar con su trabajo.
 
Es cliente de impro y su historial crediticio es muy bueno y por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Luis lives in his own home with his wife, in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone of La Paz. He works selling soft toys on Tuesdays and Thursdays in the city of El Alto. He is professionally trained as a dental technician, and works with dentists in the Buenos Aires district of the city, providing another income stream to support his family. He is seeking a loan to buy a motorised dental polisher, so he can continue with his work. Luis is an existing client of Impro, and has a very good credit history. For this reason he is eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motorised dental polisher for his dental technician business

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva tiene 39 años y vive con sus 4 hijos en su propia casa. Ella trabaja en los bordados artesanales desde hace 25 años y ofrece bellos trabajos elaborados a mano, esta trayectoria la ha coronado como una de las mejores en su zona. Los fustanes ya acabados los lucen las mujeres en las fiestas costumbristas de su región, ahora ella está muy animada en seguir adelante  porque  algunos de sus paisanos regresan después de mucho tiempo y  hacen pedidos en cantidades para asistir a las festividades que se programan en los próximos meses. Elva considera su trabajo como  una profesión, la cual disfruta cada día. dicionado a esto también se dedica a la crianza de animales  para venderlos cada cierto tiempo en la feria ganadera. Es la primera vez que  Elva tiene un préstamo con MFP, comprometiéndose a  trabajar en equipo y ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para comprar hilos de diversos colores en cantidades para bordar los fustanes, además lo empleará en el pago de salario para la persona que contratará para que la ayude a terminar los bordados en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Elva is 39 years old and lives with her four children in a home she owns. She has been creating handcrafted embroideries for 25 years and sells beautiful hand-worked crafts. She is known as one of the best embroiderers of her area. The finished skirts are worn by women during local traditional celebrations. Now she is very cheerful about the future because some villagers are returning after a long time away and they are placing large orders for the upcoming celebrations. Elva thinks of her work as a profession which she enjoys every day. In addition to embroidery she raises animals to sell at market after a certain time. This is Elva's first loan with MFP, she is committed to working in a group and to being punctual in her repayments. She will use the loan to buy large quantities of wool in a medley of colours in order to embroider the traditional skirts as well as to pay the salary of an assistant she will hire so she can finish the embroideries more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidering

loans.name: Shanti Singh

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanti Singh T. lives in a single-family home with her husband and their one son in Sainbu-Bhaishipati Lalitpur. Their son attends pre-primary school.

Mrs. T. and her husband Mr. Dhan Shyam T. have run their own grocery store for over five years. Before this, Mr. T. had tried hard to find suitable employment; when his efforts proved unsuccessful, he decided that he and his wife should open their own grocery business. They sell different types of grocery items at their store such as rice, maize, noodles, and a variety of snacks.

Mrs. T. is requesting a loan of 20,000 Npr to buy different varieties of grocery goods. Her primary aim is to provide a better education for her son.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Phum's Group

texts.en:
Phum is the leader of a group of borrowers consists of four members. Phum is a widow, mother of three children: all of them are students. She sells different kinds of vegetables such as cucumber, tomato, potato, salad, chili, etc. and she has been in this business for more than four years.

Phum has a lot of customers who always buy her vegetables in bulk because she is famous for her polite attitude. She also plants some vegetables behind her house.

Recently, Phum asked for a loan to buy fertilizer for her plantation. The other three group members are: P., 55, who sells vegetables in the local market; looking for a loan to buy more vegetables for selling. S., 58, who owns a plot of land for growing crops, is asking for a loan to buy a bicycle for her son to travel to school. R., 36, who sells vegetables, is taking a loan to invest in her business. They all live in the Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her plantation.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam has been a dressmaker and chicken seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. She works at her business for eight hours every day.

Maryam belongs to the M'mola group loan and is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more materials for her business. She hopes to increase her profit through this loan so that she will be able to grow her business as well as save money for future use.

Maryam is 50 years old and married. She has seven grown children, ages 30 to 35.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her dressmaker business.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha  es socia del Bancomunal Sol de Alegría.
Mirtha es casada tiene 32 años, un hijo de 4 años que esta en el jardín.
Mirtha estudio secretariado cuando termino no pudo trabajar por que su papa se enfermo y sus planes cambiaron. Al tiempo Ella empezó vendiendo jugo de naranja, pero no le salía mucho, pensó en algo que tenga mas salida y que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes, era dar desayuno, ella  vende desayunos  en el mercado todos los días. Por las noches esta estudiando enfermería geriátrica.
Mirtha necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de insumos como azúcar, leche, quinua, harina, para la preparación de desayunos.
Desde que esta en Finca cuenta con un capital para la compra de víveres para dar el desayuno. 
El sueño de Mirtha es terminar sus estudios y tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a member of the Sol de Alegría comunal bank. Mirtha is married, 32 years old, and has a 4 year-old son in kindergarten. Mirtha studied to be a secretary, but when she finished her studies she couldn’t work because her father fell ill and her plans changed. She eventually began selling orange juice, but this didn’t earn much. She thought something that would earn more and that she could offer to her customers was selling breakfast. She sells breakfasts in the market every day. In the evenings she is studying geriatric nursing. Mirtha needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, quinoa, and flour for preparing the breakfasts. Since she has been with Finca, she has had the capital she needs to buy ingredients for her breakfasts. Mirtha’s dream is to finish her studies and have a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mirtha needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, quinoa, and flour for preparing breakfasts.

loans.name: Abduhalil

texts.ru: Абдухалилу 59 лет, женат и имеет 4 детей. Нигде не работает, так как находится на пенсии. Чтобы получить дополнительный доход занимается выпечкой национального таджикского хлеба – лепешек на дому. Продает лепешки его жена на рынке. Кроме выпечки лепешек также занимается откормом скота. Абдухалил решил подать заявку на КИВА и собирается прикупить муку, так как цена на нее немного растет.
texts.en:
Abduhalil is 59 years old; he is married and has 4 children. He does not have a job, because he is retired. In order to earn additional income he bakes tradition Tajik bread – flatbread, at home. His wife sells the flatbread at the market. In addition to baking flatbread he fattens livestock. Abduhalil decide to apply on KIVA and plans to purchase flour because prices are growing a little bit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour at wholesale

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita P. is from the town of Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is forty-six years old and married with four school-age children. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a retail rice business. She has been selling rice for over three years and earns about $110 a month from these activities. In 2006, Jovita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This will be her tenth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC (Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative):

PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Hawa B. est une jeune femme de 27ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de divers produits qu’elle aimerait renforcer afin d’améliorer les conditions de vies de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Hawa B., age 27, is married and the mother of 4 children. Her business consists in selling various items, and she would like to bolster it in order to improve the standard of living of her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business (sales of sugar, tea, cigarettes, oil)

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida tiene 28 años, es una joven madre soltera que vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a sus 3 hijos Erick de 10, Britney de 8 y Lidia de un año, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El restaurante de Zaida es muy concurrido por los clientes que buscan una comida deliciosa y un precio accesible, ella es una buena cocinera y sus sazón es muy admirada por todos sus clientes, sus menús son muy surtidos llegando a ofrecer hasta 5 platos de fondo para que el cliente escoja según su agrado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y darle a la comida su toque secreto, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender sola a todos los clientes que entran a su restaurante. Para un futuro cercano espera que pueda contratar a personas que la ayuden a realizar un mejor trabajo y ha mejorar la atención en su restaurante. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito, en su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas ollas y hará arreglar la infraestructura de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Zaida, 28, is a young single mother. She lives in her relatives’ house with her three children; Erik, 10; Britney, 8; and Lidia, 1. Her children are the motivation for all of her efforts. Zaida’s restaurant is very busy with customers who look for a delicious meal at a reasonable price. She is a good cook, and her good seasoning amazes all of her customers. Her menu items are varied. Her customers can select, according to their preference, from up to five main dishes. What she likes best about her work is cooking and giving her food her secret touch. She has been doing this for six years. The most difficult thing is to have to wait on all of the customers in her restaurant by herself. In the near future she hopes to be able to hire people to help her do a better job and to improve the service in her restaurant. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy for the opportunity to receive a loan. She is very united with her colleagues in her community bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy pots and make repairs to the restaurant’s infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy utensils and make repairs to her restaurant

loans.name: Hada Francis

texts.es: Hada Francis M. tiene 45 años. Es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por que tenia la necesidad de mejorar los ingresos de su familia, ya que tiene una hija que adopto porque lamentablemente no podía tener hijos, ya si toma esta decisión de ofrecerle a esta niña todo el cariño y las satisfacer las necesidades necesarias. El motivo de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pinturas de unas, pinturas de labios, sombras, cremas entre otros productos. Su mayor sueño es seguir apoyando a su familia por medio de este trabajo.
texts.en:
Hada Francis M. is 45 years old. She is a strong-willed and responsible woman. She started her business selling cosmetics more than 4 years ago because she needed to improve her family’s income. Hada adopted a daughter because unfortunately she wasn’t able to have children. Since she made that decision, she needed to offer all the love and fulfill the basic needs that a child requires.

She has requested a loan to buy nail polish, lipsticks, eye shadows, crèmes, and other products. Her greatest dream is to continue supporting her family through her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For business improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Tuesendo Group

texts.en:
Ever since her husband died in a drowning accident, Finda has lived as a widow with seven children around the Chasenneh area, in the Foyah District of Lofa County. Her children range in age from 12 years old to 30 years old, and they generally have received 8th grade-level education.

For the past five years, she has been in the business of making pop, food, and soap. By doing so, she is able to provide for her children and to support them in school. She explains that her biggest challenge has been a lack of funding since she is rather successful at attracting customers with her reasonable/affordable prices. She dreams of operating a larger business in order to better support her kids.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., rice, sugar, oil, and flour)

loans.name: Yoysi

texts.es: La señora Yoysi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia de El Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Yoysi, se inicio con la venta de golosinas, hace 03 años atrás. Y con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 empezó con sus ventas de golosinas. También se dedica a la venta de comidas, ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son los docentes y alumnos, ya que se encuentra cerca de un Instituto y esto le favorece bastante en sus ventas.  Hoy en día se siente muy bien y tranquila, con el trabajo que realiza.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará golosinas como: chocolates sublimes, cañonazo; chupetines, chicles y caramelos en diferentes sabores y marcas; así satisfacer a sus clientes. Parte del dinero también invertirá, en la compra de insumos, para preparar sus alimentos.Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yoysi belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres en Accion” [“Women in Action”] in the district of San Jose de Sisa, Province of El Dorado, Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 36 years old, and is a mother of 3 children that still depend on her. Yoysi began selling sweets 3 years ago, and with her first loan of 300 PEN she was able to start this business. She also works selling food from her own house, where her principal clients are teachers and students, given that she is located near an institute which helps greatly in her sales. Currently she feels well and is very calm about the work that she carries out. With this loan of 1200 PEN she will purchase sweets, such as: Sublimes chocolates, Cañonazo candies, lollipops, gum, and different flavor and brand caramels, to be able to satisfy her clients needs. Part of the money will also be invested in the purchase of supplies to make her meals. She feels very satisfied with the work she carries out, and she thinks it is worth the sacrifice to be able to fulfill her dreams and goals that she has set for herself. In this same manner, she thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos institution for supporting her and the other women that hope to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase different types of candies.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 35 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children. Currently one of her children is in school.

Diana enjoys selling goods through her business. This is how she makes a living. She has been selling tubers and yams for ten years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of yams from the farmers. This saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices.

Diana would like to use the loan to buy yams in bulk so she can better meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her children in school and to expand her business to the desired level.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Activos De Santa Fe 1-3 Group

texts.en:
Alfred, 42, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator for his group, “Activos de Santa Fe” (Assets of Santa Fe), and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Alfred and his fellow borrowers from Activos de Santa Fe live in Batey Santa Fe (Holy Faith). Bateyes are small communities built up around the housing constructed by sugar companies for their workers. Bateyes are remote and difficult to access, lack potable water and any kind of reliable electricity, and have limited medical facilities, if any at all. Alfred is a single father of one son, 13, who lives with him in their home.

Despite the difficulties associated with living in a batey, Alfred remains optimistic for his future. With this loan, his third with Esperanza, Alfred plans to purchase more clothing and shoes to sell in his shop. He is also optimistic about his son’s future, saying that the loans have helped his son by giving him more time to study rather than having to work around the house.

Thank you for lending to Alfred and to the Activos de Santa Fe group!

loans.use: To purchase more clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Celestino

texts.en:
Celestino M. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, beans and onions. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and onions to sell. Celestino is 33 years old and is married to a a car driver. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and provide them with food.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
D. Batbayar is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Gobi-Altai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His two boys, ages nine and six, attend a local secondary school. Batbayar makes clothes in his town with the help of his wife. They make a variety of traditional Mongolian clothing items. He also operates a seasonal dairy and raw materials business to supplement his income. He sells dairy products during the winter when they are in high demand and he sells raw materials during the summer and fall months. Batbayar started his clothing business in 2004 and started selling dairy and raw materials in 2007. He has had success with both businesses and continues to build on his experience as a businessman. Batbayar is very hardworking man who has strong desire to accomplish his goals. For the future, he says, “All I want is to own my own workspace.” He is requesting a 1,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase dairy products to sell this winter. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es: Eufemia G. M. de 55 años de edad, reside en Guatajiagua ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas, las cuales le ayudan en el negocio, así mismo vive junto a dos nietos. Ella posee un negocio en el cual se dedica a elaborar jarrones, comales y otros productos más, elaborados a base de barro o losa, estos son productos muy típicos de la cultura salvadoreña los cuales se utilizan para la cocina. Eufemia posee muy buena clientela y cuenta con lugares en diferentes departamento del país en los cuales vende sus productos al por mayor. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de su trabajo, materia como barro, losa y leña, esta última la utiliza para cocer el barro. Ella espera poder aumentar su capital de trabajo para poder comprar más material y de esta manera poder aceptar más trabajo ya que hasta ahora esto le ha sido difícil porque no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Eufemia Gonzalez Martinez is 55 years old and shel ives in Guatajiagua located in Morazan. She lives together with her husband and their two daughters, both of whom help her run the business, and two grandchildren. She sells ceramic jugs, grills and other ceramic and clay products, very typical in the Salvadoran culture. Eufemia enjoys a good client base and she sells to different regions of the country on a wholesale basis. She is requesting a loan to purchase more materials for her business, such as clay, ceramic and wood for firing. She hopes to improve the working capital to purchase more material. She will be able to accept larger orders, something she has had trouble with because she didn't have the funds to be able to fill the orders.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clay and other materials.

loans.name: Imad El Dine

texts.en: Imad El Dine is a 21-year-old single man, living with his parents. He has owned a barber shop since 2007. He cooperates with his father to support the household. The young man caters to a wide range of clientele in their village and neighboring villages. Today, Imad El Dine wishes to improve the decor of his barbershop and buy more tools. In order to do so, Imad El Dine is requesting $1,200.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his barbershop and buy more tools

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica, age 38, is a rice grower. She is married to Geronimo, and they have four children. They both want their kids to have a proper education, and they work hard to achieve this. Palm trees, which produce palm oil, are planted on some parts of their land. This serves as another source of income for Angelica's family.

Angelica currently needs additional income for her farming business. She applied for a loan of 6000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy necessary farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizer, which she needs for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores M.'s main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. Dolores has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Dolores joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities.
