Having successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI, Dolores is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Patricidra's Group

texts.en:
Patricidra S. is from the village of Rizal, and is the leader of a 12-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Patricidra S..
Patricidra is 57 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetic products in the local community. Patricidra has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Patricidra joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Patricidra is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia trabaja como empleada domestica por las mañanas y  por las tardes se dedica a la venta de víveres (arroz, azúcar, harina, etc.) que los coloca a crédito para cobrar diariamente, semanalmente, o al mes.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de sopocachi bajo de la ciudad de la Paz 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo, aceite).
Es cliente antiguo Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en  el pago se sus cuotas, demostrando responsabilidad ya que  con este crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Celia works as a domestic employee in the mornings and sells groceries (rice, sugar, flour, etc.) in the afternoons; she sells on credit and collects either daily, weekly or monthly. Her home is in the Sopocachi Bajo area of La Paz. She will use the funds to buy stock items (sugar, rice, pasta, cooking oil). She is a long-standing Impro client. Her credit history classifies her as a good client having demonstrated responsibility; this loan will help her improve her income and living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, pasta, cooking oil at wholesale to resell to her customers on credit.

loans.name: Badmaarag

texts.en:
Badmaarag is 24 years old and lives with her two children, parents and siblings in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her parents produce shoes and sell them to their customers, and they help a lot with their daughter's business as well.

Currently, Badmaarag operates a tailoring business in her town. She started her business in 2004, and has started to rent a counter with her family at a local trading center called a Ar-Hatan-Trade. Her business is supported by the entire family and they have built a stable operation.

Over the years, Badmaarag has steadily expanded her business and gained much experience as a businesswoman. Today, her monthly revenue exceeds 600,000 - 800,000 tugrugs (approximately 440 - 575 USD). She and her family equally share all the profits that they gain from their businesses.

Badmaarag is a very open-minded person who has many plans for the future. She says, “I would like to grow my business to a stable operation, and to keep contributing to my family’s finances.” She is requesting a 240,000 tugrug loan to purchase more fabric and materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora C. is from the town of D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married and has 1 adult-aged child. Leonora owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing new clothing and accepting dresses to sew in her community. Leonora has been involved in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Leonora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Leonora is requesting a new loan, her third, of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosario Araceli

texts.es: La Srta. Rosario tiene su tienda en la zona de Pampahasi, y vive en la misma zona, ella es muy joven pero le gusta trabajar y poder cubrir sus gastos sola, aunque vive con sus padres; está estudiando por las noches y en el día atiende la tienda. El crédito será invertido en la compra de un turril de aceite, garrafas y abarrotes ya que tiene demanda de estos productos, y espera hacer crecer su tienda para luego convertirse en un almacen. Uno de los deseos de la Srta. Rosario es terminar sus estudios y comprarse una casita para poder dar en alquiler y asi tener mas ingresos para ayudar a sus padres ya que ahora con el negocio de su tienda sola mantiene el hogar, trabaja todo el dia dia y aveces esta muy cansada para ir a sus clases en la universidad, es duro para ella pero sigue adelante, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Rosario has a store in the area of Pampahasi and lives in the same area. She is very young, but she likes to work and can cover her expenses alone, even though she lives with her parents. She studies at night and works in the store during the day. The loan will be used to buy a container of oil, containers, and groceries since she has demand for these products and hopes to grow her store to later convert it into a full grocery store. One of Rosario's dreams is to finish her studies and buy a house so she can rent it out and thus have more income to help her parents as with the business from her store she only maintains the home. She works all day and sometimes is very tired when going to classes at the college. It is hard, but she continues on. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown by the giving of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun C., 37, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She produces cow ties and raises animals for an income of about USD 2 per day.

Her husband is a tuk-tuk driver, earning an income of USD 6.6 per day to help cover the family expenses.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
El señor Franklin vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Franklin es chofer de radio taxi, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
Su vivienda no fue terminada por lo que le falta el acabado en interiores, el crédito solicitado es para la construcción y refacción de pisos y cielo falso para mejorar la calidad de su vivienda.
Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Franklin lives in his own house in the Alto Irpavi area of the city of La Paz. Franklin is a radio taxi driver. He supports himself with this income. His house was not finished; it lacks the finishings on the inside. The requested loan is for the construction and refurbishment of the floors and dropped ceiling. This will improve the quality of his house. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva L. is from the village of lalawan Dicayas. She is 31 years old. Eva is single, has one school-aged and one infant child. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Eva has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eva joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Eva is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for additional capital for her electronics for television sets. This loan will be the second taken out by Eva from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital for her electronics for television sets

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram M. is running a small café business in a market area. Aram’s wife is an experienced cook, preparing delicious meals for the clients. The couple’s daughter also works in the café, serving the clients. The café has a delivery service, which is quite in demand. 

However, their current ovens are old and not for restaurant business, causing a delay in the food production. To keep up with the demand, Aram requires a new fridge to hygienically store the raw products, a modern high-productivity oven and a fryer to produce pizza, lahmajo (flatbread baked with meat), hot dogs and other meals and snacks. This will increase the family business drastically and keep the clientele happy.

loans.use: New fridge, high-productivity oven and fryer

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena C. is 42 years old, married and has five school-aged children. She is from the village of Mozzozzin Norte on the island of Luzon. Nena manufactures and sells clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been in business for over 24 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nena joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Nena is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase more materials. She plans to use all additional revenue to pay her children’s tuition fees.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Bisensiha

texts.en: Bisensiha J. sells cooking oil, tomatoes, sweet potatoes and onions. She is requesting a loan to stock both fresh and dried fish to sell. Bisensiha is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a store and stock food items to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of fresh and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sticks

loans.name: Blue Arrow Group-Jinja

texts.en:
To illustrate his success in his business, 35-year-old K. Moses of Blue Arrow Group in Jinja, Uganda, feels he needs to emphasize his hard work over the course of the last seven years in his tender contract service work. His work revolves mostly around the collection of revenue from restaurant owners and taxi operators.

The hardworking Moses says he was formerly employed at a local factory. This, he says, gave him some firsthand experience on how to run a business. The happily married father of two says he makes 54,000 UGX in weekly profits. Moses says that he does not waste the money he earns but uses it for his family especially in times of necessity such as for school fees. With this loan he will pay off his debts to the local council administration. He is grateful that he is a part of his group.

loans.use: To cancel debts to the local council administration

loans.name: Tuyana

texts.en:
Tuyana is single. She runs a small enterprise selling women’s clothing, bijouterie, scarves, socks, leggings, etc. in the central market. She has been in this trade for 16 years and has gained much experience working in this sphere of business

Tuyana is seeking a loan of 2,500 Grivnyas to increase her working capital. She is hoping to use additional funding to grow and expand her trade and, as a result, her income. Tuyana is an entrepreneur of integrity. Her professional management skills and friendly customer service have ensured her business a stable standing in this market niche.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Aires

texts.en: Aires P. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Liloan, Santander, Cebu. She earns her living running a general store and food vending business. Her husband, Rolden P., age 34, works as a driver. They have two children who are 6 and 10 years old. Aires joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Aires has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future to send her children to school. Aires P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago, de 48 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa María de 44 años y de sus 3 jóvenes hijos que estudian, juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 10 años, este emprendedor hombre se dedica al comercio de diversas confecciones de ropa, y dice que las ganancias son regulares pues compra en la capital su mercadería a precios bajos y las transporta hasta diversas provincias. En los diversos lugares donde va vende a mayor precio las confecciones y esta muy satisfecho, pues de a pocos ha ido adquiriendo clientela, quienes saben de la calidad de las confecciones que Santiago ofrece. Manifiesta además que le gusta mucho su negocio pues los viajes le permiten distraerse, y aunque trabaja solo, tiene deseos de poder transportar mayor cantidad de mercadería y ampliar las fronteras de su negocio, para ello tiene pensado contratar a un ayudante. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Santiago tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en diversas confecciones porque ya quiere empezar ampliar el negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Santiago is 48 years old.  He lives in his own home with his 44 year-old wife María and his three young children who are all in school.  They work hard every day to get ahead in life.  For 10 years this entrepreneur has been working buying and selling different clothing fashions.  He says that the income is steady since he buys his goods in the capital for a low price then transports them to different provinces.  In the different places he travels to, he sells the garments at a higher price and he is very satisfied because he has been acquiring a customer base which is aware of the quality of the fashions which he offers.  He says that he likes his business a lot because he enjoys the trips he makes.  Although he works alone, he would like to be able to carry more goods and expand his business.  For this reason, he would like to hire an assistant.

This will be the second loan Santiago has had from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner because he doesn't want to give a bad impression to the people who, through funding his loan, will help him to continue working in search of progress.  Santiago plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a larger quantity of garments because he wants to begin to expand his business and improve his income.

loans.use: Purchase of more garments in different fashions.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La Señora María  se dedica desde hace tres años al comercio de huevos, actividad que  desarrolla en el mercado de la zona y en su domicilio, vende con la ayuda de sus hijas, quienes colaboran con ella en sus tiempos libres,  solicito el crédito ya que por la época de todos santos el producto es escaso y la señora tiene que estocar para dichas fechas ya que mucha gente compra estos productos para la elaboración de pan, galletas y masitas variadas , es la segunda oportunidad que solicita crédito en la institución en la cual demostró responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. María has been selling eggs for three years. She sells her product at the local market and from her home. Her daughters help generate sales during their free time. María is requesting a loan in time for All Saints Day because eggs are scarce during this occasion. She has to acquire inventory during this time because many people buy eggs for making bread, cookies, and various desserts.

This is the second time she has requested a loan from Emprender and she has demonstrated responsibility with her payments. María is grateful for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more eggs

loans.name: C2379 Izere Group

texts.en:
The Izere Group is made up of six members. Their leader is Claudine. This is the Izere Group's first loan from Vision Finance Company. They will use it to purchase more products for their market stalls.

Claudine is the leader of the group. She is 28 years old and married. She has 5 children between the ages of 1 and 9. Claudine owns a market store in the Rwamagana District of Rwanda. The store is open from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day. Claudine has three years of experience in this business. She has two employees and her store is well-organized, packed with things, and known in her area. 

With this Izere Group loan, Claudine will purchase more food products. With the profits from her business Claudine hopes to pay for school fees, renovate her house, and provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more food for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase oil, potatoes and other perishable products to prepare food.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a barber from the village of Roujeb, next to Nablus city. He started this work five years ago after he completed the necessary training courses. Muhammad's shop is one of the oldest in the village where he lives. Muhammad came to FATEN and took out a loan to improve the shop by painting the walls and purchasing needed tools and chairs for the shop.

Muhammad appears in the picture here cutting one of his customer's hair.

loans.use: To paint the shop and purchase tools and chairs

loans.name: Audrey

texts.en:
Audrey is a married  of 36 years old and a mother of four children. Her husband's income adds to the family income. She operates a mobile phone and accessories shop in Buruburu estate which is a middle class estate. This is her primary business which she has been doing for the last two years.
 
With this loan, she plans to add more stock of the phones and their accessories so that she can increase her capital base.

She hopes to expand and grow her business so as to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy Mobile phones and phone accessories for sale.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is a rice farmer from the town of Banga. She is married to a farmer and they have 2 young children. Lani and her husband work their hardest to keep the farm productive. Also, Lani does not forget her responsibilities to their children. She makes sure they have food to eat and are given proper education. Lani wishes for her children to be successful someday. She says that for now, all she can do is be the best mother she ca.

Lani joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lani has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lani is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 30-year old married woman who supports her family by operating both a fish vending and a fishing businesses.  She lives in Madridejos, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending and a fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 25000. 

Milagros is borrowing PHP 29500 so that she could continue to fund the operations of her fish vending business.   This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 28000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Milagros aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.	"

loans.use: Fund the operations of her fish vending business.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a poultry business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and local hotel operators. Beauty faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during times of disease outbreak. She hopes to expand her business and establish another poultry farm in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Goghi's Group

texts.en:
Goghi is only 38 years of age. She got divorced a few years ago and operates a jewelry making and selling business. After her divorce, she settled in her brother’s home and started her business because she didn’t want to become a burden on him. She is very skillful in her work and gets regular orders from different jewelers in the city. 

Goghi lives in Sahiwal which is famous for its cow species and agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her brother and his family. She has a five-year-old son who also lives with her and has not started his education yet. Besides her business, Goghi also takes care of household responsibilities and her son. 

Goghi has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her jewelry business. With the loan, she will buy materials such as beads, wires and glue for making jewelry in bulk quantity. This will help her offer more variety to her clients and make more profits. Goghi started her business 12 years ago and it is working very well for her. She won't leave this work and her marriage as well. She offers her jewelry at cheaper rates – that’s why she has a good number of clients. 

Goghi is hopeful that a loan investment will help her make larger profits and she will be able to start saving some money every month for her son’s education. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has responsibly made her payments and never gave any chance of complaints.

loans.use: To buy material for a jewelry making and selling business

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Dy O. is 40 years old and resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. O. is employed at the garment factory, earning an income of $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $50 on other necessary expenses. O. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina lives in Mian channu, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for past 17 years with her family in a 2-room brick house. She is 40 years old and married to S. M. who operates a livestock business. He has a cow and a buffalo. He collects the milk by getting up early in the morning everyday and he sells to his community members. He also sells cattle (goats), by raising them as the customers require. 

Robina is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She takes her responsibilities very seriously and makes the utmost effort to give comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. In her spare time, she also assists her husband by taking care of his cattle. 

Robina is the mother of a 7 year old daughter who is studying in class 3rd. She also has a 6 year old son who is studying in class 2nd. Robina couldn’t get an education herself due to the poor financial circumstances of her parents. But, she wants to provide a quality education for her children so that they become successful in their lives. 

Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will buy cattle (goats) for selling at a profit. He has been doing this business for the past 12 years. Robina hopes that, after the loan investment, her husband’s business will be in a more profitable position and it will result in a better financial condition for her family.

loans.use: To buy cattle (goats) for selling.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Jineen. He owns land in Yabad village in Jenin district. Muhammad is married and his wife helps him work their land. They grow seasonal fruits and vegetables and sell them to the vegetable stores in Jenin.

Muhammad who is photographed here took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a car and use it to distribute the crops over the stores he deals with. The car will help Muhammad reach more stores and have more clients which will increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase a car to transport his crops.

loans.name: Linda

texts.es: Linda E. González, tiene 39 años y se dedica a vender tacos al pastor y hamburguesas, empezó con su negocio hace aproximadamente 13 años, ella pidió su préstamo para comprar otro horno y una parrilla porque quiere poner otro negocio en su casa. Comenta que empezó con el negocio por que le gusta cocinar, dice que le está echando ganas a su trabajo porque quiere comprarles a sus hijos una computadora ya que en la escuela les dejan bastante tarea. La señora Linda es casada con el señor Rafael desde hace 17 años el se dedica a ayudarle a su esposa en el negocio de comida, ellos tienen 3 hijos, Gabriel de 16 años el estudia la preparatoria y sueña con ser ingeniero en sistemas, luego sigue Natali de 12 años, que estudia la secundaria, ella quiere estudiar para profesora y el pequeño de los tres Alfonso de 6 años el estudia la  primaria.
texts.en:
Linda E. González, 39, sells “tacos al pastor” (made from meat that has been marinated and then cooked in a rotisserie with pineapple on top), and hamburgers.  She started her business about 13 years ago.  She requested a loan to buy another oven and a grill because she wants to open another business at home.  She comments that she started the business because she likes to cook.  She says she’s putting a lot into it because she wants to buy her children a computer because they get quite a bit of homework at school.

Linda has been married to Rafael for 17 years and he helps his wife with the food business.  They have three children.  Gabriel, 16, goes to high school and dreams with becoming a Systems Engineer.  Next comes Natalí, 12, who is in middle school; she wants to become a Teacher.  The youngest of the three is Alfonso, 6, who is in elementary school.

loans.use: to buy an oven and a grill.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from carinderia (local eatery) and ready-to-wear (RTW).

Mary Ann aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El tiene 35 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ganadería y agricultura, el vende ganados y también tiene una tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y habas y también el socio se dedica a la formulación de proyectos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de ganadería y agricultura. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas para las tierras de cultivo. 
                                                      
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Liderando Las Palmeras" community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

The borrower is 35 years old, single, and has one child.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business raising livestock and farming.  He sells livestock and owns farmland on which he grows corn, potatoes and beans.  He also works drawing up projects.  The borrower would like to expand his livestock raising and farming business.  He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for his land.

The borrower is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his land
